verses.name: Psalms 1:1
verses.text: Blessed is the man that walketh not in the counsel of the ungodly, nor standeth in the way of sinners, nor sitteth in the seat of the scornful.

verses.name: Psalms 1:2
verses.text: But his delight is in the law of the Lord; and in his law doth he meditate day and night.

verses.name: Psalms 1:3
verses.text: And he shall be like a tree planted by the rivers of water, that bringeth forth his fruit in his season; his leaf also shall not wither; and whatsoever he doeth shall prosper.

verses.name: Psalms 1:4
verses.text: The ungodly are not so: but are like the chaff which the wind driveth away.

verses.name: Psalms 1:5
verses.text: Therefore the ungodly shall not stand in the judgment, nor sinners in the congregation of the righteous.

verses.name: Psalms 1:6
verses.text: For the Lord knoweth the way of the righteous: but the way of the ungodly shall perish.

verses.name: Psalms 2:1
verses.text: Why do the heathen rage, and the people imagine a vain thing?

verses.name: Psalms 2:2
verses.text: The kings of the earth set themselves, and the rulers take counsel together, against the Lord, and against his anointed, saying,

verses.name: Psalms 2:3
verses.text: Let us break their bands asunder, and cast away their cords from us.

verses.name: Psalms 2:4
verses.text: He that sitteth in the heavens shall laugh: the Lord shall have them in derision.

verses.name: Psalms 2:5
verses.text: Then shall he speak unto them in his wrath, and vex them in his sore displeasure.

verses.name: Psalms 2:6
verses.text: Yet have I set my king upon my holy hill of Zion.

verses.name: Psalms 2:7
verses.text: I will declare the decree: the Lord hath said unto me, Thou art my Son; this day have I begotten thee.

verses.name: Psalms 2:8
verses.text: Ask of me, and I shall give thee the heathen for thine inheritance, and the uttermost parts of the earth for thy possession.

verses.name: Psalms 2:9
verses.text: Thou shalt break them with a rod of iron; thou shalt dash them in pieces like a potter’s vessel.

verses.name: Psalms 2:10
verses.text: Be wise now therefore, O ye kings: be instructed, ye judges of the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 2:11
verses.text: Serve the Lord with fear, and rejoice with trembling.

verses.name: Psalms 2:12
verses.text: Kiss the Son, lest he be angry, and ye perish from the way, when his wrath is kindled but a little. Blessed are all they that put their trust in him.

verses.name: Psalms 3:1
verses.text: Lord, how are they increased that trouble me! many are they that rise up against me.

verses.name: Psalms 3:2
verses.text: Many there be which say of my soul, There is no help for him in God. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 3:3
verses.text: But thou, O Lord, art a shield for me; my glory, and the lifter up of mine head.

verses.name: Psalms 3:4
verses.text: I cried unto the Lord with my voice, and he heard me out of his holy hill. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 3:5
verses.text: I laid me down and slept; I awaked; for the Lord sustained me.

verses.name: Psalms 3:6
verses.text: I will not be afraid of ten thousands of people, that have set themselves against me round about.

verses.name: Psalms 3:7
verses.text: Arise, O Lord; save me, O my God: for thou hast smitten all mine enemies upon the cheek bone; thou hast broken the teeth of the ungodly.

verses.name: Psalms 3:8
verses.text: Salvation belongeth unto the Lord: thy blessing is upon thy people. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 4:1
verses.text: Hear me when I call, O God of my righteousness: thou hast enlarged me when I was in distress; have mercy upon me, and hear my prayer.

verses.name: Psalms 4:2
verses.text: O ye sons of men, how long will ye turn my glory into shame? how long will ye love vanity, and seek after leasing? Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 4:3
verses.text: But know that the Lord hath set apart him that is godly for himself: the Lord will hear when I call unto him.

verses.name: Psalms 4:4
verses.text: Stand in awe, and sin not: commune with your own heart upon your bed, and be still. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 4:5
verses.text: Offer the sacrifices of righteousness, and put your trust in the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 4:6
verses.text: There be many that say, Who will shew us any good? Lord, lift thou up the light of thy countenance upon us.

verses.name: Psalms 4:7
verses.text: Thou hast put gladness in my heart, more than in the time that their corn and their wine increased.

verses.name: Psalms 4:8
verses.text: I will both lay me down in peace, and sleep: for thou, Lord, only makest me dwell in safety.

verses.name: Psalms 5:1
verses.text: Give ear to my words, O Lord, consider my meditation.

verses.name: Psalms 5:2
verses.text: Hearken unto the voice of my cry, my King, and my God: for unto thee will I pray.

verses.name: Psalms 5:3
verses.text: My voice shalt thou hear in the morning, O Lord; in the morning will I direct my prayer unto thee, and will look up.

verses.name: Psalms 5:4
verses.text: For thou art not a God that hath pleasure in wickedness: neither shall evil dwell with thee.

verses.name: Psalms 5:5
verses.text: The foolish shall not stand in thy sight: thou hatest all workers of iniquity.

verses.name: Psalms 5:6
verses.text: Thou shalt destroy them that speak leasing: the Lord will abhor the bloody and deceitful man.

verses.name: Psalms 5:7
verses.text: But as for me, I will come into thy house in the multitude of thy mercy: and in thy fear will I worship toward thy holy temple.

verses.name: Psalms 5:8
verses.text: Lead me, O Lord, in thy righteousness because of mine enemies; make thy way straight before my face.

verses.name: Psalms 5:9
verses.text: For there is no faithfulness in their mouth; their inward part is very wickedness; their throat is an open sepulchre; they flatter with their tongue.

verses.name: Psalms 5:10
verses.text: Destroy thou them, O God; let them fall by their own counsels; cast them out in the multitude of their transgressions; for they have rebelled against thee.

verses.name: Psalms 5:11
verses.text: But let all those that put their trust in thee rejoice: let them ever shout for joy, because thou defendest them: let them also that love thy name be joyful in thee.

verses.name: Psalms 5:12
verses.text: For thou, Lord, wilt bless the righteous; with favour wilt thou compass him as with a shield.

verses.name: Psalms 6:1
verses.text: O Lord, rebuke me not in thine anger, neither chasten me in thy hot displeasure.

verses.name: Psalms 6:2
verses.text: Have mercy upon me, O Lord; for I am weak: O Lord, heal me; for my bones are vexed.

verses.name: Psalms 6:3
verses.text: My soul is also sore vexed: but thou, O Lord, how long?

verses.name: Psalms 6:4
verses.text: Return, O Lord, deliver my soul: oh save me for thy mercies’ sake.

verses.name: Psalms 6:5
verses.text: For in death there is no remembrance of thee: in the grave who shall give thee thanks?

verses.name: Psalms 6:6
verses.text: I am weary with my groaning; all the night make I my bed to swim; I water my couch with my tears.

verses.name: Psalms 6:7
verses.text: Mine eye is consumed because of grief; it waxeth old because of all mine enemies.

verses.name: Psalms 6:8
verses.text: Depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity; for the Lord hath heard the voice of my weeping.

verses.name: Psalms 6:9
verses.text: The Lord hath heard my supplication; the Lord will receive my prayer.

verses.name: Psalms 6:10
verses.text: Let all mine enemies be ashamed and sore vexed: let them return and be ashamed suddenly.

verses.name: Psalms 7:1
verses.text: O Lord my God, in thee do I put my trust: save me from all them that persecute me, and deliver me:

verses.name: Psalms 7:2
verses.text: Lest he tear my soul like a lion, rending it in pieces, while there is none to deliver.

verses.name: Psalms 7:3
verses.text: O Lord my God, if I have done this; if there be iniquity in my hands;

verses.name: Psalms 7:4
verses.text: If I have rewarded evil unto him that was at peace with me; (yea, I have delivered him that without cause is mine enemy:)

verses.name: Psalms 7:5
verses.text: Let the enemy persecute my soul, and take it; yea, let him tread down my life upon the earth, and lay mine honour in the dust. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 7:6
verses.text: Arise, O Lord, in thine anger, lift up thyself because of the rage of mine enemies: and awake for me to the judgment that thou hast commanded.

verses.name: Psalms 7:7
verses.text: So shall the congregation of the people compass thee about: for their sakes therefore return thou on high.

verses.name: Psalms 7:8
verses.text: The Lord shall judge the people: judge me, O Lord, according to my righteousness, and according to mine integrity that is in me.

verses.name: Psalms 7:9
verses.text: Oh let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end; but establish the just: for the righteous God trieth the hearts and reins.

verses.name: Psalms 7:10
verses.text: My defence is of God, which saveth the upright in heart.

verses.name: Psalms 7:11
verses.text: God judgeth the righteous, and God is angry with the wicked every day.

verses.name: Psalms 7:12
verses.text: If he turn not, he will whet his sword; he hath bent his bow, and made it ready.

verses.name: Psalms 7:13
verses.text: He hath also prepared for him the instruments of death; he ordaineth his arrows against the persecutors.

verses.name: Psalms 7:14
verses.text: Behold, he travaileth with iniquity, and hath conceived mischief, and brought forth falsehood.

verses.name: Psalms 7:15
verses.text: He made a pit, and digged it, and is fallen into the ditch which he made.

verses.name: Psalms 7:16
verses.text: His mischief shall return upon his own head, and his violent dealing shall come down upon his own pate.

verses.name: Psalms 7:17
verses.text: I will praise the Lord according to his righteousness: and will sing praise to the name of the Lord most high.

verses.name: Psalms 8:1
verses.text: O Lord our Lord, how excellent is thy name in all the earth! who hast set thy glory above the heavens.

verses.name: Psalms 8:2
verses.text: Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings hast thou ordained strength because of thine enemies, that thou mightest still the enemy and the avenger.

verses.name: Psalms 8:3
verses.text: When I consider thy heavens, the work of thy fingers, the moon and the stars, which thou hast ordained;

verses.name: Psalms 8:4
verses.text: What is man, that thou art mindful of him? and the son of man, that thou visitest him?

verses.name: Psalms 8:5
verses.text: For thou hast made him a little lower than the angels, and hast crowned him with glory and honour.

verses.name: Psalms 8:6
verses.text: Thou madest him to have dominion over the works of thy hands; thou hast put all things under his feet:

verses.name: Psalms 8:7
verses.text: All sheep and oxen, yea, and the beasts of the field;

verses.name: Psalms 8:8
verses.text: The fowl of the air, and the fish of the sea, and whatsoever passeth through the paths of the seas.

verses.name: Psalms 8:9
verses.text: O Lord our Lord, how excellent is thy name in all the earth!

verses.name: Psalms 9:1
verses.text: I will praise thee, O Lord, with my whole heart; I will shew forth all thy marvellous works.

verses.name: Psalms 9:2
verses.text: I will be glad and rejoice in thee: I will sing praise to thy name, O thou most High.

verses.name: Psalms 9:3
verses.text: When mine enemies are turned back, they shall fall and perish at thy presence.

verses.name: Psalms 9:4
verses.text: For thou hast maintained my right and my cause; thou satest in the throne judging right.

verses.name: Psalms 9:5
verses.text: Thou hast rebuked the heathen, thou hast destroyed the wicked, thou hast put out their name for ever and ever.

verses.name: Psalms 9:6
verses.text: O thou enemy, destructions are come to a perpetual end: and thou hast destroyed cities; their memorial is perished with them.

verses.name: Psalms 9:7
verses.text: But the Lord shall endure for ever: he hath prepared his throne for judgment.

verses.name: Psalms 9:8
verses.text: And he shall judge the world in righteousness, he shall minister judgment to the people in uprightness.

verses.name: Psalms 9:9
verses.text: The Lord also will be a refuge for the oppressed, a refuge in times of trouble.

verses.name: Psalms 9:10
verses.text: And they that know thy name will put their trust in thee: for thou, Lord, hast not forsaken them that seek thee.

verses.name: Psalms 9:11
verses.text: Sing praises to the Lord, which dwelleth in Zion: declare among the people his doings.

verses.name: Psalms 9:12
verses.text: When he maketh inquisition for blood, he remembereth them: he forgetteth not the cry of the humble.

verses.name: Psalms 9:13
verses.text: Have mercy upon me, O Lord; consider my trouble which I suffer of them that hate me, thou that liftest me up from the gates of death:

verses.name: Psalms 9:14
verses.text: That I may shew forth all thy praise in the gates of the daughter of Zion: I will rejoice in thy salvation.

verses.name: Psalms 9:15
verses.text: The heathen are sunk down in the pit that they made: in the net which they hid is their own foot taken.

verses.name: Psalms 9:16
verses.text: The Lord is known by the judgment which he executeth: the wicked is snared in the work of his own hands. Higgaion. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 9:17
verses.text: The wicked shall be turned into hell, and all the nations that forget God.

verses.name: Psalms 9:18
verses.text: For the needy shall not alway be forgotten: the expectation of the poor shall not perish for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 9:19
verses.text: Arise, O Lord; let not man prevail: let the heathen be judged in thy sight.

verses.name: Psalms 9:20
verses.text: Put them in fear, O Lord: that the nations may know themselves to be but men. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 10:1
verses.text: Why standest thou afar off, O Lord? why hidest thou thyself in times of trouble?

verses.name: Psalms 10:2
verses.text: The wicked in his pride doth persecute the poor: let them be taken in the devices that they have imagined.

verses.name: Psalms 10:3
verses.text: For the wicked boasteth of his heart’s desire, and blesseth the covetous, whom the Lord abhorreth.

verses.name: Psalms 10:4
verses.text: The wicked, through the pride of his countenance, will not seek after God: God is not in all his thoughts.

verses.name: Psalms 10:5
verses.text: His ways are always grievous; thy judgments are far above out of his sight: as for all his enemies, he puffeth at them.

verses.name: Psalms 10:6
verses.text: He hath said in his heart, I shall not be moved: for I shall never be in adversity.

verses.name: Psalms 10:7
verses.text: His mouth is full of cursing and deceit and fraud: under his tongue is mischief and vanity.

verses.name: Psalms 10:8
verses.text: He sitteth in the lurking places of the villages: in the secret places doth he murder the innocent: his eyes are privily set against the poor.

verses.name: Psalms 10:9
verses.text: He lieth in wait secretly as a lion in his den: he lieth in wait to catch the poor: he doth catch the poor, when he draweth him into his net.

verses.name: Psalms 10:10
verses.text: He croucheth, and humbleth himself, that the poor may fall by his strong ones.

verses.name: Psalms 10:11
verses.text: He hath said in his heart, God hath forgotten: he hideth his face; he will never see it.

verses.name: Psalms 10:12
verses.text: Arise, O Lord; O God, lift up thine hand: forget not the humble.

verses.name: Psalms 10:13
verses.text: Wherefore doth the wicked contemn God? he hath said in his heart, Thou wilt not require it.

verses.name: Psalms 10:14
verses.text: Thou hast seen it; for thou beholdest mischief and spite, to requite it with thy hand: the poor committeth himself unto thee; thou art the helper of the fatherless.

verses.name: Psalms 10:15
verses.text: Break thou the arm of the wicked and the evil man: seek out his wickedness till thou find none.

verses.name: Psalms 10:16
verses.text: The Lord is King for ever and ever: the heathen are perished out of his land.

verses.name: Psalms 10:17
verses.text: Lord, thou hast heard the desire of the humble: thou wilt prepare their heart, thou wilt cause thine ear to hear:

verses.name: Psalms 10:18
verses.text: To judge the fatherless and the oppressed, that the man of the earth may no more oppress.

verses.name: Psalms 11:1
verses.text: In the Lord put I my trust: how say ye to my soul, Flee as a bird to your mountain?

verses.name: Psalms 11:2
verses.text: For, lo, the wicked bend their bow, they make ready their arrow upon the string, that they may privily shoot at the upright in heart.

verses.name: Psalms 11:3
verses.text: If the foundations be destroyed, what can the righteous do?

verses.name: Psalms 11:4
verses.text: The Lord is in his holy temple, the Lord’s throne is in heaven: his eyes behold, his eyelids try, the children of men.

verses.name: Psalms 11:5
verses.text: The Lord trieth the righteous: but the wicked and him that loveth violence his soul hateth.

verses.name: Psalms 11:6
verses.text: Upon the wicked he shall rain snares, fire and brimstone, and an horrible tempest: this shall be the portion of their cup.

verses.name: Psalms 11:7
verses.text: For the righteous Lord loveth righteousness; his countenance doth behold the upright.

verses.name: Psalms 12:1
verses.text: Help, Lord; for the godly man ceaseth; for the faithful fail from among the children of men.

verses.name: Psalms 12:2
verses.text: They speak vanity every one with his neighbour: with flattering lips and with a double heart do they speak.

verses.name: Psalms 12:3
verses.text: The Lord shall cut off all flattering lips, and the tongue that speaketh proud things:

verses.name: Psalms 12:4
verses.text: Who have said, With our tongue will we prevail; our lips are our own: who is lord over us?

verses.name: Psalms 12:5
verses.text: For the oppression of the poor, for the sighing of the needy, now will I arise, saith the Lord; I will set him in safety from him that puffeth at him.

verses.name: Psalms 12:6
verses.text: The words of the Lord are pure words: as silver tried in a furnace of earth, purified seven times.

verses.name: Psalms 12:7
verses.text: Thou shalt keep them, O Lord, thou shalt preserve them from this generation for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 12:8
verses.text: The wicked walk on every side, when the vilest men are exalted.

verses.name: Psalms 13:1
verses.text: How long wilt thou forget me, O Lord? for ever? how long wilt thou hide thy face from me?

verses.name: Psalms 13:2
verses.text: How long shall I take counsel in my soul, having sorrow in my heart daily? how long shall mine enemy be exalted over me?

verses.name: Psalms 13:3
verses.text: Consider and hear me, O Lord my God: lighten mine eyes, lest I sleep the sleep of death;

verses.name: Psalms 13:4
verses.text: Lest mine enemy say, I have prevailed against him; and those that trouble me rejoice when I am moved.

verses.name: Psalms 13:5
verses.text: But I have trusted in thy mercy; my heart shall rejoice in thy salvation.

verses.name: Psalms 13:6
verses.text: I will sing unto the Lord, because he hath dealt bountifully with me.

verses.name: Psalms 14:1
verses.text: The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God. They are corrupt, they have done abominable works, there is none that doeth good.

verses.name: Psalms 14:2
verses.text: The Lord looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there were any that did understand, and seek God.

verses.name: Psalms 14:3
verses.text: They are all gone aside, they are all together become filthy: there is none that doeth good, no, not one.

verses.name: Psalms 14:4
verses.text: Have all the workers of iniquity no knowledge? who eat up my people as they eat bread, and call not upon the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 14:5
verses.text: There were they in great fear: for God is in the generation of the righteous.

verses.name: Psalms 14:6
verses.text: Ye have shamed the counsel of the poor, because the Lord is his refuge.

verses.name: Psalms 14:7
verses.text: Oh that the salvation of Israel were come out of Zion! when the Lord bringeth back the captivity of his people, Jacob shall rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.

verses.name: Psalms 15:1
verses.text: Lord, who shall abide in thy tabernacle? who shall dwell in thy holy hill?

verses.name: Psalms 15:2
verses.text: He that walketh uprightly, and worketh righteousness, and speaketh the truth in his heart.

verses.name: Psalms 15:3
verses.text: He that backbiteth not with his tongue, nor doeth evil to his neighbour, nor taketh up a reproach against his neighbour.

verses.name: Psalms 15:4
verses.text: In whose eyes a vile person is contemned; but he honoureth them that fear the Lord. He that sweareth to his own hurt, and changeth not.

verses.name: Psalms 15:5
verses.text: He that putteth not out his money to usury, nor taketh reward against the innocent. He that doeth these things shall never be moved.

verses.name: Psalms 16:1
verses.text: Preserve me, O God: for in thee do I put my trust.

verses.name: Psalms 16:2
verses.text: O my soul, thou hast said unto the Lord, Thou art my Lord: my goodness extendeth not to thee;

verses.name: Psalms 16:3
verses.text: But to the saints that are in the earth, and to the excellent, in whom is all my delight.

verses.name: Psalms 16:4
verses.text: Their sorrows shall be multiplied that hasten after another god: their drink offerings of blood will I not offer, nor take up their names into my lips.

verses.name: Psalms 16:5
verses.text: The Lord is the portion of mine inheritance and of my cup: thou maintainest my lot.

verses.name: Psalms 16:6
verses.text: The lines are fallen unto me in pleasant places; yea, I have a goodly heritage.

verses.name: Psalms 16:7
verses.text: I will bless the Lord, who hath given me counsel: my reins also instruct me in the night seasons.

verses.name: Psalms 16:8
verses.text: I have set the Lord always before me: because he is at my right hand, I shall not be moved.

verses.name: Psalms 16:9
verses.text: Therefore my heart is glad, and my glory rejoiceth: my flesh also shall rest in hope.

verses.name: Psalms 16:10
verses.text: For thou wilt not leave my soul in hell; neither wilt thou suffer thine Holy One to see corruption.

verses.name: Psalms 16:11
verses.text: Thou wilt shew me the path of life: in thy presence is fulness of joy; at thy right hand there are pleasures for evermore.

verses.name: Psalms 17:1
verses.text: Hear the right, O Lord, attend unto my cry, give ear unto my prayer, that goeth not out of feigned lips.

verses.name: Psalms 17:2
verses.text: Let my sentence come forth from thy presence; let thine eyes behold the things that are equal.

verses.name: Psalms 17:3
verses.text: Thou hast proved mine heart; thou hast visited me in the night; thou hast tried me, and shalt find nothing; I am purposed that my mouth shall not transgress.

verses.name: Psalms 17:4
verses.text: Concerning the works of men, by the word of thy lips I have kept me from the paths of the destroyer.

verses.name: Psalms 17:5
verses.text: Hold up my goings in thy paths, that my footsteps slip not.

verses.name: Psalms 17:6
verses.text: I have called upon thee, for thou wilt hear me, O God: incline thine ear unto me, and hear my speech.

verses.name: Psalms 17:7
verses.text: Shew thy marvellous lovingkindness, O thou that savest by thy right hand them which put their trust in thee from those that rise up against them.

verses.name: Psalms 17:8
verses.text: Keep me as the apple of the eye, hide me under the shadow of thy wings,

verses.name: Psalms 17:9
verses.text: From the wicked that oppress me, from my deadly enemies, who compass me about.

verses.name: Psalms 17:10
verses.text: They are inclosed in their own fat: with their mouth they speak proudly.

verses.name: Psalms 17:11
verses.text: They have now compassed us in our steps: they have set their eyes bowing down to the earth;

verses.name: Psalms 17:12
verses.text: Like as a lion that is greedy of his prey, and as it were a young lion lurking in secret places.

verses.name: Psalms 17:13
verses.text: Arise, O Lord, disappoint him, cast him down: deliver my soul from the wicked, which is thy sword:

verses.name: Psalms 17:14
verses.text: From men which are thy hand, O Lord, from men of the world, which have their portion in this life, and whose belly thou fillest with thy hid treasure: they are full of children, and leave the rest of their substance to their babes.

verses.name: Psalms 17:15
verses.text: As for me, I will behold thy face in righteousness: I shall be satisfied, when I awake, with thy likeness.

verses.name: Psalms 18:1
verses.text: I will love thee, O Lord, my strength.

verses.name: Psalms 18:2
verses.text: The Lord is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer; my God, my strength, in whom I will trust; my buckler, and the horn of my salvation, and my high tower.

verses.name: Psalms 18:3
verses.text: I will call upon the Lord, who is worthy to be praised: so shall I be saved from mine enemies.

verses.name: Psalms 18:4
verses.text: The sorrows of death compassed me, and the floods of ungodly men made me afraid.

verses.name: Psalms 18:5
verses.text: The sorrows of hell compassed me about: the snares of death prevented me.

verses.name: Psalms 18:6
verses.text: In my distress I called upon the Lord, and cried unto my God: he heard my voice out of his temple, and my cry came before him, even into his ears.

verses.name: Psalms 18:7
verses.text: Then the earth shook and trembled; the foundations also of the hills moved and were shaken, because he was wroth.

verses.name: Psalms 18:8
verses.text: There went up a smoke out of his nostrils, and fire out of his mouth devoured: coals were kindled by it.

verses.name: Psalms 18:9
verses.text: He bowed the heavens also, and came down: and darkness was under his feet.

verses.name: Psalms 18:10
verses.text: And he rode upon a cherub, and did fly: yea, he did fly upon the wings of the wind.

verses.name: Psalms 18:11
verses.text: He made darkness his secret place; his pavilion round about him were dark waters and thick clouds of the skies.

verses.name: Psalms 18:12
verses.text: At the brightness that was before him his thick clouds passed, hail stones and coals of fire.

verses.name: Psalms 18:13
verses.text: The Lord also thundered in the heavens, and the Highest gave his voice; hail stones and coals of fire.

verses.name: Psalms 18:14
verses.text: Yea, he sent out his arrows, and scattered them; and he shot out lightnings, and discomfited them.

verses.name: Psalms 18:15
verses.text: Then the channels of waters were seen, and the foundations of the world were discovered at thy rebuke, O Lord, at the blast of the breath of thy nostrils.

verses.name: Psalms 18:16
verses.text: He sent from above, he took me, he drew me out of many waters.

verses.name: Psalms 18:17
verses.text: He delivered me from my strong enemy, and from them which hated me: for they were too strong for me.

verses.name: Psalms 18:18
verses.text: They prevented me in the day of my calamity: but the Lord was my stay.

verses.name: Psalms 18:19
verses.text: He brought me forth also into a large place; he delivered me, because he delighted in me.

verses.name: Psalms 18:20
verses.text: The Lord rewarded me according to my righteousness; according to the cleanness of my hands hath he recompensed me.

verses.name: Psalms 18:21
verses.text: For I have kept the ways of the Lord, and have not wickedly departed from my God.

verses.name: Psalms 18:22
verses.text: For all his judgments were before me, and I did not put away his statutes from me.

verses.name: Psalms 18:23
verses.text: I was also upright before him, and I kept myself from mine iniquity.

verses.name: Psalms 18:24
verses.text: Therefore hath the Lord recompensed me according to my righteousness, according to the cleanness of my hands in his eyesight.

verses.name: Psalms 18:25
verses.text: With the merciful thou wilt shew thyself merciful; with an upright man thou wilt shew thyself upright;

verses.name: Psalms 18:26
verses.text: With the pure thou wilt shew thyself pure; and with the froward thou wilt shew thyself froward.

verses.name: Psalms 18:27
verses.text: For thou wilt save the afflicted people; but wilt bring down high looks.

verses.name: Psalms 18:28
verses.text: For thou wilt light my candle: the Lord my God will enlighten my darkness.

verses.name: Psalms 18:29
verses.text: For by thee I have run through a troop; and by my God have I leaped over a wall.

verses.name: Psalms 18:30
verses.text: As for God, his way is perfect: the word of the Lord is tried: he is a buckler to all those that trust in him.

verses.name: Psalms 18:31
verses.text: For who is God save the Lord? or who is a rock save our God?

verses.name: Psalms 18:32
verses.text: It is God that girdeth me with strength, and maketh my way perfect.

verses.name: Psalms 18:33
verses.text: He maketh my feet like hinds’ feet, and setteth me upon my high places.

verses.name: Psalms 18:34
verses.text: He teacheth my hands to war, so that a bow of steel is broken by mine arms.

verses.name: Psalms 18:35
verses.text: Thou hast also given me the shield of thy salvation: and thy right hand hath holden me up, and thy gentleness hath made me great.

verses.name: Psalms 18:36
verses.text: Thou hast enlarged my steps under me, that my feet did not slip.

verses.name: Psalms 18:37
verses.text: I have pursued mine enemies, and overtaken them: neither did I turn again till they were consumed.

verses.name: Psalms 18:38
verses.text: I have wounded them that they were not able to rise: they are fallen under my feet.

verses.name: Psalms 18:39
verses.text: For thou hast girded me with strength unto the battle: thou hast subdued under me those that rose up against me.

verses.name: Psalms 18:40
verses.text: Thou hast also given me the necks of mine enemies; that I might destroy them that hate me.

verses.name: Psalms 18:41
verses.text: They cried, but there was none to save them: even unto the Lord, but he answered them not.

verses.name: Psalms 18:42
verses.text: Then did I beat them small as the dust before the wind: I did cast them out as the dirt in the streets.

verses.name: Psalms 18:43
verses.text: Thou hast delivered me from the strivings of the people; and thou hast made me the head of the heathen: a people whom I have not known shall serve me.

verses.name: Psalms 18:44
verses.text: As soon as they hear of me, they shall obey me: the strangers shall submit themselves unto me.

verses.name: Psalms 18:45
verses.text: The strangers shall fade away, and be afraid out of their close places.

verses.name: Psalms 18:46
verses.text: The Lord liveth; and blessed be my rock; and let the God of my salvation be exalted.

verses.name: Psalms 18:47
verses.text: It is God that avengeth me, and subdueth the people under me.

verses.name: Psalms 18:48
verses.text: He delivereth me from mine enemies: yea, thou liftest me up above those that rise up against me: thou hast delivered me from the violent man.

verses.name: Psalms 18:49
verses.text: Therefore will I give thanks unto thee, O Lord, among the heathen, and sing praises unto thy name.

verses.name: Psalms 18:50
verses.text: Great deliverance giveth he to his king; and sheweth mercy to his anointed, to David, and to his seed for evermore.

verses.name: Psalms 19:1
verses.text: The heavens declare the glory of God; and the firmament sheweth his handywork.

verses.name: Psalms 19:2
verses.text: Day unto day uttereth speech, and night unto night sheweth knowledge.

verses.name: Psalms 19:3
verses.text: There is no speech nor language, where their voice is not heard.

verses.name: Psalms 19:4
verses.text: Their line is gone out through all the earth, and their words to the end of the world. In them hath he set a tabernacle for the sun,

verses.name: Psalms 19:5
verses.text: Which is as a bridegroom coming out of his chamber, and rejoiceth as a strong man to run a race.

verses.name: Psalms 19:6
verses.text: His going forth is from the end of the heaven, and his circuit unto the ends of it: and there is nothing hid from the heat thereof.

verses.name: Psalms 19:7
verses.text: The law of the Lord is perfect, converting the soul: the testimony of the Lord is sure, making wise the simple.

verses.name: Psalms 19:8
verses.text: The statutes of the Lord are right, rejoicing the heart: the commandment of the Lord is pure, enlightening the eyes.

verses.name: Psalms 19:9
verses.text: The fear of the Lord is clean, enduring for ever: the judgments of the Lord are true and righteous altogether.

verses.name: Psalms 19:10
verses.text: More to be desired are they than gold, yea, than much fine gold: sweeter also than honey and the honeycomb.

verses.name: Psalms 19:11
verses.text: Moreover by them is thy servant warned: and in keeping of them there is great reward.

verses.name: Psalms 19:12
verses.text: Who can understand his errors? cleanse thou me from secret faults.

verses.name: Psalms 19:13
verses.text: Keep back thy servant also from presumptuous sins; let them not have dominion over me: then shall I be upright, and I shall be innocent from the great transgression.

verses.name: Psalms 19:14
verses.text: Let the words of my mouth, and the meditation of my heart, be acceptable in thy sight, O Lord, my strength, and my redeemer.

verses.name: Psalms 20:1
verses.text: The Lord hear thee in the day of trouble; the name of the God of Jacob defend thee;

verses.name: Psalms 20:2
verses.text: Send thee help from the sanctuary, and strengthen thee out of Zion;

verses.name: Psalms 20:3
verses.text: Remember all thy offerings, and accept thy burnt sacrifice; Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 20:4
verses.text: Grant thee according to thine own heart, and fulfil all thy counsel.

verses.name: Psalms 20:5
verses.text: We will rejoice in thy salvation, and in the name of our God we will set up our banners: the Lord fulfil all thy petitions.

verses.name: Psalms 20:6
verses.text: Now know I that the Lord saveth his anointed; he will hear him from his holy heaven with the saving strength of his right hand.

verses.name: Psalms 20:7
verses.text: Some trust in chariots, and some in horses: but we will remember the name of the Lord our God.

verses.name: Psalms 20:8
verses.text: They are brought down and fallen: but we are risen, and stand upright.

verses.name: Psalms 20:9
verses.text: Save, Lord: let the king hear us when we call.

verses.name: Psalms 21:1
verses.text: The king shall joy in thy strength, O Lord; and in thy salvation how greatly shall he rejoice!

verses.name: Psalms 21:2
verses.text: Thou hast given him his heart’s desire, and hast not withholden the request of his lips. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 21:3
verses.text: For thou preventest him with the blessings of goodness: thou settest a crown of pure gold on his head.

verses.name: Psalms 21:4
verses.text: He asked life of thee, and thou gavest it him, even length of days for ever and ever.

verses.name: Psalms 21:5
verses.text: His glory is great in thy salvation: honour and majesty hast thou laid upon him.

verses.name: Psalms 21:6
verses.text: For thou hast made him most blessed for ever: thou hast made him exceeding glad with thy countenance.

verses.name: Psalms 21:7
verses.text: For the king trusteth in the Lord, and through the mercy of the most High he shall not be moved.

verses.name: Psalms 21:8
verses.text: Thine hand shall find out all thine enemies: thy right hand shall find out those that hate thee.

verses.name: Psalms 21:9
verses.text: Thou shalt make them as a fiery oven in the time of thine anger: the Lord shall swallow them up in his wrath, and the fire shall devour them.

verses.name: Psalms 21:10
verses.text: Their fruit shalt thou destroy from the earth, and their seed from among the children of men.

verses.name: Psalms 21:11
verses.text: For they intended evil against thee: they imagined a mischievous device, which they are not able to perform.

verses.name: Psalms 21:12
verses.text: Therefore shalt thou make them turn their back, when thou shalt make ready thine arrows upon thy strings against the face of them.

verses.name: Psalms 21:13
verses.text: Be thou exalted, Lord, in thine own strength: so will we sing and praise thy power.

verses.name: Psalms 22:1
verses.text: My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me? why art thou so far from helping me, and from the words of my roaring?

verses.name: Psalms 22:2
verses.text: O my God, I cry in the daytime, but thou hearest not; and in the night season, and am not silent.

verses.name: Psalms 22:3
verses.text: But thou art holy, O thou that inhabitest the praises of Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 22:4
verses.text: Our fathers trusted in thee: they trusted, and thou didst deliver them.

verses.name: Psalms 22:5
verses.text: They cried unto thee, and were delivered: they trusted in thee, and were not confounded.

verses.name: Psalms 22:6
verses.text: But I am a worm, and no man; a reproach of men, and despised of the people.

verses.name: Psalms 22:7
verses.text: All they that see me laugh me to scorn: they shoot out the lip, they shake the head, saying,

verses.name: Psalms 22:8
verses.text: He trusted on the Lord that he would deliver him: let him deliver him, seeing he delighted in him.

verses.name: Psalms 22:9
verses.text: But thou art he that took me out of the womb: thou didst make me hope when I was upon my mother’s breasts.

verses.name: Psalms 22:10
verses.text: I was cast upon thee from the womb: thou art my God from my mother’s belly.

verses.name: Psalms 22:11
verses.text: Be not far from me; for trouble is near; for there is none to help.

verses.name: Psalms 22:12
verses.text: Many bulls have compassed me: strong bulls of Bashan have beset me round.

verses.name: Psalms 22:13
verses.text: They gaped upon me with their mouths, as a ravening and a roaring lion.

verses.name: Psalms 22:14
verses.text: I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint: my heart is like wax; it is melted in the midst of my bowels.

verses.name: Psalms 22:15
verses.text: My strength is dried up like a potsherd; and my tongue cleaveth to my jaws; and thou hast brought me into the dust of death.

verses.name: Psalms 22:16
verses.text: For dogs have compassed me: the assembly of the wicked have inclosed me: they pierced my hands and my feet.

verses.name: Psalms 22:17
verses.text: I may tell all my bones: they look and stare upon me.

verses.name: Psalms 22:18
verses.text: They part my garments among them, and cast lots upon my vesture.

verses.name: Psalms 22:19
verses.text: But be not thou far from me, O Lord: O my strength, haste thee to help me.

verses.name: Psalms 22:20
verses.text: Deliver my soul from the sword; my darling from the power of the dog.

verses.name: Psalms 22:21
verses.text: Save me from the lion’s mouth: for thou hast heard me from the horns of the unicorns.

verses.name: Psalms 22:22
verses.text: I will declare thy name unto my brethren: in the midst of the congregation will I praise thee.

verses.name: Psalms 22:23
verses.text: Ye that fear the Lord, praise him; all ye the seed of Jacob, glorify him; and fear him, all ye the seed of Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 22:24
verses.text: For he hath not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the afflicted; neither hath he hid his face from him; but when he cried unto him, he heard.

verses.name: Psalms 22:25
verses.text: My praise shall be of thee in the great congregation: I will pay my vows before them that fear him.

verses.name: Psalms 22:26
verses.text: The meek shall eat and be satisfied: they shall praise the Lord that seek him: your heart shall live for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 22:27
verses.text: All the ends of the world shall remember and turn unto the Lord: and all the kindreds of the nations shall worship before thee.

verses.name: Psalms 22:28
verses.text: For the kingdom is the Lord’s: and he is the governor among the nations.

verses.name: Psalms 22:29
verses.text: All they that be fat upon earth shall eat and worship: all they that go down to the dust shall bow before him: and none can keep alive his own soul.

verses.name: Psalms 22:30
verses.text: A seed shall serve him; it shall be accounted to the Lord for a generation.

verses.name: Psalms 22:31
verses.text: They shall come, and shall declare his righteousness unto a people that shall be born, that he hath done this.

verses.name: Psalms 23:1
verses.text: The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want.

verses.name: Psalms 23:2
verses.text: He maketh me to lie down in green pastures: he leadeth me beside the still waters.

verses.name: Psalms 23:3
verses.text: He restoreth my soul: he leadeth me in the paths of righteousness for his name’s sake.

verses.name: Psalms 23:4
verses.text: Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil: for thou art with me; thy rod and thy staff they comfort me.

verses.name: Psalms 23:5
verses.text: Thou preparest a table before me in the presence of mine enemies: thou anointest my head with oil; my cup runneth over.

verses.name: Psalms 23:6
verses.text: Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life: and I will dwell in the house of the Lord for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 24:1
verses.text: The earth is the Lord’s, and the fulness thereof; the world, and they that dwell therein.

verses.name: Psalms 24:2
verses.text: For he hath founded it upon the seas, and established it upon the floods.

verses.name: Psalms 24:3
verses.text: Who shall ascend into the hill of the Lord? or who shall stand in his holy place?

verses.name: Psalms 24:4
verses.text: He that hath clean hands, and a pure heart; who hath not lifted up his soul unto vanity, nor sworn deceitfully.

verses.name: Psalms 24:5
verses.text: He shall receive the blessing from the Lord, and righteousness from the God of his salvation.

verses.name: Psalms 24:6
verses.text: This is the generation of them that seek him, that seek thy face, O Jacob. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 24:7
verses.text: Lift up your heads, O ye gates; and be ye lift up, ye everlasting doors; and the King of glory shall come in.

verses.name: Psalms 24:8
verses.text: Who is this King of glory? The Lord strong and mighty, the Lord mighty in battle.

verses.name: Psalms 24:9
verses.text: Lift up your heads, O ye gates; even lift them up, ye everlasting doors; and the King of glory shall come in.

verses.name: Psalms 24:10
verses.text: Who is this King of glory? The Lord of hosts, he is the King of glory. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 25:1
verses.text: Unto thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.

verses.name: Psalms 25:2
verses.text: O my God, I trust in thee: let me not be ashamed, let not mine enemies triumph over me.

verses.name: Psalms 25:3
verses.text: Yea, let none that wait on thee be ashamed: let them be ashamed which transgress without cause.

verses.name: Psalms 25:4
verses.text: Shew me thy ways, O Lord; teach me thy paths.

verses.name: Psalms 25:5
verses.text: Lead me in thy truth, and teach me: for thou art the God of my salvation; on thee do I wait all the day.

verses.name: Psalms 25:6
verses.text: Remember, O Lord, thy tender mercies and thy lovingkindnesses; for they have been ever of old.

verses.name: Psalms 25:7
verses.text: Remember not the sins of my youth, nor my transgressions: according to thy mercy remember thou me for thy goodness’ sake, O Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 25:8
verses.text: Good and upright is the Lord: therefore will he teach sinners in the way.

verses.name: Psalms 25:9
verses.text: The meek will he guide in judgment: and the meek will he teach his way.

verses.name: Psalms 25:10
verses.text: All the paths of the Lord are mercy and truth unto such as keep his covenant and his testimonies.

verses.name: Psalms 25:11
verses.text: For thy name’s sake, O Lord, pardon mine iniquity; for it is great.

verses.name: Psalms 25:12
verses.text: What man is he that feareth the Lord? him shall he teach in the way that he shall choose.

verses.name: Psalms 25:13
verses.text: His soul shall dwell at ease; and his seed shall inherit the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 25:14
verses.text: The secret of the Lord is with them that fear him; and he will shew them his covenant.

verses.name: Psalms 25:15
verses.text: Mine eyes are ever toward the Lord; for he shall pluck my feet out of the net.

verses.name: Psalms 25:16
verses.text: Turn thee unto me, and have mercy upon me; for I am desolate and afflicted.

verses.name: Psalms 25:17
verses.text: The troubles of my heart are enlarged: O bring thou me out of my distresses.

verses.name: Psalms 25:18
verses.text: Look upon mine affliction and my pain; and forgive all my sins.

verses.name: Psalms 25:19
verses.text: Consider mine enemies; for they are many; and they hate me with cruel hatred.

verses.name: Psalms 25:20
verses.text: O keep my soul, and deliver me: let me not be ashamed; for I put my trust in thee.

verses.name: Psalms 25:21
verses.text: Let integrity and uprightness preserve me; for I wait on thee.

verses.name: Psalms 25:22
verses.text: Redeem Israel, O God, out of all his troubles.

verses.name: Psalms 26:1
verses.text: Judge me, O Lord; for I have walked in mine integrity: I have trusted also in the Lord; therefore I shall not slide.

verses.name: Psalms 26:2
verses.text: Examine me, O Lord, and prove me; try my reins and my heart.

verses.name: Psalms 26:3
verses.text: For thy lovingkindness is before mine eyes: and I have walked in thy truth.

verses.name: Psalms 26:4
verses.text: I have not sat with vain persons, neither will I go in with dissemblers.

verses.name: Psalms 26:5
verses.text: I have hated the congregation of evil doers; and will not sit with the wicked.

verses.name: Psalms 26:6
verses.text: I will wash mine hands in innocency: so will I compass thine altar, O Lord:

verses.name: Psalms 26:7
verses.text: That I may publish with the voice of thanksgiving, and tell of all thy wondrous works.

verses.name: Psalms 26:8
verses.text: Lord, I have loved the habitation of thy house, and the place where thine honour dwelleth.

verses.name: Psalms 26:9
verses.text: Gather not my soul with sinners, nor my life with bloody men:

verses.name: Psalms 26:10
verses.text: In whose hands is mischief, and their right hand is full of bribes.

verses.name: Psalms 26:11
verses.text: But as for me, I will walk in mine integrity: redeem me, and be merciful unto me.

verses.name: Psalms 26:12
verses.text: My foot standeth in an even place: in the congregations will I bless the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 27:1
verses.text: The Lord is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? the Lord is the strength of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?

verses.name: Psalms 27:2
verses.text: When the wicked, even mine enemies and my foes, came upon me to eat up my flesh, they stumbled and fell.

verses.name: Psalms 27:3
verses.text: Though an host should encamp against me, my heart shall not fear: though war should rise against me, in this will I be confident.

verses.name: Psalms 27:4
verses.text: One thing have I desired of the Lord, that will I seek after; that I may dwell in the house of the Lord all the days of my life, to behold the beauty of the Lord, and to enquire in his temple.

verses.name: Psalms 27:5
verses.text: For in the time of trouble he shall hide me in his pavilion: in the secret of his tabernacle shall he hide me; he shall set me up upon a rock.

verses.name: Psalms 27:6
verses.text: And now shall mine head be lifted up above mine enemies round about me: therefore will I offer in his tabernacle sacrifices of joy; I will sing, yea, I will sing praises unto the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 27:7
verses.text: Hear, O Lord, when I cry with my voice: have mercy also upon me, and answer me.

verses.name: Psalms 27:8
verses.text: When thou saidst, Seek ye my face; my heart said unto thee, Thy face, Lord, will I seek.

verses.name: Psalms 27:9
verses.text: Hide not thy face far from me; put not thy servant away in anger: thou hast been my help; leave me not, neither forsake me, O God of my salvation.

verses.name: Psalms 27:10
verses.text: When my father and my mother forsake me, then the Lord will take me up.

verses.name: Psalms 27:11
verses.text: Teach me thy way, O Lord, and lead me in a plain path, because of mine enemies.

verses.name: Psalms 27:12
verses.text: Deliver me not over unto the will of mine enemies: for false witnesses are risen up against me, and such as breathe out cruelty.

verses.name: Psalms 27:13
verses.text: I had fainted, unless I had believed to see the goodness of the Lord in the land of the living.

verses.name: Psalms 27:14
verses.text: Wait on the Lord: be of good courage, and he shall strengthen thine heart: wait, I say, on the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 28:1
verses.text: Unto thee will I cry, O Lord my rock; be not silent to me: lest, if thou be silent to me, I become like them that go down into the pit.

verses.name: Psalms 28:2
verses.text: Hear the voice of my supplications, when I cry unto thee, when I lift up my hands toward thy holy oracle.

verses.name: Psalms 28:3
verses.text: Draw me not away with the wicked, and with the workers of iniquity, which speak peace to their neighbours, but mischief is in their hearts.

verses.name: Psalms 28:4
verses.text: Give them according to their deeds, and according to the wickedness of their endeavours: give them after the work of their hands; render to them their desert.

verses.name: Psalms 28:5
verses.text: Because they regard not the works of the Lord, nor the operation of his hands, he shall destroy them, and not build them up.

verses.name: Psalms 28:6
verses.text: Blessed be the Lord, because he hath heard the voice of my supplications.

verses.name: Psalms 28:7
verses.text: The Lord is my strength and my shield; my heart trusted in him, and I am helped: therefore my heart greatly rejoiceth; and with my song will I praise him.

verses.name: Psalms 28:8
verses.text: The Lord is their strength, and he is the saving strength of his anointed.

verses.name: Psalms 28:9
verses.text: Save thy people, and bless thine inheritance: feed them also, and lift them up for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 29:1
verses.text: Give unto the Lord, O ye mighty, give unto the Lord glory and strength.

verses.name: Psalms 29:2
verses.text: Give unto the Lord the glory due unto his name; worship the Lord in the beauty of holiness.

verses.name: Psalms 29:3
verses.text: The voice of the Lord is upon the waters: the God of glory thundereth: the Lord is upon many waters.

verses.name: Psalms 29:4
verses.text: The voice of the Lord is powerful; the voice of the Lord is full of majesty.

verses.name: Psalms 29:5
verses.text: The voice of the Lord breaketh the cedars; yea, the Lord breaketh the cedars of Lebanon.

verses.name: Psalms 29:6
verses.text: He maketh them also to skip like a calf; Lebanon and Sirion like a young unicorn.

verses.name: Psalms 29:7
verses.text: The voice of the Lord divideth the flames of fire.

verses.name: Psalms 29:8
verses.text: The voice of the Lord shaketh the wilderness; the Lord shaketh the wilderness of Kadesh.

verses.name: Psalms 29:9
verses.text: The voice of the Lord maketh the hinds to calve, and discovereth the forests: and in his temple doth every one speak of his glory.

verses.name: Psalms 29:10
verses.text: The Lord sitteth upon the flood; yea, the Lord sitteth King for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 29:11
verses.text: The Lord will give strength unto his people; the Lord will bless his people with peace.

verses.name: Psalms 30:1
verses.text: I will extol thee, O Lord; for thou hast lifted me up, and hast not made my foes to rejoice over me.

verses.name: Psalms 30:2
verses.text: O Lord my God, I cried unto thee, and thou hast healed me.

verses.name: Psalms 30:3
verses.text: O Lord, thou hast brought up my soul from the grave: thou hast kept me alive, that I should not go down to the pit.

verses.name: Psalms 30:4
verses.text: Sing unto the Lord, O ye saints of his, and give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness.

verses.name: Psalms 30:5
verses.text: For his anger endureth but a moment; in his favour is life: weeping may endure for a night, but joy cometh in the morning.

verses.name: Psalms 30:6
verses.text: And in my prosperity I said, I shall never be moved.

verses.name: Psalms 30:7
verses.text: Lord, by thy favour thou hast made my mountain to stand strong: thou didst hide thy face, and I was troubled.

verses.name: Psalms 30:8
verses.text: I cried to thee, O Lord; and unto the Lord I made supplication.

verses.name: Psalms 30:9
verses.text: What profit is there in my blood, when I go down to the pit? Shall the dust praise thee? shall it declare thy truth?

verses.name: Psalms 30:10
verses.text: Hear, O Lord, and have mercy upon me: Lord, be thou my helper.

verses.name: Psalms 30:11
verses.text: Thou hast turned for me my mourning into dancing: thou hast put off my sackcloth, and girded me with gladness;

verses.name: Psalms 30:12
verses.text: To the end that my glory may sing praise to thee, and not be silent. O Lord my God, I will give thanks unto thee for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 31:1
verses.text: In thee, O Lord, do I put my trust; let me never be ashamed: deliver me in thy righteousness.

verses.name: Psalms 31:2
verses.text: Bow down thine ear to me; deliver me speedily: be thou my strong rock, for an house of defence to save me.

verses.name: Psalms 31:3
verses.text: For thou art my rock and my fortress; therefore for thy name’s sake lead me, and guide me.

verses.name: Psalms 31:4
verses.text: Pull me out of the net that they have laid privily for me: for thou art my strength.

verses.name: Psalms 31:5
verses.text: Into thine hand I commit my spirit: thou hast redeemed me, O Lord God of truth.

verses.name: Psalms 31:6
verses.text: I have hated them that regard lying vanities: but I trust in the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 31:7
verses.text: I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy: for thou hast considered my trouble; thou hast known my soul in adversities;

verses.name: Psalms 31:8
verses.text: And hast not shut me up into the hand of the enemy: thou hast set my feet in a large room.

verses.name: Psalms 31:9
verses.text: Have mercy upon me, O Lord, for I am in trouble: mine eye is consumed with grief, yea, my soul and my belly.

verses.name: Psalms 31:10
verses.text: For my life is spent with grief, and my years with sighing: my strength faileth because of mine iniquity, and my bones are consumed.

verses.name: Psalms 31:11
verses.text: I was a reproach among all mine enemies, but especially among my neighbours, and a fear to mine acquaintance: they that did see me without fled from me.

verses.name: Psalms 31:12
verses.text: I am forgotten as a dead man out of mind: I am like a broken vessel.

verses.name: Psalms 31:13
verses.text: For I have heard the slander of many: fear was on every side: while they took counsel together against me, they devised to take away my life.

verses.name: Psalms 31:14
verses.text: But I trusted in thee, O Lord: I said, Thou art my God.

verses.name: Psalms 31:15
verses.text: My times are in thy hand: deliver me from the hand of mine enemies, and from them that persecute me.

verses.name: Psalms 31:16
verses.text: Make thy face to shine upon thy servant: save me for thy mercies’ sake.

verses.name: Psalms 31:17
verses.text: Let me not be ashamed, O Lord; for I have called upon thee: let the wicked be ashamed, and let them be silent in the grave.

verses.name: Psalms 31:18
verses.text: Let the lying lips be put to silence; which speak grievous things proudly and contemptuously against the righteous.

verses.name: Psalms 31:19
verses.text: Oh how great is thy goodness, which thou hast laid up for them that fear thee; which thou hast wrought for them that trust in thee before the sons of men!

verses.name: Psalms 31:20
verses.text: Thou shalt hide them in the secret of thy presence from the pride of man: thou shalt keep them secretly in a pavilion from the strife of tongues.

verses.name: Psalms 31:21
verses.text: Blessed be the Lord: for he hath shewed me his marvellous kindness in a strong city.

verses.name: Psalms 31:22
verses.text: For I said in my haste, I am cut off from before thine eyes: nevertheless thou heardest the voice of my supplications when I cried unto thee.

verses.name: Psalms 31:23
verses.text: O love the Lord, all ye his saints: for the Lord preserveth the faithful, and plentifully rewardeth the proud doer.

verses.name: Psalms 31:24
verses.text: Be of good courage, and he shall strengthen your heart, all ye that hope in the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 32:1
verses.text: Blessed is he whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered.

verses.name: Psalms 32:2
verses.text: Blessed is the man unto whom the Lord imputeth not iniquity, and in whose spirit there is no guile.

verses.name: Psalms 32:3
verses.text: When I kept silence, my bones waxed old through my roaring all the day long.

verses.name: Psalms 32:4
verses.text: For day and night thy hand was heavy upon me: my moisture is turned into the drought of summer. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 32:5
verses.text: I acknowledged my sin unto thee, and mine iniquity have I not hid. I said, I will confess my transgressions unto the Lord; and thou forgavest the iniquity of my sin. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 32:6
verses.text: For this shall every one that is godly pray unto thee in a time when thou mayest be found: surely in the floods of great waters they shall not come nigh unto him.

verses.name: Psalms 32:7
verses.text: Thou art my hiding place; thou shalt preserve me from trouble; thou shalt compass me about with songs of deliverance. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 32:8
verses.text: I will instruct thee and teach thee in the way which thou shalt go: I will guide thee with mine eye.

verses.name: Psalms 32:9
verses.text: Be ye not as the horse, or as the mule, which have no understanding: whose mouth must be held in with bit and bridle, lest they come near unto thee.

verses.name: Psalms 32:10
verses.text: Many sorrows shall be to the wicked: but he that trusteth in the Lord, mercy shall compass him about.

verses.name: Psalms 32:11
verses.text: Be glad in the Lord, and rejoice, ye righteous: and shout for joy, all ye that are upright in heart.

verses.name: Psalms 33:1
verses.text: Rejoice in the Lord, O ye righteous: for praise is comely for the upright.

verses.name: Psalms 33:2
verses.text: Praise the Lord with harp: sing unto him with the psaltery and an instrument of ten strings.

verses.name: Psalms 33:3
verses.text: Sing unto him a new song; play skilfully with a loud noise.

verses.name: Psalms 33:4
verses.text: For the word of the Lord is right; and all his works are done in truth.

verses.name: Psalms 33:5
verses.text: He loveth righteousness and judgment: the earth is full of the goodness of the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 33:6
verses.text: By the word of the Lord were the heavens made; and all the host of them by the breath of his mouth.

verses.name: Psalms 33:7
verses.text: He gathereth the waters of the sea together as an heap: he layeth up the depth in storehouses.

verses.name: Psalms 33:8
verses.text: Let all the earth fear the Lord: let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of him.

verses.name: Psalms 33:9
verses.text: For he spake, and it was done; he commanded, and it stood fast.

verses.name: Psalms 33:10
verses.text: The Lord bringeth the counsel of the heathen to nought: he maketh the devices of the people of none effect.

verses.name: Psalms 33:11
verses.text: The counsel of the Lord standeth for ever, the thoughts of his heart to all generations.

verses.name: Psalms 33:12
verses.text: Blessed is the nation whose God is the Lord; and the people whom he hath chosen for his own inheritance.

verses.name: Psalms 33:13
verses.text: The Lord looketh from heaven; he beholdeth all the sons of men.

verses.name: Psalms 33:14
verses.text: From the place of his habitation he looketh upon all the inhabitants of the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 33:15
verses.text: He fashioneth their hearts alike; he considereth all their works.

verses.name: Psalms 33:16
verses.text: There is no king saved by the multitude of an host: a mighty man is not delivered by much strength.

verses.name: Psalms 33:17
verses.text: An horse is a vain thing for safety: neither shall he deliver any by his great strength.

verses.name: Psalms 33:18
verses.text: Behold, the eye of the Lord is upon them that fear him, upon them that hope in his mercy;

verses.name: Psalms 33:19
verses.text: To deliver their soul from death, and to keep them alive in famine.

verses.name: Psalms 33:20
verses.text: Our soul waiteth for the Lord: he is our help and our shield.

verses.name: Psalms 33:21
verses.text: For our heart shall rejoice in him, because we have trusted in his holy name.

verses.name: Psalms 33:22
verses.text: Let thy mercy, O Lord, be upon us, according as we hope in thee.

verses.name: Psalms 34:1
verses.text: I will bless the Lord at all times: his praise shall continually be in my mouth.

verses.name: Psalms 34:2
verses.text: My soul shall make her boast in the Lord: the humble shall hear thereof, and be glad.

verses.name: Psalms 34:3
verses.text: O magnify the Lord with me, and let us exalt his name together.

verses.name: Psalms 34:4
verses.text: I sought the Lord, and he heard me, and delivered me from all my fears.

verses.name: Psalms 34:5
verses.text: They looked unto him, and were lightened: and their faces were not ashamed.

verses.name: Psalms 34:6
verses.text: This poor man cried, and the Lord heard him, and saved him out of all his troubles.

verses.name: Psalms 34:7
verses.text: The angel of the Lord encampeth round about them that fear him, and delivereth them.

verses.name: Psalms 34:8
verses.text: O taste and see that the Lord is good: blessed is the man that trusteth in him.

verses.name: Psalms 34:9
verses.text: O fear the Lord, ye his saints: for there is no want to them that fear him.

verses.name: Psalms 34:10
verses.text: The young lions do lack, and suffer hunger: but they that seek the Lord shall not want any good thing.

verses.name: Psalms 34:11
verses.text: Come, ye children, hearken unto me: I will teach you the fear of the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 34:12
verses.text: What man is he that desireth life, and loveth many days, that he may see good?

verses.name: Psalms 34:13
verses.text: Keep thy tongue from evil, and thy lips from speaking guile.

verses.name: Psalms 34:14
verses.text: Depart from evil, and do good; seek peace, and pursue it.

verses.name: Psalms 34:15
verses.text: The eyes of the Lord are upon the righteous, and his ears are open unto their cry.

verses.name: Psalms 34:16
verses.text: The face of the Lord is against them that do evil, to cut off the remembrance of them from the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 34:17
verses.text: The righteous cry, and the Lord heareth, and delivereth them out of all their troubles.

verses.name: Psalms 34:18
verses.text: The Lord is nigh unto them that are of a broken heart; and saveth such as be of a contrite spirit.

verses.name: Psalms 34:19
verses.text: Many are the afflictions of the righteous: but the Lord delivereth him out of them all.

verses.name: Psalms 34:20
verses.text: He keepeth all his bones: not one of them is broken.

verses.name: Psalms 34:21
verses.text: Evil shall slay the wicked: and they that hate the righteous shall be desolate.

verses.name: Psalms 34:22
verses.text: The Lord redeemeth the soul of his servants: and none of them that trust in him shall be desolate.

verses.name: Psalms 35:1
verses.text: Plead my cause, O Lord, with them that strive with me: fight against them that fight against me.

verses.name: Psalms 35:2
verses.text: Take hold of shield and buckler, and stand up for mine help.

verses.name: Psalms 35:3
verses.text: Draw out also the spear, and stop the way against them that persecute me: say unto my soul, I am thy salvation.

verses.name: Psalms 35:4
verses.text: Let them be confounded and put to shame that seek after my soul: let them be turned back and brought to confusion that devise my hurt.

verses.name: Psalms 35:5
verses.text: Let them be as chaff before the wind: and let the angel of the Lord chase them.

verses.name: Psalms 35:6
verses.text: Let their way be dark and slippery: and let the angel of the Lord persecute them.

verses.name: Psalms 35:7
verses.text: For without cause have they hid for me their net in a pit, which without cause they have digged for my soul.

verses.name: Psalms 35:8
verses.text: Let destruction come upon him at unawares; and let his net that he hath hid catch himself: into that very destruction let him fall.

verses.name: Psalms 35:9
verses.text: And my soul shall be joyful in the Lord: it shall rejoice in his salvation.

verses.name: Psalms 35:10
verses.text: All my bones shall say, Lord, who is like unto thee, which deliverest the poor from him that is too strong for him, yea, the poor and the needy from him that spoileth him?

verses.name: Psalms 35:11
verses.text: False witnesses did rise up; they laid to my charge things that I knew not.

verses.name: Psalms 35:12
verses.text: They rewarded me evil for good to the spoiling of my soul.

verses.name: Psalms 35:13
verses.text: But as for me, when they were sick, my clothing was sackcloth: I humbled my soul with fasting; and my prayer returned into mine own bosom.

verses.name: Psalms 35:14
verses.text: I behaved myself as though he had been my friend or brother: I bowed down heavily, as one that mourneth for his mother.

verses.name: Psalms 35:15
verses.text: But in mine adversity they rejoiced, and gathered themselves together: yea, the abjects gathered themselves together against me, and I knew it not; they did tear me, and ceased not:

verses.name: Psalms 35:16
verses.text: With hypocritical mockers in feasts, they gnashed upon me with their teeth.

verses.name: Psalms 35:17
verses.text: Lord, how long wilt thou look on? rescue my soul from their destructions, my darling from the lions.

verses.name: Psalms 35:18
verses.text: I will give thee thanks in the great congregation: I will praise thee among much people.

verses.name: Psalms 35:19
verses.text: Let not them that are mine enemies wrongfully rejoice over me: neither let them wink with the eye that hate me without a cause.

verses.name: Psalms 35:20
verses.text: For they speak not peace: but they devise deceitful matters against them that are quiet in the land.

verses.name: Psalms 35:21
verses.text: Yea, they opened their mouth wide against me, and said, Aha, aha, our eye hath seen it.

verses.name: Psalms 35:22
verses.text: This thou hast seen, O Lord: keep not silence: O Lord, be not far from me.

verses.name: Psalms 35:23
verses.text: Stir up thyself, and awake to my judgment, even unto my cause, my God and my Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 35:24
verses.text: Judge me, O Lord my God, according to thy righteousness; and let them not rejoice over me.

verses.name: Psalms 35:25
verses.text: Let them not say in their hearts, Ah, so would we have it: let them not say, We have swallowed him up.

verses.name: Psalms 35:26
verses.text: Let them be ashamed and brought to confusion together that rejoice at mine hurt: let them be clothed with shame and dishonour that magnify themselves against me.

verses.name: Psalms 35:27
verses.text: Let them shout for joy, and be glad, that favour my righteous cause: yea, let them say continually, Let the Lord be magnified, which hath pleasure in the prosperity of his servant.

verses.name: Psalms 35:28
verses.text: And my tongue shall speak of thy righteousness and of thy praise all the day long.

verses.name: Psalms 36:1
verses.text: The transgression of the wicked saith within my heart, that there is no fear of God before his eyes.

verses.name: Psalms 36:2
verses.text: For he flattereth himself in his own eyes, until his iniquity be found to be hateful.

verses.name: Psalms 36:3
verses.text: The words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit: he hath left off to be wise, and to do good.

verses.name: Psalms 36:4
verses.text: He deviseth mischief upon his bed; he setteth himself in a way that is not good; he abhorreth not evil.

verses.name: Psalms 36:5
verses.text: Thy mercy, O Lord, is in the heavens; and thy faithfulness reacheth unto the clouds.

verses.name: Psalms 36:6
verses.text: Thy righteousness is like the great mountains; thy judgments are a great deep: O Lord, thou preservest man and beast.

verses.name: Psalms 36:7
verses.text: How excellent is thy lovingkindness, O God! therefore the children of men put their trust under the shadow of thy wings.

verses.name: Psalms 36:8
verses.text: They shall be abundantly satisfied with the fatness of thy house; and thou shalt make them drink of the river of thy pleasures.

verses.name: Psalms 36:9
verses.text: For with thee is the fountain of life: in thy light shall we see light.

verses.name: Psalms 36:10
verses.text: O continue thy lovingkindness unto them that know thee; and thy righteousness to the upright in heart.

verses.name: Psalms 36:11
verses.text: Let not the foot of pride come against me, and let not the hand of the wicked remove me.

verses.name: Psalms 36:12
verses.text: There are the workers of iniquity fallen: they are cast down, and shall not be able to rise.

verses.name: Psalms 37:1
verses.text: Fret not thyself because of evildoers, neither be thou envious against the workers of iniquity.

verses.name: Psalms 37:2
verses.text: For they shall soon be cut down like the grass, and wither as the green herb.

verses.name: Psalms 37:3
verses.text: Trust in the Lord, and do good; so shalt thou dwell in the land, and verily thou shalt be fed.

verses.name: Psalms 37:4
verses.text: Delight thyself also in the Lord; and he shall give thee the desires of thine heart.

verses.name: Psalms 37:5
verses.text: Commit thy way unto the Lord; trust also in him; and he shall bring it to pass.

verses.name: Psalms 37:6
verses.text: And he shall bring forth thy righteousness as the light, and thy judgment as the noonday.

verses.name: Psalms 37:7
verses.text: Rest in the Lord, and wait patiently for him: fret not thyself because of him who prospereth in his way, because of the man who bringeth wicked devices to pass.

verses.name: Psalms 37:8
verses.text: Cease from anger, and forsake wrath: fret not thyself in any wise to do evil.

verses.name: Psalms 37:9
verses.text: For evildoers shall be cut off: but those that wait upon the Lord, they shall inherit the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 37:10
verses.text: For yet a little while, and the wicked shall not be: yea, thou shalt diligently consider his place, and it shall not be.

verses.name: Psalms 37:11
verses.text: But the meek shall inherit the earth; and shall delight themselves in the abundance of peace.

verses.name: Psalms 37:12
verses.text: The wicked plotteth against the just, and gnasheth upon him with his teeth.

verses.name: Psalms 37:13
verses.text: The Lord shall laugh at him: for he seeth that his day is coming.

verses.name: Psalms 37:14
verses.text: The wicked have drawn out the sword, and have bent their bow, to cast down the poor and needy, and to slay such as be of upright conversation.

verses.name: Psalms 37:15
verses.text: Their sword shall enter into their own heart, and their bows shall be broken.

verses.name: Psalms 37:16
verses.text: A little that a righteous man hath is better than the riches of many wicked.

verses.name: Psalms 37:17
verses.text: For the arms of the wicked shall be broken: but the Lord upholdeth the righteous.

verses.name: Psalms 37:18
verses.text: The Lord knoweth the days of the upright: and their inheritance shall be for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 37:19
verses.text: They shall not be ashamed in the evil time: and in the days of famine they shall be satisfied.

verses.name: Psalms 37:20
verses.text: But the wicked shall perish, and the enemies of the Lord shall be as the fat of lambs: they shall consume; into smoke shall they consume away.

verses.name: Psalms 37:21
verses.text: The wicked borroweth, and payeth not again: but the righteous sheweth mercy, and giveth.

verses.name: Psalms 37:22
verses.text: For such as be blessed of him shall inherit the earth; and they that be cursed of him shall be cut off.

verses.name: Psalms 37:23
verses.text: The steps of a good man are ordered by the Lord: and he delighteth in his way.

verses.name: Psalms 37:24
verses.text: Though he fall, he shall not be utterly cast down: for the Lord upholdeth him with his hand.

verses.name: Psalms 37:25
verses.text: I have been young, and now am old; yet have I not seen the righteous forsaken, nor his seed begging bread.

verses.name: Psalms 37:26
verses.text: He is ever merciful, and lendeth; and his seed is blessed.

verses.name: Psalms 37:27
verses.text: Depart from evil, and do good; and dwell for evermore.

verses.name: Psalms 37:28
verses.text: For the Lord loveth judgment, and forsaketh not his saints; they are preserved for ever: but the seed of the wicked shall be cut off.

verses.name: Psalms 37:29
verses.text: The righteous shall inherit the land, and dwell therein for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 37:30
verses.text: The mouth of the righteous speaketh wisdom, and his tongue talketh of judgment.

verses.name: Psalms 37:31
verses.text: The law of his God is in his heart; none of his steps shall slide.

verses.name: Psalms 37:32
verses.text: The wicked watcheth the righteous, and seeketh to slay him.

verses.name: Psalms 37:33
verses.text: The Lord will not leave him in his hand, nor condemn him when he is judged.

verses.name: Psalms 37:34
verses.text: Wait on the Lord, and keep his way, and he shall exalt thee to inherit the land: when the wicked are cut off, thou shalt see it.

verses.name: Psalms 37:35
verses.text: I have seen the wicked in great power, and spreading himself like a green bay tree.

verses.name: Psalms 37:36
verses.text: Yet he passed away, and, lo, he was not: yea, I sought him, but he could not be found.

verses.name: Psalms 37:37
verses.text: Mark the perfect man, and behold the upright: for the end of that man is peace.

verses.name: Psalms 37:38
verses.text: But the transgressors shall be destroyed together: the end of the wicked shall be cut off.

verses.name: Psalms 37:39
verses.text: But the salvation of the righteous is of the Lord: he is their strength in the time of trouble.

verses.name: Psalms 37:40
verses.text: And the Lord shall help them, and deliver them: he shall deliver them from the wicked, and save them, because they trust in him.

verses.name: Psalms 38:1
verses.text: O Lord, rebuke me not in thy wrath: neither chasten me in thy hot displeasure.

verses.name: Psalms 38:2
verses.text: For thine arrows stick fast in me, and thy hand presseth me sore.

verses.name: Psalms 38:3
verses.text: There is no soundness in my flesh because of thine anger; neither is there any rest in my bones because of my sin.

verses.name: Psalms 38:4
verses.text: For mine iniquities are gone over mine head: as an heavy burden they are too heavy for me.

verses.name: Psalms 38:5
verses.text: My wounds stink and are corrupt because of my foolishness.

verses.name: Psalms 38:6
verses.text: I am troubled; I am bowed down greatly; I go mourning all the day long.

verses.name: Psalms 38:7
verses.text: For my loins are filled with a loathsome disease: and there is no soundness in my flesh.

verses.name: Psalms 38:8
verses.text: I am feeble and sore broken: I have roared by reason of the disquietness of my heart.

verses.name: Psalms 38:9
verses.text: Lord, all my desire is before thee; and my groaning is not hid from thee.

verses.name: Psalms 38:10
verses.text: My heart panteth, my strength faileth me: as for the light of mine eyes, it also is gone from me.

verses.name: Psalms 38:11
verses.text: My lovers and my friends stand aloof from my sore; and my kinsmen stand afar off.

verses.name: Psalms 38:12
verses.text: They also that seek after my life lay snares for me: and they that seek my hurt speak mischievous things, and imagine deceits all the day long.

verses.name: Psalms 38:13
verses.text: But I, as a deaf man, heard not; and I was as a dumb man that openeth not his mouth.

verses.name: Psalms 38:14
verses.text: Thus I was as a man that heareth not, and in whose mouth are no reproofs.

verses.name: Psalms 38:15
verses.text: For in thee, O Lord, do I hope: thou wilt hear, O Lord my God.

verses.name: Psalms 38:16
verses.text: For I said, Hear me, lest otherwise they should rejoice over me: when my foot slippeth, they magnify themselves against me.

verses.name: Psalms 38:17
verses.text: For I am ready to halt, and my sorrow is continually before me.

verses.name: Psalms 38:18
verses.text: For I will declare mine iniquity; I will be sorry for my sin.

verses.name: Psalms 38:19
verses.text: But mine enemies are lively, and they are strong: and they that hate me wrongfully are multiplied.

verses.name: Psalms 38:20
verses.text: They also that render evil for good are mine adversaries; because I follow the thing that good is.

verses.name: Psalms 38:21
verses.text: Forsake me not, O Lord: O my God, be not far from me.

verses.name: Psalms 38:22
verses.text: Make haste to help me, O Lord my salvation.

verses.name: Psalms 39:1
verses.text: I said, I will take heed to my ways, that I sin not with my tongue: I will keep my mouth with a bridle, while the wicked is before me.

verses.name: Psalms 39:2
verses.text: I was dumb with silence, I held my peace, even from good; and my sorrow was stirred.

verses.name: Psalms 39:3
verses.text: My heart was hot within me, while I was musing the fire burned: then spake I with my tongue,

verses.name: Psalms 39:4
verses.text: Lord, make me to know mine end, and the measure of my days, what it is; that I may know how frail I am.

verses.name: Psalms 39:5
verses.text: Behold, thou hast made my days as an handbreadth; and mine age is as nothing before thee: verily every man at his best state is altogether vanity. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 39:6
verses.text: Surely every man walketh in a vain shew: surely they are disquieted in vain: he heapeth up riches, and knoweth not who shall gather them.

verses.name: Psalms 39:7
verses.text: And now, Lord, what wait I for? my hope is in thee.

verses.name: Psalms 39:8
verses.text: Deliver me from all my transgressions: make me not the reproach of the foolish.

verses.name: Psalms 39:9
verses.text: I was dumb, I opened not my mouth; because thou didst it.

verses.name: Psalms 39:10
verses.text: Remove thy stroke away from me: I am consumed by the blow of thine hand.

verses.name: Psalms 39:11
verses.text: When thou with rebukes dost correct man for iniquity, thou makest his beauty to consume away like a moth: surely every man is vanity. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 39:12
verses.text: Hear my prayer, O Lord, and give ear unto my cry; hold not thy peace at my tears: for I am a stranger with thee, and a sojourner, as all my fathers were.

verses.name: Psalms 39:13
verses.text: O spare me, that I may recover strength, before I go hence, and be no more.

verses.name: Psalms 40:1
verses.text: I waited patiently for the Lord; and he inclined unto me, and heard my cry.

verses.name: Psalms 40:2
verses.text: He brought me up also out of an horrible pit, out of the miry clay, and set my feet upon a rock, and established my goings.

verses.name: Psalms 40:3
verses.text: And he hath put a new song in my mouth, even praise unto our God: many shall see it, and fear, and shall trust in the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 40:4
