verses.text: Blessed is that man that maketh the Lord his trust, and respecteth not the proud, nor such as turn aside to lies.

verses.name: Psalms 40:5
verses.text: Many, O Lord my God, are thy wonderful works which thou hast done, and thy thoughts which are to us-ward: they cannot be reckoned up in order unto thee: if I would declare and speak of them, they are more than can be numbered.

verses.name: Psalms 40:6
verses.text: Sacrifice and offering thou didst not desire; mine ears hast thou opened: burnt offering and sin offering hast thou not required.

verses.name: Psalms 40:7
verses.text: Then said I, Lo, I come: in the volume of the book it is written of me,

verses.name: Psalms 40:8
verses.text: I delight to do thy will, O my God: yea, thy law is within my heart.

verses.name: Psalms 40:9
verses.text: I have preached righteousness in the great congregation: lo, I have not refrained my lips, O Lord, thou knowest.

verses.name: Psalms 40:10
verses.text: I have not hid thy righteousness within my heart; I have declared thy faithfulness and thy salvation: I have not concealed thy lovingkindness and thy truth from the great congregation.

verses.name: Psalms 40:11
verses.text: Withhold not thou thy tender mercies from me, O Lord: let thy lovingkindness and thy truth continually preserve me.

verses.name: Psalms 40:12
verses.text: For innumerable evils have compassed me about: mine iniquities have taken hold upon me, so that I am not able to look up; they are more than the hairs of mine head: therefore my heart faileth me.

verses.name: Psalms 40:13
verses.text: Be pleased, O Lord, to deliver me: O Lord, make haste to help me.

verses.name: Psalms 40:14
verses.text: Let them be ashamed and confounded together that seek after my soul to destroy it; let them be driven backward and put to shame that wish me evil.

verses.name: Psalms 40:15
verses.text: Let them be desolate for a reward of their shame that say unto me, Aha, aha.

verses.name: Psalms 40:16
verses.text: Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee: let such as love thy salvation say continually, The Lord be magnified.

verses.name: Psalms 40:17
verses.text: But I am poor and needy; yet the Lord thinketh upon me: thou art my help and my deliverer; make no tarrying, O my God.

verses.name: Psalms 41:1
verses.text: Blessed is he that considereth the poor: the Lord will deliver him in time of trouble.

verses.name: Psalms 41:2
verses.text: The Lord will preserve him, and keep him alive; and he shall be blessed upon the earth: and thou wilt not deliver him unto the will of his enemies.

verses.name: Psalms 41:3
verses.text: The Lord will strengthen him upon the bed of languishing: thou wilt make all his bed in his sickness.

verses.name: Psalms 41:4
verses.text: I said, Lord, be merciful unto me: heal my soul; for I have sinned against thee.

verses.name: Psalms 41:5
verses.text: Mine enemies speak evil of me, When shall he die, and his name perish?

verses.name: Psalms 41:6
verses.text: And if he come to see me, he speaketh vanity: his heart gathereth iniquity to itself; when he goeth abroad, he telleth it.

verses.name: Psalms 41:7
verses.text: All that hate me whisper together against me: against me do they devise my hurt.

verses.name: Psalms 41:8
verses.text: An evil disease, say they, cleaveth fast unto him: and now that he lieth he shall rise up no more.

verses.name: Psalms 41:9
verses.text: Yea, mine own familiar friend, in whom I trusted, which did eat of my bread, hath lifted up his heel against me.

verses.name: Psalms 41:10
verses.text: But thou, O Lord, be merciful unto me, and raise me up, that I may requite them.

verses.name: Psalms 41:11
verses.text: By this I know that thou favourest me, because mine enemy doth not triumph over me.

verses.name: Psalms 41:12
verses.text: And as for me, thou upholdest me in mine integrity, and settest me before thy face for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 41:13
verses.text: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel from everlasting, and to everlasting. Amen, and Amen.

verses.name: Psalms 42:1
verses.text: As the hart panteth after the water brooks, so panteth my soul after thee, O God.

verses.name: Psalms 42:2
verses.text: My soul thirsteth for God, for the living God: when shall I come and appear before God?

verses.name: Psalms 42:3
verses.text: My tears have been my meat day and night, while they continually say unto me, Where is thy God?

verses.name: Psalms 42:4
verses.text: When I remember these things, I pour out my soul in me: for I had gone with the multitude, I went with them to the house of God, with the voice of joy and praise, with a multitude that kept holyday.

verses.name: Psalms 42:5
verses.text: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why art thou disquieted in me? hope thou in God: for I shall yet praise him for the help of his countenance.

verses.name: Psalms 42:6
verses.text: O my God, my soul is cast down within me: therefore will I remember thee from the land of Jordan, and of the Hermonites, from the hill Mizar.

verses.name: Psalms 42:7
verses.text: Deep calleth unto deep at the noise of thy waterspouts: all thy waves and thy billows are gone over me.

verses.name: Psalms 42:8
verses.text: Yet the Lord will command his lovingkindness in the daytime, and in the night his song shall be with me, and my prayer unto the God of my life.

verses.name: Psalms 42:9
verses.text: I will say unto God my rock, Why hast thou forgotten me? why go I mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?

verses.name: Psalms 42:10
verses.text: As with a sword in my bones, mine enemies reproach me; while they say daily unto me, Where is thy God?

verses.name: Psalms 42:11
verses.text: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why art thou disquieted within me? hope thou in God: for I shall yet praise him, who is the health of my countenance, and my God.

verses.name: Psalms 43:1
verses.text: Judge me, O God, and plead my cause against an ungodly nation: O deliver me from the deceitful and unjust man.

verses.name: Psalms 43:2
verses.text: For thou art the God of my strength: why dost thou cast me off? why go I mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?

verses.name: Psalms 43:3
verses.text: O send out thy light and thy truth: let them lead me; let them bring me unto thy holy hill, and to thy tabernacles.

verses.name: Psalms 43:4
verses.text: Then will I go unto the altar of God, unto God my exceeding joy: yea, upon the harp will I praise thee, O God my God.

verses.name: Psalms 43:5
verses.text: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why art thou disquieted within me? hope in God: for I shall yet praise him, who is the health of my countenance, and my God.

verses.name: Psalms 44:1
verses.text: We have heard with our ears, O God, our fathers have told us, what work thou didst in their days, in the times of old.

verses.name: Psalms 44:2
verses.text: How thou didst drive out the heathen with thy hand, and plantedst them; how thou didst afflict the people, and cast them out.

verses.name: Psalms 44:3
verses.text: For they got not the land in possession by their own sword, neither did their own arm save them: but thy right hand, and thine arm, and the light of thy countenance, because thou hadst a favour unto them.

verses.name: Psalms 44:4
verses.text: Thou art my King, O God: command deliverances for Jacob.

verses.name: Psalms 44:5
verses.text: Through thee will we push down our enemies: through thy name will we tread them under that rise up against us.

verses.name: Psalms 44:6
verses.text: For I will not trust in my bow, neither shall my sword save me.

verses.name: Psalms 44:7
verses.text: But thou hast saved us from our enemies, and hast put them to shame that hated us.

verses.name: Psalms 44:8
verses.text: In God we boast all the day long, and praise thy name for ever. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 44:9
verses.text: But thou hast cast off, and put us to shame; and goest not forth with our armies.

verses.name: Psalms 44:10
verses.text: Thou makest us to turn back from the enemy: and they which hate us spoil for themselves.

verses.name: Psalms 44:11
verses.text: Thou hast given us like sheep appointed for meat; and hast scattered us among the heathen.

verses.name: Psalms 44:12
verses.text: Thou sellest thy people for nought, and dost not increase thy wealth by their price.

verses.name: Psalms 44:13
verses.text: Thou makest us a reproach to our neighbours, a scorn and a derision to them that are round about us.

verses.name: Psalms 44:14
verses.text: Thou makest us a byword among the heathen, a shaking of the head among the people.

verses.name: Psalms 44:15
verses.text: My confusion is continually before me, and the shame of my face hath covered me,

verses.name: Psalms 44:16
verses.text: For the voice of him that reproacheth and blasphemeth; by reason of the enemy and avenger.

verses.name: Psalms 44:17
verses.text: All this is come upon us; yet have we not forgotten thee, neither have we dealt falsely in thy covenant.

verses.name: Psalms 44:18
verses.text: Our heart is not turned back, neither have our steps declined from thy way;

verses.name: Psalms 44:19
verses.text: Though thou hast sore broken us in the place of dragons, and covered us with the shadow of death.

verses.name: Psalms 44:20
verses.text: If we have forgotten the name of our God, or stretched out our hands to a strange god;

verses.name: Psalms 44:21
verses.text: Shall not God search this out? for he knoweth the secrets of the heart.

verses.name: Psalms 44:22
verses.text: Yea, for thy sake are we killed all the day long; we are counted as sheep for the slaughter.

verses.name: Psalms 44:23
verses.text: Awake, why sleepest thou, O Lord? arise, cast us not off for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 44:24
verses.text: Wherefore hidest thou thy face, and forgettest our affliction and our oppression?

verses.name: Psalms 44:25
verses.text: For our soul is bowed down to the dust: our belly cleaveth unto the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 44:26
verses.text: Arise for our help, and redeem us for thy mercies’ sake.

verses.name: Psalms 45:1
verses.text: My heart is inditing a good matter: I speak of the things which I have made touching the king: my tongue is the pen of a ready writer.

verses.name: Psalms 45:2
verses.text: Thou art fairer than the children of men: grace is poured into thy lips: therefore God hath blessed thee for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 45:3
verses.text: Gird thy sword upon thy thigh, O most mighty, with thy glory and thy majesty.

verses.name: Psalms 45:4
verses.text: And in thy majesty ride prosperously because of truth and meekness and righteousness; and thy right hand shall teach thee terrible things.

verses.name: Psalms 45:5
verses.text: Thine arrows are sharp in the heart of the king’s enemies; whereby the people fall under thee.

verses.name: Psalms 45:6
verses.text: Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever: the sceptre of thy kingdom is a right sceptre.

verses.name: Psalms 45:7
verses.text: Thou lovest righteousness, and hatest wickedness: therefore God, thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.

verses.name: Psalms 45:8
verses.text: All thy garments smell of myrrh, and aloes, and cassia, out of the ivory palaces, whereby they have made thee glad.

verses.name: Psalms 45:9
verses.text: Kings’ daughters were among thy honourable women: upon thy right hand did stand the queen in gold of Ophir.

verses.name: Psalms 45:10
verses.text: Hearken, O daughter, and consider, and incline thine ear; forget also thine own people, and thy father’s house;

verses.name: Psalms 45:11
verses.text: So shall the king greatly desire thy beauty: for he is thy Lord; and worship thou him.

verses.name: Psalms 45:12
verses.text: And the daughter of Tyre shall be there with a gift; even the rich among the people shall intreat thy favour.

verses.name: Psalms 45:13
verses.text: The king’s daughter is all glorious within: her clothing is of wrought gold.

verses.name: Psalms 45:14
verses.text: She shall be brought unto the king in raiment of needlework: the virgins her companions that follow her shall be brought unto thee.

verses.name: Psalms 45:15
verses.text: With gladness and rejoicing shall they be brought: they shall enter into the king’s palace.

verses.name: Psalms 45:16
verses.text: Instead of thy fathers shall be thy children, whom thou mayest make princes in all the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 45:17
verses.text: I will make thy name to be remembered in all generations: therefore shall the people praise thee for ever and ever.

verses.name: Psalms 46:1
verses.text: God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.

verses.name: Psalms 46:2
verses.text: Therefore will not we fear, though the earth be removed, and though the mountains be carried into the midst of the sea;

verses.name: Psalms 46:3
verses.text: Though the waters thereof roar and be troubled, though the mountains shake with the swelling thereof. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 46:4
verses.text: There is a river, the streams whereof shall make glad the city of God, the holy place of the tabernacles of the most High.

verses.name: Psalms 46:5
verses.text: God is in the midst of her; she shall not be moved: God shall help her, and that right early.

verses.name: Psalms 46:6
verses.text: The heathen raged, the kingdoms were moved: he uttered his voice, the earth melted.

verses.name: Psalms 46:7
verses.text: The Lord of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 46:8
verses.text: Come, behold the works of the Lord, what desolations he hath made in the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 46:9
verses.text: He maketh wars to cease unto the end of the earth; he breaketh the bow, and cutteth the spear in sunder; he burneth the chariot in the fire.

verses.name: Psalms 46:10
verses.text: Be still, and know that I am God: I will be exalted among the heathen, I will be exalted in the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 46:11
verses.text: The Lord of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 47:1
verses.text: O clap your hands, all ye people; shout unto God with the voice of triumph.

verses.name: Psalms 47:2
verses.text: For the Lord most high is terrible; he is a great King over all the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 47:3
verses.text: He shall subdue the people under us, and the nations under our feet.

verses.name: Psalms 47:4
verses.text: He shall choose our inheritance for us, the excellency of Jacob whom he loved. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 47:5
verses.text: God is gone up with a shout, the Lord with the sound of a trumpet.

verses.name: Psalms 47:6
verses.text: Sing praises to God, sing praises: sing praises unto our King, sing praises.

verses.name: Psalms 47:7
verses.text: For God is the King of all the earth: sing ye praises with understanding.

verses.name: Psalms 47:8
verses.text: God reigneth over the heathen: God sitteth upon the throne of his holiness.

verses.name: Psalms 47:9
verses.text: The princes of the people are gathered together, even the people of the God of Abraham: for the shields of the earth belong unto God: he is greatly exalted.

verses.name: Psalms 48:1
verses.text: Great is the Lord, and greatly to be praised in the city of our God, in the mountain of his holiness.

verses.name: Psalms 48:2
verses.text: Beautiful for situation, the joy of the whole earth, is mount Zion, on the sides of the north, the city of the great King.

verses.name: Psalms 48:3
verses.text: God is known in her palaces for a refuge.

verses.name: Psalms 48:4
verses.text: For, lo, the kings were assembled, they passed by together.

verses.name: Psalms 48:5
verses.text: They saw it, and so they marvelled; they were troubled, and hasted away.

verses.name: Psalms 48:6
verses.text: Fear took hold upon them there, and pain, as of a woman in travail.

verses.name: Psalms 48:7
verses.text: Thou breakest the ships of Tarshish with an east wind.

verses.name: Psalms 48:8
verses.text: As we have heard, so have we seen in the city of the Lord of hosts, in the city of our God: God will establish it for ever. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 48:9
verses.text: We have thought of thy lovingkindness, O God, in the midst of thy temple.

verses.name: Psalms 48:10
verses.text: According to thy name, O God, so is thy praise unto the ends of the earth: thy right hand is full of righteousness.

verses.name: Psalms 48:11
verses.text: Let mount Zion rejoice, let the daughters of Judah be glad, because of thy judgments.

verses.name: Psalms 48:12
verses.text: Walk about Zion, and go round about her: tell the towers thereof.

verses.name: Psalms 48:13
verses.text: Mark ye well her bulwarks, consider her palaces; that ye may tell it to the generation following.

verses.name: Psalms 48:14
verses.text: For this God is our God for ever and ever: he will be our guide even unto death.

verses.name: Psalms 49:1
verses.text: Hear this, all ye people; give ear, all ye inhabitants of the world:

verses.name: Psalms 49:2
verses.text: Both low and high, rich and poor, together.

verses.name: Psalms 49:3
verses.text: My mouth shall speak of wisdom; and the meditation of my heart shall be of understanding.

verses.name: Psalms 49:4
verses.text: I will incline mine ear to a parable: I will open my dark saying upon the harp.

verses.name: Psalms 49:5
verses.text: Wherefore should I fear in the days of evil, when the iniquity of my heels shall compass me about?

verses.name: Psalms 49:6
verses.text: They that trust in their wealth, and boast themselves in the multitude of their riches;

verses.name: Psalms 49:7
verses.text: None of them can by any means redeem his brother, nor give to God a ransom for him:

verses.name: Psalms 49:8
verses.text: (For the redemption of their soul is precious, and it ceaseth for ever:)

verses.name: Psalms 49:9
verses.text: That he should still live for ever, and not see corruption.

verses.name: Psalms 49:10
verses.text: For he seeth that wise men die, likewise the fool and the brutish person perish, and leave their wealth to others.

verses.name: Psalms 49:11
verses.text: Their inward thought is, that their houses shall continue for ever, and their dwelling places to all generations; they call their lands after their own names.

verses.name: Psalms 49:12
verses.text: Nevertheless man being in honour abideth not: he is like the beasts that perish.

verses.name: Psalms 49:13
verses.text: This their way is their folly: yet their posterity approve their sayings. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 49:14
verses.text: Like sheep they are laid in the grave; death shall feed on them; and the upright shall have dominion over them in the morning; and their beauty shall consume in the grave from their dwelling.

verses.name: Psalms 49:15
verses.text: But God will redeem my soul from the power of the grave: for he shall receive me. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 49:16
verses.text: Be not thou afraid when one is made rich, when the glory of his house is increased;

verses.name: Psalms 49:17
verses.text: For when he dieth he shall carry nothing away: his glory shall not descend after him.

verses.name: Psalms 49:18
verses.text: Though while he lived he blessed his soul: and men will praise thee, when thou doest well to thyself.

verses.name: Psalms 49:19
verses.text: He shall go to the generation of his fathers; they shall never see light.

verses.name: Psalms 49:20
verses.text: Man that is in honour, and understandeth not, is like the beasts that perish.

verses.name: Psalms 50:1
verses.text: The mighty God, even the Lord, hath spoken, and called the earth from the rising of the sun unto the going down thereof.

verses.name: Psalms 50:2
verses.text: Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God hath shined.

verses.name: Psalms 50:3
verses.text: Our God shall come, and shall not keep silence: a fire shall devour before him, and it shall be very tempestuous round about him.

verses.name: Psalms 50:4
verses.text: He shall call to the heavens from above, and to the earth, that he may judge his people.

verses.name: Psalms 50:5
verses.text: Gather my saints together unto me; those that have made a covenant with me by sacrifice.

verses.name: Psalms 50:6
verses.text: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is judge himself. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 50:7
verses.text: Hear, O my people, and I will speak; O Israel, and I will testify against thee: I am God, even thy God.

verses.name: Psalms 50:8
verses.text: I will not reprove thee for thy sacrifices or thy burnt offerings, to have been continually before me.

verses.name: Psalms 50:9
verses.text: I will take no bullock out of thy house, nor he goats out of thy folds.

verses.name: Psalms 50:10
verses.text: For every beast of the forest is mine, and the cattle upon a thousand hills.

verses.name: Psalms 50:11
verses.text: I know all the fowls of the mountains: and the wild beasts of the field are mine.

verses.name: Psalms 50:12
verses.text: If I were hungry, I would not tell thee: for the world is mine, and the fulness thereof.

verses.name: Psalms 50:13
verses.text: Will I eat the flesh of bulls, or drink the blood of goats?

verses.name: Psalms 50:14
verses.text: Offer unto God thanksgiving; and pay thy vows unto the most High:

verses.name: Psalms 50:15
verses.text: And call upon me in the day of trouble: I will deliver thee, and thou shalt glorify me.

verses.name: Psalms 50:16
verses.text: But unto the wicked God saith, What hast thou to do to declare my statutes, or that thou shouldest take my covenant in thy mouth?

verses.name: Psalms 50:17
verses.text: Seeing thou hatest instruction, and castest my words behind thee.

verses.name: Psalms 50:18
verses.text: When thou sawest a thief, then thou consentedst with him, and hast been partaker with adulterers.

verses.name: Psalms 50:19
verses.text: Thou givest thy mouth to evil, and thy tongue frameth deceit.

verses.name: Psalms 50:20
verses.text: Thou sittest and speakest against thy brother; thou slanderest thine own mother’s son.

verses.name: Psalms 50:21
verses.text: These things hast thou done, and I kept silence; thou thoughtest that I was altogether such an one as thyself: but I will reprove thee, and set them in order before thine eyes.

verses.name: Psalms 50:22
verses.text: Now consider this, ye that forget God, lest I tear you in pieces, and there be none to deliver.

verses.name: Psalms 50:23
verses.text: Whoso offereth praise glorifieth me: and to him that ordereth his conversation aright will I shew the salvation of God.

verses.name: Psalms 51:1
verses.text: Have mercy upon me, O God, according to thy lovingkindness: according unto the multitude of thy tender mercies blot out my transgressions.

verses.name: Psalms 51:2
verses.text: Wash me throughly from mine iniquity, and cleanse me from my sin.

verses.name: Psalms 51:3
verses.text: For I acknowledge my transgressions: and my sin is ever before me.

verses.name: Psalms 51:4
verses.text: Against thee, thee only, have I sinned, and done this evil in thy sight: that thou mightest be justified when thou speakest, and be clear when thou judgest.

verses.name: Psalms 51:5
verses.text: Behold, I was shapen in iniquity; and in sin did my mother conceive me.

verses.name: Psalms 51:6
verses.text: Behold, thou desirest truth in the inward parts: and in the hidden part thou shalt make me to know wisdom.

verses.name: Psalms 51:7
verses.text: Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean: wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.

verses.name: Psalms 51:8
verses.text: Make me to hear joy and gladness; that the bones which thou hast broken may rejoice.

verses.name: Psalms 51:9
verses.text: Hide thy face from my sins, and blot out all mine iniquities.

verses.name: Psalms 51:10
verses.text: Create in me a clean heart, O God; and renew a right spirit within me.

verses.name: Psalms 51:11
verses.text: Cast me not away from thy presence; and take not thy holy spirit from me.

verses.name: Psalms 51:12
verses.text: Restore unto me the joy of thy salvation; and uphold me with thy free spirit.

verses.name: Psalms 51:13
verses.text: Then will I teach transgressors thy ways; and sinners shall be converted unto thee.

verses.name: Psalms 51:14
verses.text: Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, O God, thou God of my salvation: and my tongue shall sing aloud of thy righteousness.

verses.name: Psalms 51:15
verses.text: O Lord, open thou my lips; and my mouth shall shew forth thy praise.

verses.name: Psalms 51:16
verses.text: For thou desirest not sacrifice; else would I give it: thou delightest not in burnt offering.

verses.name: Psalms 51:17
verses.text: The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit: a broken and a contrite heart, O God, thou wilt not despise.

verses.name: Psalms 51:18
verses.text: Do good in thy good pleasure unto Zion: build thou the walls of Jerusalem.

verses.name: Psalms 51:19
verses.text: Then shalt thou be pleased with the sacrifices of righteousness, with burnt offering and whole burnt offering: then shall they offer bullocks upon thine altar.

verses.name: Psalms 52:1
verses.text: Why boastest thou thyself in mischief, O mighty man? the goodness of God endureth continually.

verses.name: Psalms 52:2
verses.text: Thy tongue deviseth mischiefs; like a sharp razor, working deceitfully.

verses.name: Psalms 52:3
verses.text: Thou lovest evil more than good; and lying rather than to speak righteousness. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 52:4
verses.text: Thou lovest all devouring words, O thou deceitful tongue.

verses.name: Psalms 52:5
verses.text: God shall likewise destroy thee for ever, he shall take thee away, and pluck thee out of thy dwelling place, and root thee out of the land of the living. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 52:6
verses.text: The righteous also shall see, and fear, and shall laugh at him:

verses.name: Psalms 52:7
verses.text: Lo, this is the man that made not God his strength; but trusted in the abundance of his riches, and strengthened himself in his wickedness.

verses.name: Psalms 52:8
verses.text: But I am like a green olive tree in the house of God: I trust in the mercy of God for ever and ever.

verses.name: Psalms 52:9
verses.text: I will praise thee for ever, because thou hast done it: and I will wait on thy name; for it is good before thy saints.

verses.name: Psalms 53:1
verses.text: The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God. Corrupt are they, and have done abominable iniquity: there is none that doeth good.

verses.name: Psalms 53:2
verses.text: God looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there were any that did understand, that did seek God.

verses.name: Psalms 53:3
verses.text: Every one of them is gone back: they are altogether become filthy; there is none that doeth good, no, not one.

verses.name: Psalms 53:4
verses.text: Have the workers of iniquity no knowledge? who eat up my people as they eat bread: they have not called upon God.

verses.name: Psalms 53:5
verses.text: There were they in great fear, where no fear was: for God hath scattered the bones of him that encampeth against thee: thou hast put them to shame, because God hath despised them.

verses.name: Psalms 53:6
verses.text: Oh that the salvation of Israel were come out of Zion! When God bringeth back the captivity of his people, Jacob shall rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.

verses.name: Psalms 54:1
verses.text: Save me, O God, by thy name, and judge me by thy strength.

verses.name: Psalms 54:2
verses.text: Hear my prayer, O God; give ear to the words of my mouth.

verses.name: Psalms 54:3
verses.text: For strangers are risen up against me, and oppressors seek after my soul: they have not set God before them. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 54:4
verses.text: Behold, God is mine helper: the Lord is with them that uphold my soul.

verses.name: Psalms 54:5
verses.text: He shall reward evil unto mine enemies: cut them off in thy truth.

verses.name: Psalms 54:6
verses.text: I will freely sacrifice unto thee: I will praise thy name, O Lord; for it is good.

verses.name: Psalms 54:7
verses.text: For he hath delivered me out of all trouble: and mine eye hath seen his desire upon mine enemies.

verses.name: Psalms 55:1
verses.text: Give ear to my prayer, O God; and hide not thyself from my supplication.

verses.name: Psalms 55:2
verses.text: Attend unto me, and hear me: I mourn in my complaint, and make a noise;

verses.name: Psalms 55:3
verses.text: Because of the voice of the enemy, because of the oppression of the wicked: for they cast iniquity upon me, and in wrath they hate me.

verses.name: Psalms 55:4
verses.text: My heart is sore pained within me: and the terrors of death are fallen upon me.

verses.name: Psalms 55:5
verses.text: Fearfulness and trembling are come upon me, and horror hath overwhelmed me.

verses.name: Psalms 55:6
verses.text: And I said, Oh that I had wings like a dove! for then would I fly away, and be at rest.

verses.name: Psalms 55:7
verses.text: Lo, then would I wander far off, and remain in the wilderness. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 55:8
verses.text: I would hasten my escape from the windy storm and tempest.

verses.name: Psalms 55:9
verses.text: Destroy, O Lord, and divide their tongues: for I have seen violence and strife in the city.

verses.name: Psalms 55:10
verses.text: Day and night they go about it upon the walls thereof: mischief also and sorrow are in the midst of it.

verses.name: Psalms 55:11
verses.text: Wickedness is in the midst thereof: deceit and guile depart not from her streets.

verses.name: Psalms 55:12
verses.text: For it was not an enemy that reproached me; then I could have borne it: neither was it he that hated me that did magnify himself against me; then I would have hid myself from him:

verses.name: Psalms 55:13
verses.text: But it was thou, a man mine equal, my guide, and mine acquaintance.

verses.name: Psalms 55:14
verses.text: We took sweet counsel together, and walked unto the house of God in company.

verses.name: Psalms 55:15
verses.text: Let death seize upon them, and let them go down quick into hell: for wickedness is in their dwellings, and among them.

verses.name: Psalms 55:16
verses.text: As for me, I will call upon God; and the Lord shall save me.

verses.name: Psalms 55:17
verses.text: Evening, and morning, and at noon, will I pray, and cry aloud: and he shall hear my voice.

verses.name: Psalms 55:18
verses.text: He hath delivered my soul in peace from the battle that was against me: for there were many with me.

verses.name: Psalms 55:19
verses.text: God shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.

verses.name: Psalms 55:20
verses.text: He hath put forth his hands against such as be at peace with him: he hath broken his covenant.

verses.name: Psalms 55:21
verses.text: The words of his mouth were smoother than butter, but war was in his heart: his words were softer than oil, yet were they drawn swords.

verses.name: Psalms 55:22
verses.text: Cast thy burden upon the Lord, and he shall sustain thee: he shall never suffer the righteous to be moved.

verses.name: Psalms 55:23
verses.text: But thou, O God, shalt bring them down into the pit of destruction: bloody and deceitful men shall not live out half their days; but I will trust in thee.

verses.name: Psalms 56:1
verses.text: Be merciful unto me, O God: for man would swallow me up; he fighting daily oppresseth me.

verses.name: Psalms 56:2
verses.text: Mine enemies would daily swallow me up: for they be many that fight against me, O thou most High.

verses.name: Psalms 56:3
verses.text: What time I am afraid, I will trust in thee.

verses.name: Psalms 56:4
verses.text: In God I will praise his word, in God I have put my trust; I will not fear what flesh can do unto me.

verses.name: Psalms 56:5
verses.text: Every day they wrest my words: all their thoughts are against me for evil.

verses.name: Psalms 56:6
verses.text: They gather themselves together, they hide themselves, they mark my steps, when they wait for my soul.

verses.name: Psalms 56:7
verses.text: Shall they escape by iniquity? in thine anger cast down the people, O God.

verses.name: Psalms 56:8
verses.text: Thou tellest my wanderings: put thou my tears into thy bottle: are they not in thy book?

verses.name: Psalms 56:9
verses.text: When I cry unto thee, then shall mine enemies turn back: this I know; for God is for me.

verses.name: Psalms 56:10
verses.text: In God will I praise his word: in the Lord will I praise his word.

verses.name: Psalms 56:11
verses.text: In God have I put my trust: I will not be afraid what man can do unto me.

verses.name: Psalms 56:12
verses.text: Thy vows are upon me, O God: I will render praises unto thee.

verses.name: Psalms 56:13
verses.text: For thou hast delivered my soul from death: wilt not thou deliver my feet from falling, that I may walk before God in the light of the living?

verses.name: Psalms 57:1
verses.text: Be merciful unto me, O God, be merciful unto me: for my soul trusteth in thee: yea, in the shadow of thy wings will I make my refuge, until these calamities be overpast.

verses.name: Psalms 57:2
verses.text: I will cry unto God most high; unto God that performeth all things for me.

verses.name: Psalms 57:3
verses.text: He shall send from heaven, and save me from the reproach of him that would swallow me up. Selah. God shall send forth his mercy and his truth.

verses.name: Psalms 57:4
verses.text: My soul is among lions: and I lie even among them that are set on fire, even the sons of men, whose teeth are spears and arrows, and their tongue a sharp sword.

verses.name: Psalms 57:5
verses.text: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens; let thy glory be above all the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 57:6
verses.text: They have prepared a net for my steps; my soul is bowed down: they have digged a pit before me, into the midst whereof they are fallen themselves. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 57:7
verses.text: My heart is fixed, O God, my heart is fixed: I will sing and give praise.

verses.name: Psalms 57:8
verses.text: Awake up, my glory; awake, psaltery and harp: I myself will awake early.

verses.name: Psalms 57:9
verses.text: I will praise thee, O Lord, among the people: I will sing unto thee among the nations.

verses.name: Psalms 57:10
verses.text: For thy mercy is great unto the heavens, and thy truth unto the clouds.

verses.name: Psalms 57:11
verses.text: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens: let thy glory be above all the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 58:1
verses.text: Do ye indeed speak righteousness, O congregation? do ye judge uprightly, O ye sons of men?

verses.name: Psalms 58:2
verses.text: Yea, in heart ye work wickedness; ye weigh the violence of your hands in the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 58:3
verses.text: The wicked are estranged from the womb: they go astray as soon as they be born, speaking lies.

verses.name: Psalms 58:4
verses.text: Their poison is like the poison of a serpent: they are like the deaf adder that stoppeth her ear;

verses.name: Psalms 58:5
verses.text: Which will not hearken to the voice of charmers, charming never so wisely.

verses.name: Psalms 58:6
verses.text: Break their teeth, O God, in their mouth: break out the great teeth of the young lions, O Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 58:7
verses.text: Let them melt away as waters which run continually: when he bendeth his bow to shoot his arrows, let them be as cut in pieces.

verses.name: Psalms 58:8
verses.text: As a snail which melteth, let every one of them pass away: like the untimely birth of a woman, that they may not see the sun.

verses.name: Psalms 58:9
verses.text: Before your pots can feel the thorns, he shall take them away as with a whirlwind, both living, and in his wrath.

verses.name: Psalms 58:10
verses.text: The righteous shall rejoice when he seeth the vengeance: he shall wash his feet in the blood of the wicked.

verses.name: Psalms 58:11
verses.text: So that a man shall say, Verily there is a reward for the righteous: verily he is a God that judgeth in the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 59:1
verses.text: Deliver me from mine enemies, O my God: defend me from them that rise up against me.

verses.name: Psalms 59:2
verses.text: Deliver me from the workers of iniquity, and save me from bloody men.

verses.name: Psalms 59:3
verses.text: For, lo, they lie in wait for my soul: the mighty are gathered against me; not for my transgression, nor for my sin, O Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 59:4
verses.text: They run and prepare themselves without my fault: awake to help me, and behold.

verses.name: Psalms 59:5
verses.text: Thou therefore, O Lord God of hosts, the God of Israel, awake to visit all the heathen: be not merciful to any wicked transgressors. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 59:6
verses.text: They return at evening: they make a noise like a dog, and go round about the city.

verses.name: Psalms 59:7
verses.text: Behold, they belch out with their mouth: swords are in their lips: for who, say they, doth hear?

verses.name: Psalms 59:8
verses.text: But thou, O Lord, shalt laugh at them; thou shalt have all the heathen in derision.

verses.name: Psalms 59:9
verses.text: Because of his strength will I wait upon thee: for God is my defence.

verses.name: Psalms 59:10
verses.text: The God of my mercy shall prevent me: God shall let me see my desire upon mine enemies.

verses.name: Psalms 59:11
verses.text: Slay them not, lest my people forget: scatter them by thy power; and bring them down, O Lord our shield.

verses.name: Psalms 59:12
verses.text: For the sin of their mouth and the words of their lips let them even be taken in their pride: and for cursing and lying which they speak.

verses.name: Psalms 59:13
verses.text: Consume them in wrath, consume them, that they may not be: and let them know that God ruleth in Jacob unto the ends of the earth. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 59:14
verses.text: And at evening let them return; and let them make a noise like a dog, and go round about the city.

verses.name: Psalms 59:15
verses.text: Let them wander up and down for meat, and grudge if they be not satisfied.

verses.name: Psalms 59:16
verses.text: But I will sing of thy power; yea, I will sing aloud of thy mercy in the morning: for thou hast been my defence and refuge in the day of my trouble.

verses.name: Psalms 59:17
verses.text: Unto thee, O my strength, will I sing: for God is my defence, and the God of my mercy.

verses.name: Psalms 60:1
verses.text: O God, thou hast cast us off, thou hast scattered us, thou hast been displeased; O turn thyself to us again.

verses.name: Psalms 60:2
verses.text: Thou hast made the earth to tremble; thou hast broken it: heal the breaches thereof; for it shaketh.

verses.name: Psalms 60:3
verses.text: Thou hast shewed thy people hard things: thou hast made us to drink the wine of astonishment.

verses.name: Psalms 60:4
verses.text: Thou hast given a banner to them that fear thee, that it may be displayed because of the truth. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 60:5
verses.text: That thy beloved may be delivered; save with thy right hand, and hear me.

verses.name: Psalms 60:6
verses.text: God hath spoken in his holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.

verses.name: Psalms 60:7
verses.text: Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine; Ephraim also is the strength of mine head; Judah is my lawgiver;

verses.name: Psalms 60:8
verses.text: Moab is my washpot; over Edom will I cast out my shoe: Philistia, triumph thou because of me.

verses.name: Psalms 60:9
verses.text: Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me into Edom?

verses.name: Psalms 60:10
verses.text: Wilt not thou, O God, which hadst cast us off? and thou, O God, which didst not go out with our armies?

verses.name: Psalms 60:11
verses.text: Give us help from trouble: for vain is the help of man.

verses.name: Psalms 60:12
verses.text: Through God we shall do valiantly: for he it is that shall tread down our enemies.

verses.name: Psalms 61:1
verses.text: Hear my cry, O God; attend unto my prayer.

verses.name: Psalms 61:2
verses.text: From the end of the earth will I cry unto thee, when my heart is overwhelmed: lead me to the rock that is higher than I.

verses.name: Psalms 61:3
verses.text: For thou hast been a shelter for me, and a strong tower from the enemy.

verses.name: Psalms 61:4
verses.text: I will abide in thy tabernacle for ever: I will trust in the covert of thy wings. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 61:5
verses.text: For thou, O God, hast heard my vows: thou hast given me the heritage of those that fear thy name.

verses.name: Psalms 61:6
verses.text: Thou wilt prolong the king’s life: and his years as many generations.

verses.name: Psalms 61:7
verses.text: He shall abide before God for ever: O prepare mercy and truth, which may preserve him.

verses.name: Psalms 61:8
verses.text: So will I sing praise unto thy name for ever, that I may daily perform my vows.

verses.name: Psalms 62:1
verses.text: Truly my soul waiteth upon God: from him cometh my salvation.

verses.name: Psalms 62:2
verses.text: He only is my rock and my salvation; he is my defence; I shall not be greatly moved.

verses.name: Psalms 62:3
verses.text: How long will ye imagine mischief against a man? ye shall be slain all of you: as a bowing wall shall ye be, and as a tottering fence.

verses.name: Psalms 62:4
verses.text: They only consult to cast him down from his excellency: they delight in lies: they bless with their mouth, but they curse inwardly. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 62:5
verses.text: My soul, wait thou only upon God; for my expectation is from him.

verses.name: Psalms 62:6
verses.text: He only is my rock and my salvation: he is my defence; I shall not be moved.

verses.name: Psalms 62:7
verses.text: In God is my salvation and my glory: the rock of my strength, and my refuge, is in God.

verses.name: Psalms 62:8
verses.text: Trust in him at all times; ye people, pour out your heart before him: God is a refuge for us. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 62:9
verses.text: Surely men of low degree are vanity, and men of high degree are a lie: to be laid in the balance, they are altogether lighter than vanity.

verses.name: Psalms 62:10
verses.text: Trust not in oppression, and become not vain in robbery: if riches increase, set not your heart upon them.

verses.name: Psalms 62:11
verses.text: God hath spoken once; twice have I heard this; that power belongeth unto God.

verses.name: Psalms 62:12
verses.text: Also unto thee, O Lord, belongeth mercy: for thou renderest to every man according to his work.

verses.name: Psalms 63:1
verses.text: O God, thou art my God; early will I seek thee: my soul thirsteth for thee, my flesh longeth for thee in a dry and thirsty land, where no water is;

verses.name: Psalms 63:2
verses.text: To see thy power and thy glory, so as I have seen thee in the sanctuary.

verses.name: Psalms 63:3
verses.text: Because thy lovingkindness is better than life, my lips shall praise thee.

verses.name: Psalms 63:4
verses.text: Thus will I bless thee while I live: I will lift up my hands in thy name.

verses.name: Psalms 63:5
verses.text: My soul shall be satisfied as with marrow and fatness; and my mouth shall praise thee with joyful lips:

verses.name: Psalms 63:6
verses.text: When I remember thee upon my bed, and meditate on thee in the night watches.

verses.name: Psalms 63:7
verses.text: Because thou hast been my help, therefore in the shadow of thy wings will I rejoice.

verses.name: Psalms 63:8
verses.text: My soul followeth hard after thee: thy right hand upholdeth me.

verses.name: Psalms 63:9
verses.text: But those that seek my soul, to destroy it, shall go into the lower parts of the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 63:10
verses.text: They shall fall by the sword: they shall be a portion for foxes.

verses.name: Psalms 63:11
verses.text: But the king shall rejoice in God; every one that sweareth by him shall glory: but the mouth of them that speak lies shall be stopped.

verses.name: Psalms 64:1
verses.text: Hear my voice, O God, in my prayer: preserve my life from fear of the enemy.

verses.name: Psalms 64:2
verses.text: Hide me from the secret counsel of the wicked; from the insurrection of the workers of iniquity:

verses.name: Psalms 64:3
verses.text: Who whet their tongue like a sword, and bend their bows to shoot their arrows, even bitter words:

verses.name: Psalms 64:4
verses.text: That they may shoot in secret at the perfect: suddenly do they shoot at him, and fear not.

verses.name: Psalms 64:5
verses.text: They encourage themselves in an evil matter: they commune of laying snares privily; they say, Who shall see them?

verses.name: Psalms 64:6
verses.text: They search out iniquities; they accomplish a diligent search: both the inward thought of every one of them, and the heart, is deep.

verses.name: Psalms 64:7
verses.text: But God shall shoot at them with an arrow; suddenly shall they be wounded.

verses.name: Psalms 64:8
verses.text: So they shall make their own tongue to fall upon themselves: all that see them shall flee away.

verses.name: Psalms 64:9
verses.text: And all men shall fear, and shall declare the work of God; for they shall wisely consider of his doing.

verses.name: Psalms 64:10
verses.text: The righteous shall be glad in the Lord, and shall trust in him; and all the upright in heart shall glory.

verses.name: Psalms 65:1
verses.text: Praise waiteth for thee, O God, in Sion: and unto thee shall the vow be performed.

verses.name: Psalms 65:2
verses.text: O thou that hearest prayer, unto thee shall all flesh come.

verses.name: Psalms 65:3
verses.text: Iniquities prevail against me: as for our transgressions, thou shalt purge them away.

verses.name: Psalms 65:4
verses.text: Blessed is the man whom thou choosest, and causest to approach unto thee, that he may dwell in thy courts: we shall be satisfied with the goodness of thy house, even of thy holy temple.

verses.name: Psalms 65:5
verses.text: By terrible things in righteousness wilt thou answer us, O God of our salvation; who art the confidence of all the ends of the earth, and of them that are afar off upon the sea:

verses.name: Psalms 65:6
verses.text: Which by his strength setteth fast the mountains; being girded with power:

verses.name: Psalms 65:7
verses.text: Which stilleth the noise of the seas, the noise of their waves, and the tumult of the people.

verses.name: Psalms 65:8
verses.text: They also that dwell in the uttermost parts are afraid at thy tokens: thou makest the outgoings of the morning and evening to rejoice.

verses.name: Psalms 65:9
verses.text: Thou visitest the earth, and waterest it: thou greatly enrichest it with the river of God, which is full of water: thou preparest them corn, when thou hast so provided for it.

verses.name: Psalms 65:10
verses.text: Thou waterest the ridges thereof abundantly: thou settlest the furrows thereof: thou makest it soft with showers: thou blessest the springing thereof.

verses.name: Psalms 65:11
verses.text: Thou crownest the year with thy goodness; and thy paths drop fatness.

verses.name: Psalms 65:12
verses.text: They drop upon the pastures of the wilderness: and the little hills rejoice on every side.

verses.name: Psalms 65:13
verses.text: The pastures are clothed with flocks; the valleys also are covered over with corn; they shout for joy, they also sing.

verses.name: Psalms 66:1
verses.text: Make a joyful noise unto God, all ye lands:

verses.name: Psalms 66:2
verses.text: Sing forth the honour of his name: make his praise glorious.

verses.name: Psalms 66:3
verses.text: Say unto God, How terrible art thou in thy works! through the greatness of thy power shall thine enemies submit themselves unto thee.

verses.name: Psalms 66:4
verses.text: All the earth shall worship thee, and shall sing unto thee; they shall sing to thy name. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 66:5
verses.text: Come and see the works of God: he is terrible in his doing toward the children of men.

verses.name: Psalms 66:6
verses.text: He turned the sea into dry land: they went through the flood on foot: there did we rejoice in him.

verses.name: Psalms 66:7
verses.text: He ruleth by his power for ever; his eyes behold the nations: let not the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 66:8
verses.text: O bless our God, ye people, and make the voice of his praise to be heard:

verses.name: Psalms 66:9
verses.text: Which holdeth our soul in life, and suffereth not our feet to be moved.

verses.name: Psalms 66:10
verses.text: For thou, O God, hast proved us: thou hast tried us, as silver is tried.

verses.name: Psalms 66:11
verses.text: Thou broughtest us into the net; thou laidst affliction upon our loins.

verses.name: Psalms 66:12
verses.text: Thou hast caused men to ride over our heads; we went through fire and through water: but thou broughtest us out into a wealthy place.

verses.name: Psalms 66:13
verses.text: I will go into thy house with burnt offerings: I will pay thee my vows,

verses.name: Psalms 66:14
verses.text: Which my lips have uttered, and my mouth hath spoken, when I was in trouble.

verses.name: Psalms 66:15
verses.text: I will offer unto thee burnt sacrifices of fatlings, with the incense of rams; I will offer bullocks with goats. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 66:16
verses.text: Come and hear, all ye that fear God, and I will declare what he hath done for my soul.

verses.name: Psalms 66:17
verses.text: I cried unto him with my mouth, and he was extolled with my tongue.

verses.name: Psalms 66:18
verses.text: If I regard iniquity in my heart, the Lord will not hear me:

verses.name: Psalms 66:19
verses.text: But verily God hath heard me; he hath attended to the voice of my prayer.

verses.name: Psalms 66:20
verses.text: Blessed be God, which hath not turned away my prayer, nor his mercy from me.

verses.name: Psalms 67:1
verses.text: God be merciful unto us, and bless us; and cause his face to shine upon us; Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 67:2
verses.text: That thy way may be known upon earth, thy saving health among all nations.

verses.name: Psalms 67:3
verses.text: Let the people praise thee, O God; let all the people praise thee.

verses.name: Psalms 67:4
verses.text: O let the nations be glad and sing for joy: for thou shalt judge the people righteously, and govern the nations upon earth. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 67:5
verses.text: Let the people praise thee, O God; let all the people praise thee.

verses.name: Psalms 67:6
verses.text: Then shall the earth yield her increase; and God, even our own God, shall bless us.

verses.name: Psalms 67:7
verses.text: God shall bless us; and all the ends of the earth shall fear him.

verses.name: Psalms 68:1
verses.text: Let God arise, let his enemies be scattered: let them also that hate him flee before him.

verses.name: Psalms 68:2
verses.text: As smoke is driven away, so drive them away: as wax melteth before the fire, so let the wicked perish at the presence of God.

verses.name: Psalms 68:3
verses.text: But let the righteous be glad; let them rejoice before God: yea, let them exceedingly rejoice.

verses.name: Psalms 68:4
verses.text: Sing unto God, sing praises to his name: extol him that rideth upon the heavens by his name Jah, and rejoice before him.

verses.name: Psalms 68:5
verses.text: A father of the fatherless, and a judge of the widows, is God in his holy habitation.

verses.name: Psalms 68:6
verses.text: God setteth the solitary in families: he bringeth out those which are bound with chains: but the rebellious dwell in a dry land.

verses.name: Psalms 68:7
verses.text: O God, when thou wentest forth before thy people, when thou didst march through the wilderness; Selah:

verses.name: Psalms 68:8
verses.text: The earth shook, the heavens also dropped at the presence of God: even Sinai itself was moved at the presence of God, the God of Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 68:9
verses.text: Thou, O God, didst send a plentiful rain, whereby thou didst confirm thine inheritance, when it was weary.

verses.name: Psalms 68:10
verses.text: Thy congregation hath dwelt therein: thou, O God, hast prepared of thy goodness for the poor.

verses.name: Psalms 68:11
verses.text: The Lord gave the word: great was the company of those that published it.

verses.name: Psalms 68:12
verses.text: Kings of armies did flee apace: and she that tarried at home divided the spoil.

verses.name: Psalms 68:13
verses.text: Though ye have lien among the pots, yet shall ye be as the wings of a dove covered with silver, and her feathers with yellow gold.

verses.name: Psalms 68:14
verses.text: When the Almighty scattered kings in it, it was white as snow in Salmon.

verses.name: Psalms 68:15
verses.text: The hill of God is as the hill of Bashan; an high hill as the hill of Bashan.

verses.name: Psalms 68:16
verses.text: Why leap ye, ye high hills? this is the hill which God desireth to dwell in; yea, the Lord will dwell in it for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 68:17
verses.text: The chariots of God are twenty thousand, even thousands of angels: the Lord is among them, as in Sinai, in the holy place.

verses.name: Psalms 68:18
verses.text: Thou hast ascended on high, thou hast led captivity captive: thou hast received gifts for men; yea, for the rebellious also, that the Lord God might dwell among them.

verses.name: Psalms 68:19
verses.text: Blessed be the Lord, who daily loadeth us with benefits, even the God of our salvation. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 68:20
verses.text: He that is our God is the God of salvation; and unto God the Lord belong the issues from death.

verses.name: Psalms 68:21
verses.text: But God shall wound the head of his enemies, and the hairy scalp of such an one as goeth on still in his trespasses.

verses.name: Psalms 68:22
verses.text: The Lord said, I will bring again from Bashan, I will bring my people again from the depths of the sea:

verses.name: Psalms 68:23
verses.text: That thy foot may be dipped in the blood of thine enemies, and the tongue of thy dogs in the same.

verses.name: Psalms 68:24
verses.text: They have seen thy goings, O God; even the goings of my God, my King, in the sanctuary.

verses.name: Psalms 68:25
verses.text: The singers went before, the players on instruments followed after; among them were the damsels playing with timbrels.

verses.name: Psalms 68:26
verses.text: Bless ye God in the congregations, even the Lord, from the fountain of Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 68:27
verses.text: There is little Benjamin with their ruler, the princes of Judah and their council, the princes of Zebulun, and the princes of Naphtali.

verses.name: Psalms 68:28
verses.text: Thy God hath commanded thy strength: strengthen, O God, that which thou hast wrought for us.

verses.name: Psalms 68:29
verses.text: Because of thy temple at Jerusalem shall kings bring presents unto thee.

verses.name: Psalms 68:30
verses.text: Rebuke the company of spearmen, the multitude of the bulls, with the calves of the people, till every one submit himself with pieces of silver: scatter thou the people that delight in war.

verses.name: Psalms 68:31
verses.text: Princes shall come out of Egypt; Ethiopia shall soon stretch out her hands unto God.

verses.name: Psalms 68:32
verses.text: Sing unto God, ye kingdoms of the earth; O sing praises unto the Lord; Selah:

verses.name: Psalms 68:33
verses.text: To him that rideth upon the heavens of heavens, which were of old; lo, he doth send out his voice, and that a mighty voice.

verses.name: Psalms 68:34
verses.text: Ascribe ye strength unto God: his excellency is over Israel, and his strength is in the clouds.

verses.name: Psalms 68:35
verses.text: O God, thou art terrible out of thy holy places: the God of Israel is he that giveth strength and power unto his people. Blessed be God.

verses.name: Psalms 69:1
verses.text: Save me, O God; for the waters are come in unto my soul.

verses.name: Psalms 69:2
verses.text: I sink in deep mire, where there is no standing: I am come into deep waters, where the floods overflow me.

verses.name: Psalms 69:3
verses.text: I am weary of my crying: my throat is dried: mine eyes fail while I wait for my God.

verses.name: Psalms 69:4
verses.text: They that hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of mine head: they that would destroy me, being mine enemies wrongfully, are mighty: then I restored that which I took not away.

verses.name: Psalms 69:5
verses.text: O God, thou knowest my foolishness; and my sins are not hid from thee.

verses.name: Psalms 69:6
verses.text: Let not them that wait on thee, O Lord God of hosts, be ashamed for my sake: let not those that seek thee be confounded for my sake, O God of Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 69:7
verses.text: Because for thy sake I have borne reproach; shame hath covered my face.

verses.name: Psalms 69:8
verses.text: I am become a stranger unto my brethren, and an alien unto my mother’s children.

verses.name: Psalms 69:9
verses.text: For the zeal of thine house hath eaten me up; and the reproaches of them that reproached thee are fallen upon me.

verses.name: Psalms 69:10
verses.text: When I wept, and chastened my soul with fasting, that was to my reproach.

verses.name: Psalms 69:11
verses.text: I made sackcloth also my garment; and I became a proverb to them.

verses.name: Psalms 69:12
verses.text: They that sit in the gate speak against me; and I was the song of the drunkards.

verses.name: Psalms 69:13
verses.text: But as for me, my prayer is unto thee, O Lord, in an acceptable time: O God, in the multitude of thy mercy hear me, in the truth of thy salvation.

verses.name: Psalms 69:14
verses.text: Deliver me out of the mire, and let me not sink: let me be delivered from them that hate me, and out of the deep waters.

verses.name: Psalms 69:15
verses.text: Let not the waterflood overflow me, neither let the deep swallow me up, and let not the pit shut her mouth upon me.

verses.name: Psalms 69:16
verses.text: Hear me, O Lord; for thy lovingkindness is good: turn unto me according to the multitude of thy tender mercies.

verses.name: Psalms 69:17
verses.text: And hide not thy face from thy servant; for I am in trouble: hear me speedily.

verses.name: Psalms 69:18
verses.text: Draw nigh unto my soul, and redeem it: deliver me because of mine enemies.

verses.name: Psalms 69:19
verses.text: Thou hast known my reproach, and my shame, and my dishonour: mine adversaries are all before thee.

verses.name: Psalms 69:20
verses.text: Reproach hath broken my heart; and I am full of heaviness: and I looked for some to take pity, but there was none; and for comforters, but I found none.

verses.name: Psalms 69:21
verses.text: They gave me also gall for my meat; and in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.

verses.name: Psalms 69:22
verses.text: Let their table become a snare before them: and that which should have been for their welfare, let it become a trap.

verses.name: Psalms 69:23
verses.text: Let their eyes be darkened, that they see not; and make their loins continually to shake.

verses.name: Psalms 69:24
verses.text: Pour out thine indignation upon them, and let thy wrathful anger take hold of them.

verses.name: Psalms 69:25
verses.text: Let their habitation be desolate; and let none dwell in their tents.

verses.name: Psalms 69:26
verses.text: For they persecute him whom thou hast smitten; and they talk to the grief of those whom thou hast wounded.

verses.name: Psalms 69:27
verses.text: Add iniquity unto their iniquity: and let them not come into thy righteousness.

verses.name: Psalms 69:28
verses.text: Let them be blotted out of the book of the living, and not be written with the righteous.

verses.name: Psalms 69:29
verses.text: But I am poor and sorrowful: let thy salvation, O God, set me up on high.

verses.name: Psalms 69:30
verses.text: I will praise the name of God with a song, and will magnify him with thanksgiving.

verses.name: Psalms 69:31
verses.text: This also shall please the Lord better than an ox or bullock that hath horns and hoofs.

verses.name: Psalms 69:32
verses.text: The humble shall see this, and be glad: and your heart shall live that seek God.

verses.name: Psalms 69:33
verses.text: For the Lord heareth the poor, and despiseth not his prisoners.

verses.name: Psalms 69:34
verses.text: Let the heaven and earth praise him, the seas, and every thing that moveth therein.

verses.name: Psalms 69:35
verses.text: For God will save Zion, and will build the cities of Judah: that they may dwell there, and have it in possession.

verses.name: Psalms 69:36
verses.text: The seed also of his servants shall inherit it: and they that love his name shall dwell therein.

verses.name: Psalms 70:1
verses.text: Make haste, O God, to deliver me; make haste to help me, O Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 70:2
verses.text: Let them be ashamed and confounded that seek after my soul: let them be turned backward, and put to confusion, that desire my hurt.

verses.name: Psalms 70:3
verses.text: Let them be turned back for a reward of their shame that say, Aha, aha.

verses.name: Psalms 70:4
verses.text: Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee: and let such as love thy salvation say continually, Let God be magnified.

verses.name: Psalms 70:5
verses.text: But I am poor and needy: make haste unto me, O God: thou art my help and my deliverer; O Lord, make no tarrying.

verses.name: Psalms 71:1
verses.text: In thee, O Lord, do I put my trust: let me never be put to confusion.

verses.name: Psalms 71:2
verses.text: Deliver me in thy righteousness, and cause me to escape: incline thine ear unto me, and save me.

verses.name: Psalms 71:3
verses.text: Be thou my strong habitation, whereunto I may continually resort: thou hast given commandment to save me; for thou art my rock and my fortress.

verses.name: Psalms 71:4
verses.text: Deliver me, O my God, out of the hand of the wicked, out of the hand of the unrighteous and cruel man.

verses.name: Psalms 71:5
verses.text: For thou art my hope, O Lord God: thou art my trust from my youth.

verses.name: Psalms 71:6
verses.text: By thee have I been holden up from the womb: thou art he that took me out of my mother’s bowels: my praise shall be continually of thee.

verses.name: Psalms 71:7
verses.text: I am as a wonder unto many; but thou art my strong refuge.

verses.name: Psalms 71:8
verses.text: Let my mouth be filled with thy praise and with thy honour all the day.

verses.name: Psalms 71:9
verses.text: Cast me not off in the time of old age; forsake me not when my strength faileth.

verses.name: Psalms 71:10
verses.text: For mine enemies speak against me; and they that lay wait for my soul take counsel together,

verses.name: Psalms 71:11
verses.text: Saying, God hath forsaken him: persecute and take him; for there is none to deliver him.

verses.name: Psalms 71:12
verses.text: O God, be not far from me: O my God, make haste for my help.

verses.name: Psalms 71:13
verses.text: Let them be confounded and consumed that are adversaries to my soul; let them be covered with reproach and dishonour that seek my hurt.

verses.name: Psalms 71:14
verses.text: But I will hope continually, and will yet praise thee more and more.

verses.name: Psalms 71:15
verses.text: My mouth shall shew forth thy righteousness and thy salvation all the day; for I know not the numbers thereof.

verses.name: Psalms 71:16
verses.text: I will go in the strength of the Lord God: I will make mention of thy righteousness, even of thine only.

verses.name: Psalms 71:17
verses.text: O God, thou hast taught me from my youth: and hitherto have I declared thy wondrous works.

verses.name: Psalms 71:18
verses.text: Now also when I am old and grayheaded, O God, forsake me not; until I have shewed thy strength unto this generation, and thy power to every one that is to come.

verses.name: Psalms 71:19
verses.text: Thy righteousness also, O God, is very high, who hast done great things: O God, who is like unto thee!

verses.name: Psalms 71:20
verses.text: Thou, which hast shewed me great and sore troubles, shalt quicken me again, and shalt bring me up again from the depths of the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 71:21
verses.text: Thou shalt increase my greatness, and comfort me on every side.

verses.name: Psalms 71:22
verses.text: I will also praise thee with the psaltery, even thy truth, O my God: unto thee will I sing with the harp, O thou Holy One of Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 71:23
verses.text: My lips shall greatly rejoice when I sing unto thee; and my soul, which thou hast redeemed.

verses.name: Psalms 71:24
verses.text: My tongue also shall talk of thy righteousness all the day long: for they are confounded, for they are brought unto shame, that seek my hurt.

verses.name: Psalms 72:1
verses.text: Give the king thy judgments, O God, and thy righteousness unto the king’s son.

verses.name: Psalms 72:2
verses.text: He shall judge thy people with righteousness, and thy poor with judgment.

verses.name: Psalms 72:3
verses.text: The mountains shall bring peace to the people, and the little hills, by righteousness.

verses.name: Psalms 72:4
verses.text: He shall judge the poor of the people, he shall save the children of the needy, and shall break in pieces the oppressor.

verses.name: Psalms 72:5
verses.text: They shall fear thee as long as the sun and moon endure, throughout all generations.

verses.name: Psalms 72:6
verses.text: He shall come down like rain upon the mown grass: as showers that water the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 72:7
verses.text: In his days shall the righteous flourish; and abundance of peace so long as the moon endureth.

verses.name: Psalms 72:8
verses.text: He shall have dominion also from sea to sea, and from the river unto the ends of the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 72:9
verses.text: They that dwell in the wilderness shall bow before him; and his enemies shall lick the dust.

verses.name: Psalms 72:10
verses.text: The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall bring presents: the kings of Sheba and Seba shall offer gifts.

verses.name: Psalms 72:11
verses.text: Yea, all kings shall fall down before him: all nations shall serve him.

verses.name: Psalms 72:12
verses.text: For he shall deliver the needy when he crieth; the poor also, and him that hath no helper.

verses.name: Psalms 72:13
verses.text: He shall spare the poor and needy, and shall save the souls of the needy.

verses.name: Psalms 72:14
verses.text: He shall redeem their soul from deceit and violence: and precious shall their blood be in his sight.

verses.name: Psalms 72:15
verses.text: And he shall live, and to him shall be given of the gold of Sheba: prayer also shall be made for him continually; and daily shall he be praised.

verses.name: Psalms 72:16
verses.text: There shall be an handful of corn in the earth upon the top of the mountains; the fruit thereof shall shake like Lebanon: and they of the city shall flourish like grass of the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 72:17
verses.text: His name shall endure for ever: his name shall be continued as long as the sun: and men shall be blessed in him: all nations shall call him blessed.

verses.name: Psalms 72:18
verses.text: Blessed be the Lord God, the God of Israel, who only doeth wondrous things.

verses.name: Psalms 72:19
verses.text: And blessed be his glorious name for ever: and let the whole earth be filled with his glory; Amen, and Amen.

verses.name: Psalms 72:20
verses.text: The prayers of David the son of Jesse are ended.

verses.name: Psalms 73:1
verses.text: Truly God is good to Israel, even to such as are of a clean heart.

verses.name: Psalms 73:2
verses.text: But as for me, my feet were almost gone; my steps had well nigh slipped.

verses.name: Psalms 73:3
verses.text: For I was envious at the foolish, when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.

verses.name: Psalms 73:4
verses.text: For there are no bands in their death: but their strength is firm.

verses.name: Psalms 73:5
verses.text: They are not in trouble as other men; neither are they plagued like other men.

verses.name: Psalms 73:6
verses.text: Therefore pride compasseth them about as a chain; violence covereth them as a garment.

verses.name: Psalms 73:7
verses.text: Their eyes stand out with fatness: they have more than heart could wish.

verses.name: Psalms 73:8
verses.text: They are corrupt, and speak wickedly concerning oppression: they speak loftily.

verses.name: Psalms 73:9
verses.text: They set their mouth against the heavens, and their tongue walketh through the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 73:10
verses.text: Therefore his people return hither: and waters of a full cup are wrung out to them.

verses.name: Psalms 73:11
verses.text: And they say, How doth God know? and is there knowledge in the most High?

verses.name: Psalms 73:12
verses.text: Behold, these are the ungodly, who prosper in the world; they increase in riches.

verses.name: Psalms 73:13
verses.text: Verily I have cleansed my heart in vain, and washed my hands in innocency.

verses.name: Psalms 73:14
verses.text: For all the day long have I been plagued, and chastened every morning.

verses.name: Psalms 73:15
verses.text: If I say, I will speak thus; behold, I should offend against the generation of thy children.

verses.name: Psalms 73:16
verses.text: When I thought to know this, it was too painful for me;

verses.name: Psalms 73:17
verses.text: Until I went into the sanctuary of God; then understood I their end.

verses.name: Psalms 73:18
verses.text: Surely thou didst set them in slippery places: thou castedst them down into destruction.

verses.name: Psalms 73:19
verses.text: How are they brought into desolation, as in a moment! they are utterly consumed with terrors.

verses.name: Psalms 73:20
verses.text: As a dream when one awaketh; so, O Lord, when thou awakest, thou shalt despise their image.

verses.name: Psalms 73:21
verses.text: Thus my heart was grieved, and I was pricked in my reins.

verses.name: Psalms 73:22
verses.text: So foolish was I, and ignorant: I was as a beast before thee.

verses.name: Psalms 73:23
verses.text: Nevertheless I am continually with thee: thou hast holden me by my right hand.

verses.name: Psalms 73:24
verses.text: Thou shalt guide me with thy counsel, and afterward receive me to glory.

verses.name: Psalms 73:25
verses.text: Whom have I in heaven but thee? and there is none upon earth that I desire beside thee.

verses.name: Psalms 73:26
verses.text: My flesh and my heart faileth: but God is the strength of my heart, and my portion for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 73:27
verses.text: For, lo, they that are far from thee shall perish: thou hast destroyed all them that go a whoring from thee.

verses.name: Psalms 73:28
verses.text: But it is good for me to draw near to God: I have put my trust in the Lord God, that I may declare all thy works.

verses.name: Psalms 74:1
verses.text: O God, why hast thou cast us off for ever? why doth thine anger smoke against the sheep of thy pasture?

verses.name: Psalms 74:2
verses.text: Remember thy congregation, which thou hast purchased of old; the rod of thine inheritance, which thou hast redeemed; this mount Zion, wherein thou hast dwelt.

verses.name: Psalms 74:3
verses.text: Lift up thy feet unto the perpetual desolations; even all that the enemy hath done wickedly in the sanctuary.

verses.name: Psalms 74:4
verses.text: Thine enemies roar in the midst of thy congregations; they set up their ensigns for signs.

verses.name: Psalms 74:5
verses.text: A man was famous according as he had lifted up axes upon the thick trees.

verses.name: Psalms 74:6
verses.text: But now they break down the carved work thereof at once with axes and hammers.

verses.name: Psalms 74:7
verses.text: They have cast fire into thy sanctuary, they have defiled by casting down the dwelling place of thy name to the ground.

verses.name: Psalms 74:8
verses.text: They said in their hearts, Let us destroy them together: they have burned up all the synagogues of God in the land.

verses.name: Psalms 74:9
verses.text: We see not our signs: there is no more any prophet: neither is there among us any that knoweth how long.

verses.name: Psalms 74:10
verses.text: O God, how long shall the adversary reproach? shall the enemy blaspheme thy name for ever?

verses.name: Psalms 74:11
verses.text: Why withdrawest thou thy hand, even thy right hand? pluck it out of thy bosom.

verses.name: Psalms 74:12
verses.text: For God is my King of old, working salvation in the midst of the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 74:13
verses.text: Thou didst divide the sea by thy strength: thou brakest the heads of the dragons in the waters.

verses.name: Psalms 74:14
verses.text: Thou brakest the heads of leviathan in pieces, and gavest him to be meat to the people inhabiting the wilderness.

verses.name: Psalms 74:15
verses.text: Thou didst cleave the fountain and the flood: thou driedst up mighty rivers.

verses.name: Psalms 74:16
verses.text: The day is thine, the night also is thine: thou hast prepared the light and the sun.

verses.name: Psalms 74:17
verses.text: Thou hast set all the borders of the earth: thou hast made summer and winter.

verses.name: Psalms 74:18
verses.text: Remember this, that the enemy hath reproached, O Lord, and that the foolish people have blasphemed thy name.

verses.name: Psalms 74:19
verses.text: O deliver not the soul of thy turtledove unto the multitude of the wicked: forget not the congregation of thy poor for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 74:20
verses.text: Have respect unto the covenant: for the dark places of the earth are full of the habitations of cruelty.

verses.name: Psalms 74:21
verses.text: O let not the oppressed return ashamed: let the poor and needy praise thy name.

verses.name: Psalms 74:22
verses.text: Arise, O God, plead thine own cause: remember how the foolish man reproacheth thee daily.

verses.name: Psalms 74:23
verses.text: Forget not the voice of thine enemies: the tumult of those that rise up against thee increaseth continually.

verses.name: Psalms 75:1
verses.text: Unto thee, O God, do we give thanks, unto thee do we give thanks: for that thy name is near thy wondrous works declare.

verses.name: Psalms 75:2
verses.text: When I shall receive the congregation I will judge uprightly.

verses.name: Psalms 75:3
verses.text: The earth and all the inhabitants thereof are dissolved: I bear up the pillars of it. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 75:4
verses.text: I said unto the fools, Deal not foolishly: and to the wicked, Lift not up the horn:

verses.name: Psalms 75:5
verses.text: Lift not up your horn on high: speak not with a stiff neck.

verses.name: Psalms 75:6
verses.text: For promotion cometh neither from the east, nor from the west, nor from the south.

verses.name: Psalms 75:7
verses.text: But God is the judge: he putteth down one, and setteth up another.

verses.name: Psalms 75:8
verses.text: For in the hand of the Lord there is a cup, and the wine is red; it is full of mixture; and he poureth out of the same: but the dregs thereof, all the wicked of the earth shall wring them out, and drink them.

verses.name: Psalms 75:9
verses.text: But I will declare for ever; I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.

verses.name: Psalms 75:10
verses.text: All the horns of the wicked also will I cut off; but the horns of the righteous shall be exalted.

verses.name: Psalms 76:1
verses.text: In Judah is God known: his name is great in Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 76:2
verses.text: In Salem also is his tabernacle, and his dwelling place in Zion.

verses.name: Psalms 76:3
verses.text: There brake he the arrows of the bow, the shield, and the sword, and the battle. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 76:4
verses.text: Thou art more glorious and excellent than the mountains of prey.

verses.name: Psalms 76:5
verses.text: The stouthearted are spoiled, they have slept their sleep: and none of the men of might have found their hands.

verses.name: Psalms 76:6
verses.text: At thy rebuke, O God of Jacob, both the chariot and horse are cast into a dead sleep.

verses.name: Psalms 76:7
verses.text: Thou, even thou, art to be feared: and who may stand in thy sight when once thou art angry?

verses.name: Psalms 76:8
verses.text: Thou didst cause judgment to be heard from heaven; the earth feared, and was still,

verses.name: Psalms 76:9
verses.text: When God arose to judgment, to save all the meek of the earth. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 76:10
verses.text: Surely the wrath of man shall praise thee: the remainder of wrath shalt thou restrain.

verses.name: Psalms 76:11
verses.text: Vow, and pay unto the Lord your God: let all that be round about him bring presents unto him that ought to be feared.

verses.name: Psalms 76:12
verses.text: He shall cut off the spirit of princes: he is terrible to the kings of the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 77:1
verses.text: I cried unto God with my voice, even unto God with my voice; and he gave ear unto me.

verses.name: Psalms 77:2
verses.text: In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord: my sore ran in the night, and ceased not: my soul refused to be comforted.

verses.name: Psalms 77:3
verses.text: I remembered God, and was troubled: I complained, and my spirit was overwhelmed. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 77:4
verses.text: Thou holdest mine eyes waking: I am so troubled that I cannot speak.

verses.name: Psalms 77:5
verses.text: I have considered the days of old, the years of ancient times.

verses.name: Psalms 77:6
verses.text: I call to remembrance my song in the night: I commune with mine own heart: and my spirit made diligent search.

verses.name: Psalms 77:7
verses.text: Will the Lord cast off for ever? and will he be favourable no more?

verses.name: Psalms 77:8
verses.text: Is his mercy clean gone for ever? doth his promise fail for evermore?

verses.name: Psalms 77:9
verses.text: Hath God forgotten to be gracious? hath he in anger shut up his tender mercies? Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 77:10
verses.text: And I said, This is my infirmity: but I will remember the years of the right hand of the most High.

verses.name: Psalms 77:11
verses.text: I will remember the works of the Lord: surely I will remember thy wonders of old.

verses.name: Psalms 77:12
verses.text: I will meditate also of all thy work, and talk of thy doings.

verses.name: Psalms 77:13
verses.text: Thy way, O God, is in the sanctuary: who is so great a God as our God?

verses.name: Psalms 77:14
verses.text: Thou art the God that doest wonders: thou hast declared thy strength among the people.

verses.name: Psalms 77:15
verses.text: Thou hast with thine arm redeemed thy people, the sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 77:16
verses.text: The waters saw thee, O God, the waters saw thee; they were afraid: the depths also were troubled.

verses.name: Psalms 77:17
verses.text: The clouds poured out water: the skies sent out a sound: thine arrows also went abroad.

verses.name: Psalms 77:18
verses.text: The voice of thy thunder was in the heaven: the lightnings lightened the world: the earth trembled and shook.

verses.name: Psalms 77:19
verses.text: Thy way is in the sea, and thy path in the great waters, and thy footsteps are not known.

verses.name: Psalms 77:20
verses.text: Thou leddest thy people like a flock by the hand of Moses and Aaron.

verses.name: Psalms 78:1
verses.text: Give ear, O my people, to my law: incline your ears to the words of my mouth.

verses.name: Psalms 78:2
verses.text: I will open my mouth in a parable: I will utter dark sayings of old:

verses.name: Psalms 78:3
verses.text: Which we have heard and known, and our fathers have told us.

verses.name: Psalms 78:4
