verses.text: We will not hide them from their children, shewing to the generation to come the praises of the Lord, and his strength, and his wonderful works that he hath done.

verses.name: Psalms 78:5
verses.text: For he established a testimony in Jacob, and appointed a law in Israel, which he commanded our fathers, that they should make them known to their children:

verses.name: Psalms 78:6
verses.text: That the generation to come might know them, even the children which should be born; who should arise and declare them to their children:

verses.name: Psalms 78:7
verses.text: That they might set their hope in God, and not forget the works of God, but keep his commandments:

verses.name: Psalms 78:8
verses.text: And might not be as their fathers, a stubborn and rebellious generation; a generation that set not their heart aright, and whose spirit was not stedfast with God.

verses.name: Psalms 78:9
verses.text: The children of Ephraim, being armed, and carrying bows, turned back in the day of battle.

verses.name: Psalms 78:10
verses.text: They kept not the covenant of God, and refused to walk in his law;

verses.name: Psalms 78:11
verses.text: And forgat his works, and his wonders that he had shewed them.

verses.name: Psalms 78:12
verses.text: Marvellous things did he in the sight of their fathers, in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.

verses.name: Psalms 78:13
verses.text: He divided the sea, and caused them to pass through; and he made the waters to stand as an heap.

verses.name: Psalms 78:14
verses.text: In the daytime also he led them with a cloud, and all the night with a light of fire.

verses.name: Psalms 78:15
verses.text: He clave the rocks in the wilderness, and gave them drink as out of the great depths.

verses.name: Psalms 78:16
verses.text: He brought streams also out of the rock, and caused waters to run down like rivers.

verses.name: Psalms 78:17
verses.text: And they sinned yet more against him by provoking the most High in the wilderness.

verses.name: Psalms 78:18
verses.text: And they tempted God in their heart by asking meat for their lust.

verses.name: Psalms 78:19
verses.text: Yea, they spake against God; they said, Can God furnish a table in the wilderness?

verses.name: Psalms 78:20
verses.text: Behold, he smote the rock, that the waters gushed out, and the streams overflowed; can he give bread also? can he provide flesh for his people?

verses.name: Psalms 78:21
verses.text: Therefore the Lord heard this, and was wroth: so a fire was kindled against Jacob, and anger also came up against Israel;

verses.name: Psalms 78:22
verses.text: Because they believed not in God, and trusted not in his salvation:

verses.name: Psalms 78:23
verses.text: Though he had commanded the clouds from above, and opened the doors of heaven,

verses.name: Psalms 78:24
verses.text: And had rained down manna upon them to eat, and had given them of the corn of heaven.

verses.name: Psalms 78:25
verses.text: Man did eat angels’ food: he sent them meat to the full.

verses.name: Psalms 78:26
verses.text: He caused an east wind to blow in the heaven: and by his power he brought in the south wind.

verses.name: Psalms 78:27
verses.text: He rained flesh also upon them as dust, and feathered fowls like as the sand of the sea:

verses.name: Psalms 78:28
verses.text: And he let it fall in the midst of their camp, round about their habitations.

verses.name: Psalms 78:29
verses.text: So they did eat, and were well filled: for he gave them their own desire;

verses.name: Psalms 78:30
verses.text: They were not estranged from their lust. But while their meat was yet in their mouths,

verses.name: Psalms 78:31
verses.text: The wrath of God came upon them, and slew the fattest of them, and smote down the chosen men of Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 78:32
verses.text: For all this they sinned still, and believed not for his wondrous works.

verses.name: Psalms 78:33
verses.text: Therefore their days did he consume in vanity, and their years in trouble.

verses.name: Psalms 78:34
verses.text: When he slew them, then they sought him: and they returned and enquired early after God.

verses.name: Psalms 78:35
verses.text: And they remembered that God was their rock, and the high God their redeemer.

verses.name: Psalms 78:36
verses.text: Nevertheless they did flatter him with their mouth, and they lied unto him with their tongues.

verses.name: Psalms 78:37
verses.text: For their heart was not right with him, neither were they stedfast in his covenant.

verses.name: Psalms 78:38
verses.text: But he, being full of compassion, forgave their iniquity, and destroyed them not: yea, many a time turned he his anger away, and did not stir up all his wrath.

verses.name: Psalms 78:39
verses.text: For he remembered that they were but flesh; a wind that passeth away, and cometh not again.

verses.name: Psalms 78:40
verses.text: How oft did they provoke him in the wilderness, and grieve him in the desert!

verses.name: Psalms 78:41
verses.text: Yea, they turned back and tempted God, and limited the Holy One of Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 78:42
verses.text: They remembered not his hand, nor the day when he delivered them from the enemy.

verses.name: Psalms 78:43
verses.text: How he had wrought his signs in Egypt, and his wonders in the field of Zoan:

verses.name: Psalms 78:44
verses.text: And had turned their rivers into blood; and their floods, that they could not drink.

verses.name: Psalms 78:45
verses.text: He sent divers sorts of flies among them, which devoured them; and frogs, which destroyed them.

verses.name: Psalms 78:46
verses.text: He gave also their increase unto the caterpiller, and their labour unto the locust.

verses.name: Psalms 78:47
verses.text: He destroyed their vines with hail, and their sycomore trees with frost.

verses.name: Psalms 78:48
verses.text: He gave up their cattle also to the hail, and their flocks to hot thunderbolts.

verses.name: Psalms 78:49
verses.text: He cast upon them the fierceness of his anger, wrath, and indignation, and trouble, by sending evil angels among them.

verses.name: Psalms 78:50
verses.text: He made a way to his anger; he spared not their soul from death, but gave their life over to the pestilence;

verses.name: Psalms 78:51
verses.text: And smote all the firstborn in Egypt; the chief of their strength in the tabernacles of Ham:

verses.name: Psalms 78:52
verses.text: But made his own people to go forth like sheep, and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.

verses.name: Psalms 78:53
verses.text: And he led them on safely, so that they feared not: but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.

verses.name: Psalms 78:54
verses.text: And he brought them to the border of his sanctuary, even to this mountain, which his right hand had purchased.

verses.name: Psalms 78:55
verses.text: He cast out the heathen also before them, and divided them an inheritance by line, and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.

verses.name: Psalms 78:56
verses.text: Yet they tempted and provoked the most high God, and kept not his testimonies:

verses.name: Psalms 78:57
verses.text: But turned back, and dealt unfaithfully like their fathers: they were turned aside like a deceitful bow.

verses.name: Psalms 78:58
verses.text: For they provoked him to anger with their high places, and moved him to jealousy with their graven images.

verses.name: Psalms 78:59
verses.text: When God heard this, he was wroth, and greatly abhorred Israel:

verses.name: Psalms 78:60
verses.text: So that he forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent which he placed among men;

verses.name: Psalms 78:61
verses.text: And delivered his strength into captivity, and his glory into the enemy’s hand.

verses.name: Psalms 78:62
verses.text: He gave his people over also unto the sword; and was wroth with his inheritance.

verses.name: Psalms 78:63
verses.text: The fire consumed their young men; and their maidens were not given to marriage.

verses.name: Psalms 78:64
verses.text: Their priests fell by the sword; and their widows made no lamentation.

verses.name: Psalms 78:65
verses.text: Then the Lord awaked as one out of sleep, and like a mighty man that shouteth by reason of wine.

verses.name: Psalms 78:66
verses.text: And he smote his enemies in the hinder parts: he put them to a perpetual reproach.

verses.name: Psalms 78:67
verses.text: Moreover he refused the tabernacle of Joseph, and chose not the tribe of Ephraim:

verses.name: Psalms 78:68
verses.text: But chose the tribe of Judah, the mount Zion which he loved.

verses.name: Psalms 78:69
verses.text: And he built his sanctuary like high palaces, like the earth which he hath established for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 78:70
verses.text: He chose David also his servant, and took him from the sheepfolds:

verses.name: Psalms 78:71
verses.text: From following the ewes great with young he brought him to feed Jacob his people, and Israel his inheritance.

verses.name: Psalms 78:72
verses.text: So he fed them according to the integrity of his heart; and guided them by the skilfulness of his hands.

verses.name: Psalms 79:1
verses.text: O God, the heathen are come into thine inheritance; thy holy temple have they defiled; they have laid Jerusalem on heaps.

verses.name: Psalms 79:2
verses.text: The dead bodies of thy servants have they given to be meat unto the fowls of the heaven, the flesh of thy saints unto the beasts of the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 79:3
verses.text: Their blood have they shed like water round about Jerusalem; and there was none to bury them.

verses.name: Psalms 79:4
verses.text: We are become a reproach to our neighbours, a scorn and derision to them that are round about us.

verses.name: Psalms 79:5
verses.text: How long, Lord? wilt thou be angry for ever? shall thy jealousy burn like fire?

verses.name: Psalms 79:6
verses.text: Pour out thy wrath upon the heathen that have not known thee, and upon the kingdoms that have not called upon thy name.

verses.name: Psalms 79:7
verses.text: For they have devoured Jacob, and laid waste his dwelling place.

verses.name: Psalms 79:8
verses.text: O remember not against us former iniquities: let thy tender mercies speedily prevent us: for we are brought very low.

verses.name: Psalms 79:9
verses.text: Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of thy name: and deliver us, and purge away our sins, for thy name’s sake.

verses.name: Psalms 79:10
verses.text: Wherefore should the heathen say, Where is their God? let him be known among the heathen in our sight by the revenging of the blood of thy servants which is shed.

verses.name: Psalms 79:11
verses.text: Let the sighing of the prisoner come before thee; according to the greatness of thy power preserve thou those that are appointed to die;

verses.name: Psalms 79:12
verses.text: And render unto our neighbours sevenfold into their bosom their reproach, wherewith they have reproached thee, O Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 79:13
verses.text: So we thy people and sheep of thy pasture will give thee thanks for ever: we will shew forth thy praise to all generations.

verses.name: Psalms 80:1
verses.text: Give ear, O Shepherd of Israel, thou that leadest Joseph like a flock; thou that dwellest between the cherubims, shine forth.

verses.name: Psalms 80:2
verses.text: Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh stir up thy strength, and come and save us.

verses.name: Psalms 80:3
verses.text: Turn us again, O God, and cause thy face to shine; and we shall be saved.

verses.name: Psalms 80:4
verses.text: O Lord God of hosts, how long wilt thou be angry against the prayer of thy people?

verses.name: Psalms 80:5
verses.text: Thou feedest them with the bread of tears; and givest them tears to drink in great measure.

verses.name: Psalms 80:6
verses.text: Thou makest us a strife unto our neighbours: and our enemies laugh among themselves.

verses.name: Psalms 80:7
verses.text: Turn us again, O God of hosts, and cause thy face to shine; and we shall be saved.

verses.name: Psalms 80:8
verses.text: Thou hast brought a vine out of Egypt: thou hast cast out the heathen, and planted it.

verses.name: Psalms 80:9
verses.text: Thou preparedst room before it, and didst cause it to take deep root, and it filled the land.

verses.name: Psalms 80:10
verses.text: The hills were covered with the shadow of it, and the boughs thereof were like the goodly cedars.

verses.name: Psalms 80:11
verses.text: She sent out her boughs unto the sea, and her branches unto the river.

verses.name: Psalms 80:12
verses.text: Why hast thou then broken down her hedges, so that all they which pass by the way do pluck her?

verses.name: Psalms 80:13
verses.text: The boar out of the wood doth waste it, and the wild beast of the field doth devour it.

verses.name: Psalms 80:14
verses.text: Return, we beseech thee, O God of hosts: look down from heaven, and behold, and visit this vine;

verses.name: Psalms 80:15
verses.text: And the vineyard which thy right hand hath planted, and the branch that thou madest strong for thyself.

verses.name: Psalms 80:16
verses.text: It is burned with fire, it is cut down: they perish at the rebuke of thy countenance.

verses.name: Psalms 80:17
verses.text: Let thy hand be upon the man of thy right hand, upon the son of man whom thou madest strong for thyself.

verses.name: Psalms 80:18
verses.text: So will not we go back from thee: quicken us, and we will call upon thy name.

verses.name: Psalms 80:19
verses.text: Turn us again, O Lord God of hosts, cause thy face to shine; and we shall be saved.

verses.name: Psalms 81:1
verses.text: Sing aloud unto God our strength: make a joyful noise unto the God of Jacob.

verses.name: Psalms 81:2
verses.text: Take a psalm, and bring hither the timbrel, the pleasant harp with the psaltery.

verses.name: Psalms 81:3
verses.text: Blow up the trumpet in the new moon, in the time appointed, on our solemn feast day.

verses.name: Psalms 81:4
verses.text: For this was a statute for Israel, and a law of the God of Jacob.

verses.name: Psalms 81:5
verses.text: This he ordained in Joseph for a testimony, when he went out through the land of Egypt: where I heard a language that I understood not.

verses.name: Psalms 81:6
verses.text: I removed his shoulder from the burden: his hands were delivered from the pots.

verses.name: Psalms 81:7
verses.text: Thou calledst in trouble, and I delivered thee; I answered thee in the secret place of thunder: I proved thee at the waters of Meribah. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 81:8
verses.text: Hear, O my people, and I will testify unto thee: O Israel, if thou wilt hearken unto me;

verses.name: Psalms 81:9
verses.text: There shall no strange god be in thee; neither shalt thou worship any strange god.

verses.name: Psalms 81:10
verses.text: I am the Lord thy God, which brought thee out of the land of Egypt: open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it.

verses.name: Psalms 81:11
verses.text: But my people would not hearken to my voice; and Israel would none of me.

verses.name: Psalms 81:12
verses.text: So I gave them up unto their own hearts’ lust: and they walked in their own counsels.

verses.name: Psalms 81:13
verses.text: Oh that my people had hearkened unto me, and Israel had walked in my ways!

verses.name: Psalms 81:14
verses.text: I should soon have subdued their enemies, and turned my hand against their adversaries.

verses.name: Psalms 81:15
verses.text: The haters of the Lord should have submitted themselves unto him: but their time should have endured for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 81:16
verses.text: He should have fed them also with the finest of the wheat: and with honey out of the rock should I have satisfied thee.

verses.name: Psalms 82:1
verses.text: God standeth in the congregation of the mighty; he judgeth among the gods.

verses.name: Psalms 82:2
verses.text: How long will ye judge unjustly, and accept the persons of the wicked? Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 82:3
verses.text: Defend the poor and fatherless: do justice to the afflicted and needy.

verses.name: Psalms 82:4
verses.text: Deliver the poor and needy: rid them out of the hand of the wicked.

verses.name: Psalms 82:5
verses.text: They know not, neither will they understand; they walk on in darkness: all the foundations of the earth are out of course.

verses.name: Psalms 82:6
verses.text: I have said, Ye are gods; and all of you are children of the most High.

verses.name: Psalms 82:7
verses.text: But ye shall die like men, and fall like one of the princes.

verses.name: Psalms 82:8
verses.text: Arise, O God, judge the earth: for thou shalt inherit all nations.

verses.name: Psalms 83:1
verses.text: Keep not thou silence, O God: hold not thy peace, and be not still, O God.

verses.name: Psalms 83:2
verses.text: For, lo, thine enemies make a tumult: and they that hate thee have lifted up the head.

verses.name: Psalms 83:3
verses.text: They have taken crafty counsel against thy people, and consulted against thy hidden ones.

verses.name: Psalms 83:4
verses.text: They have said, Come, and let us cut them off from being a nation; that the name of Israel may be no more in remembrance.

verses.name: Psalms 83:5
verses.text: For they have consulted together with one consent: they are confederate against thee:

verses.name: Psalms 83:6
verses.text: The tabernacles of Edom, and the Ishmaelites; of Moab, and the Hagarenes;

verses.name: Psalms 83:7
verses.text: Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek; the Philistines with the inhabitants of Tyre;

verses.name: Psalms 83:8
verses.text: Assur also is joined with them: they have holpen the children of Lot. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 83:9
verses.text: Do unto them as unto the Midianites; as to Sisera, as to Jabin, at the brook of Kison:

verses.name: Psalms 83:10
verses.text: Which perished at Endor: they became as dung for the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 83:11
verses.text: Make their nobles like Oreb, and like Zeeb: yea, all their princes as Zebah, and as Zalmunna:

verses.name: Psalms 83:12
verses.text: Who said, Let us take to ourselves the houses of God in possession.

verses.name: Psalms 83:13
verses.text: O my God, make them like a wheel; as the stubble before the wind.

verses.name: Psalms 83:14
verses.text: As the fire burneth a wood, and as the flame setteth the mountains on fire;

verses.name: Psalms 83:15
verses.text: So persecute them with thy tempest, and make them afraid with thy storm.

verses.name: Psalms 83:16
verses.text: Fill their faces with shame; that they may seek thy name, O Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 83:17
verses.text: Let them be confounded and troubled for ever; yea, let them be put to shame, and perish:

verses.name: Psalms 83:18
verses.text: That men may know that thou, whose name alone is Jehovah, art the most high over all the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 84:1
verses.text: How amiable are thy tabernacles, O Lord of hosts!

verses.name: Psalms 84:2
verses.text: My soul longeth, yea, even fainteth for the courts of the Lord: my heart and my flesh crieth out for the living God.

verses.name: Psalms 84:3
verses.text: Yea, the sparrow hath found an house, and the swallow a nest for herself, where she may lay her young, even thine altars, O Lord of hosts, my King, and my God.

verses.name: Psalms 84:4
verses.text: Blessed are they that dwell in thy house: they will be still praising thee. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 84:5
verses.text: Blessed is the man whose strength is in thee; in whose heart are the ways of them.

verses.name: Psalms 84:6
verses.text: Who passing through the valley of Baca make it a well; the rain also filleth the pools.

verses.name: Psalms 84:7
verses.text: They go from strength to strength, every one of them in Zion appeareth before God.

verses.name: Psalms 84:8
verses.text: O Lord God of hosts, hear my prayer: give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 84:9
verses.text: Behold, O God our shield, and look upon the face of thine anointed.

verses.name: Psalms 84:10
verses.text: For a day in thy courts is better than a thousand. I had rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God, than to dwell in the tents of wickedness.

verses.name: Psalms 84:11
verses.text: For the Lord God is a sun and shield: the Lord will give grace and glory: no good thing will he withhold from them that walk uprightly.

verses.name: Psalms 84:12
verses.text: O Lord of hosts, blessed is the man that trusteth in thee.

verses.name: Psalms 85:1
verses.text: Lord, thou hast been favourable unto thy land: thou hast brought back the captivity of Jacob.

verses.name: Psalms 85:2
verses.text: Thou hast forgiven the iniquity of thy people, thou hast covered all their sin. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 85:3
verses.text: Thou hast taken away all thy wrath: thou hast turned thyself from the fierceness of thine anger.

verses.name: Psalms 85:4
verses.text: Turn us, O God of our salvation, and cause thine anger toward us to cease.

verses.name: Psalms 85:5
verses.text: Wilt thou be angry with us for ever? wilt thou draw out thine anger to all generations?

verses.name: Psalms 85:6
verses.text: Wilt thou not revive us again: that thy people may rejoice in thee?

verses.name: Psalms 85:7
verses.text: Shew us thy mercy, O Lord, and grant us thy salvation.

verses.name: Psalms 85:8
verses.text: I will hear what God the Lord will speak: for he will speak peace unto his people, and to his saints: but let them not turn again to folly.

verses.name: Psalms 85:9
verses.text: Surely his salvation is nigh them that fear him; that glory may dwell in our land.

verses.name: Psalms 85:10
verses.text: Mercy and truth are met together; righteousness and peace have kissed each other.

verses.name: Psalms 85:11
verses.text: Truth shall spring out of the earth; and righteousness shall look down from heaven.

verses.name: Psalms 85:12
verses.text: Yea, the Lord shall give that which is good; and our land shall yield her increase.

verses.name: Psalms 85:13
verses.text: Righteousness shall go before him; and shall set us in the way of his steps.

verses.name: Psalms 86:1
verses.text: Bow down thine ear, O Lord, hear me: for I am poor and needy.

verses.name: Psalms 86:2
verses.text: Preserve my soul; for I am holy: O thou my God, save thy servant that trusteth in thee.

verses.name: Psalms 86:3
verses.text: Be merciful unto me, O Lord: for I cry unto thee daily.

verses.name: Psalms 86:4
verses.text: Rejoice the soul of thy servant: for unto thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.

verses.name: Psalms 86:5
verses.text: For thou, Lord, art good, and ready to forgive; and plenteous in mercy unto all them that call upon thee.

verses.name: Psalms 86:6
verses.text: Give ear, O Lord, unto my prayer; and attend to the voice of my supplications.

verses.name: Psalms 86:7
verses.text: In the day of my trouble I will call upon thee: for thou wilt answer me.

verses.name: Psalms 86:8
verses.text: Among the gods there is none like unto thee, O Lord; neither are there any works like unto thy works.

verses.name: Psalms 86:9
verses.text: All nations whom thou hast made shall come and worship before thee, O Lord; and shall glorify thy name.

verses.name: Psalms 86:10
verses.text: For thou art great, and doest wondrous things: thou art God alone.

verses.name: Psalms 86:11
verses.text: Teach me thy way, O Lord; I will walk in thy truth: unite my heart to fear thy name.

verses.name: Psalms 86:12
verses.text: I will praise thee, O Lord my God, with all my heart: and I will glorify thy name for evermore.

verses.name: Psalms 86:13
verses.text: For great is thy mercy toward me: and thou hast delivered my soul from the lowest hell.

verses.name: Psalms 86:14
verses.text: O God, the proud are risen against me, and the assemblies of violent men have sought after my soul; and have not set thee before them.

verses.name: Psalms 86:15
verses.text: But thou, O Lord, art a God full of compassion, and gracious, longsuffering, and plenteous in mercy and truth.

verses.name: Psalms 86:16
verses.text: O turn unto me, and have mercy upon me; give thy strength unto thy servant, and save the son of thine handmaid.

verses.name: Psalms 86:17
verses.text: Shew me a token for good; that they which hate me may see it, and be ashamed: because thou, Lord, hast holpen me, and comforted me.

verses.name: Psalms 87:1
verses.text: His foundation is in the holy mountains.

verses.name: Psalms 87:2
verses.text: The Lord loveth the gates of Zion more than all the dwellings of Jacob.

verses.name: Psalms 87:3
verses.text: Glorious things are spoken of thee, O city of God. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 87:4
verses.text: I will make mention of Rahab and Babylon to them that know me: behold Philistia, and Tyre, with Ethiopia; this man was born there.

verses.name: Psalms 87:5
verses.text: And of Zion it shall be said, This and that man was born in her: and the highest himself shall establish her.

verses.name: Psalms 87:6
verses.text: The Lord shall count, when he writeth up the people, that this man was born there. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 87:7
verses.text: As well the singers as the players on instruments shall be there: all my springs are in thee.

verses.name: Psalms 88:1
verses.text: O Lord God of my salvation, I have cried day and night before thee:

verses.name: Psalms 88:2
verses.text: Let my prayer come before thee: incline thine ear unto my cry;

verses.name: Psalms 88:3
verses.text: For my soul is full of troubles: and my life draweth nigh unto the grave.

verses.name: Psalms 88:4
verses.text: I am counted with them that go down into the pit: I am as a man that hath no strength:

verses.name: Psalms 88:5
verses.text: Free among the dead, like the slain that lie in the grave, whom thou rememberest no more: and they are cut off from thy hand.

verses.name: Psalms 88:6
verses.text: Thou hast laid me in the lowest pit, in darkness, in the deeps.

verses.name: Psalms 88:7
verses.text: Thy wrath lieth hard upon me, and thou hast afflicted me with all thy waves. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 88:8
verses.text: Thou hast put away mine acquaintance far from me; thou hast made me an abomination unto them: I am shut up, and I cannot come forth.

verses.name: Psalms 88:9
verses.text: Mine eye mourneth by reason of affliction: Lord, I have called daily upon thee, I have stretched out my hands unto thee.

verses.name: Psalms 88:10
verses.text: Wilt thou shew wonders to the dead? shall the dead arise and praise thee? Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 88:11
verses.text: Shall thy lovingkindness be declared in the grave? or thy faithfulness in destruction?

verses.name: Psalms 88:12
verses.text: Shall thy wonders be known in the dark? and thy righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?

verses.name: Psalms 88:13
verses.text: But unto thee have I cried, O Lord; and in the morning shall my prayer prevent thee.

verses.name: Psalms 88:14
verses.text: Lord, why castest thou off my soul? why hidest thou thy face from me?

verses.name: Psalms 88:15
verses.text: I am afflicted and ready to die from my youth up: while I suffer thy terrors I am distracted.

verses.name: Psalms 88:16
verses.text: Thy fierce wrath goeth over me; thy terrors have cut me off.

verses.name: Psalms 88:17
verses.text: They came round about me daily like water; they compassed me about together.

verses.name: Psalms 88:18
verses.text: Lover and friend hast thou put far from me, and mine acquaintance into darkness.

verses.name: Psalms 89:1
verses.text: I will sing of the mercies of the Lord for ever: with my mouth will I make known thy faithfulness to all generations.

verses.name: Psalms 89:2
verses.text: For I have said, Mercy shall be built up for ever: thy faithfulness shalt thou establish in the very heavens.

verses.name: Psalms 89:3
verses.text: I have made a covenant with my chosen, I have sworn unto David my servant,

verses.name: Psalms 89:4
verses.text: Thy seed will I establish for ever, and build up thy throne to all generations. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 89:5
verses.text: And the heavens shall praise thy wonders, O Lord: thy faithfulness also in the congregation of the saints.

verses.name: Psalms 89:6
verses.text: For who in the heaven can be compared unto the Lord? who among the sons of the mighty can be likened unto the Lord?

verses.name: Psalms 89:7
verses.text: God is greatly to be feared in the assembly of the saints, and to be had in reverence of all them that are about him.

verses.name: Psalms 89:8
verses.text: O Lord God of hosts, who is a strong Lord like unto thee? or to thy faithfulness round about thee?

verses.name: Psalms 89:9
verses.text: Thou rulest the raging of the sea: when the waves thereof arise, thou stillest them.

verses.name: Psalms 89:10
verses.text: Thou hast broken Rahab in pieces, as one that is slain; thou hast scattered thine enemies with thy strong arm.

verses.name: Psalms 89:11
verses.text: The heavens are thine, the earth also is thine: as for the world and the fulness thereof, thou hast founded them.

verses.name: Psalms 89:12
verses.text: The north and the south thou hast created them: Tabor and Hermon shall rejoice in thy name.

verses.name: Psalms 89:13
verses.text: Thou hast a mighty arm: strong is thy hand, and high is thy right hand.

verses.name: Psalms 89:14
verses.text: Justice and judgment are the habitation of thy throne: mercy and truth shall go before thy face.

verses.name: Psalms 89:15
verses.text: Blessed is the people that know the joyful sound: they shall walk, O Lord, in the light of thy countenance.

verses.name: Psalms 89:16
verses.text: In thy name shall they rejoice all the day: and in thy righteousness shall they be exalted.

verses.name: Psalms 89:17
verses.text: For thou art the glory of their strength: and in thy favour our horn shall be exalted.

verses.name: Psalms 89:18
verses.text: For the Lord is our defence; and the Holy One of Israel is our king.

verses.name: Psalms 89:19
verses.text: Then thou spakest in vision to thy holy one, and saidst, I have laid help upon one that is mighty; I have exalted one chosen out of the people.

verses.name: Psalms 89:20
verses.text: I have found David my servant; with my holy oil have I anointed him:

verses.name: Psalms 89:21
verses.text: With whom my hand shall be established: mine arm also shall strengthen him.

verses.name: Psalms 89:22
verses.text: The enemy shall not exact upon him; nor the son of wickedness afflict him.

verses.name: Psalms 89:23
verses.text: And I will beat down his foes before his face, and plague them that hate him.

verses.name: Psalms 89:24
verses.text: But my faithfulness and my mercy shall be with him: and in my name shall his horn be exalted.

verses.name: Psalms 89:25
verses.text: I will set his hand also in the sea, and his right hand in the rivers.

verses.name: Psalms 89:26
verses.text: He shall cry unto me, Thou art my father, my God, and the rock of my salvation.

verses.name: Psalms 89:27
verses.text: Also I will make him my firstborn, higher than the kings of the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 89:28
verses.text: My mercy will I keep for him for evermore, and my covenant shall stand fast with him.

verses.name: Psalms 89:29
verses.text: His seed also will I make to endure for ever, and his throne as the days of heaven.

verses.name: Psalms 89:30
verses.text: If his children forsake my law, and walk not in my judgments;

verses.name: Psalms 89:31
verses.text: If they break my statutes, and keep not my commandments;

verses.name: Psalms 89:32
verses.text: Then will I visit their transgression with the rod, and their iniquity with stripes.

verses.name: Psalms 89:33
verses.text: Nevertheless my lovingkindness will I not utterly take from him, nor suffer my faithfulness to fail.

verses.name: Psalms 89:34
verses.text: My covenant will I not break, nor alter the thing that is gone out of my lips.

verses.name: Psalms 89:35
verses.text: Once have I sworn by my holiness that I will not lie unto David.

verses.name: Psalms 89:36
verses.text: His seed shall endure for ever, and his throne as the sun before me.

verses.name: Psalms 89:37
verses.text: It shall be established for ever as the moon, and as a faithful witness in heaven. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 89:38
verses.text: But thou hast cast off and abhorred, thou hast been wroth with thine anointed.

verses.name: Psalms 89:39
verses.text: Thou hast made void the covenant of thy servant: thou hast profaned his crown by casting it to the ground.

verses.name: Psalms 89:40
verses.text: Thou hast broken down all his hedges; thou hast brought his strong holds to ruin.

verses.name: Psalms 89:41
verses.text: All that pass by the way spoil him: he is a reproach to his neighbours.

verses.name: Psalms 89:42
verses.text: Thou hast set up the right hand of his adversaries; thou hast made all his enemies to rejoice.

verses.name: Psalms 89:43
verses.text: Thou hast also turned the edge of his sword, and hast not made him to stand in the battle.

verses.name: Psalms 89:44
verses.text: Thou hast made his glory to cease, and cast his throne down to the ground.

verses.name: Psalms 89:45
verses.text: The days of his youth hast thou shortened: thou hast covered him with shame. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 89:46
verses.text: How long, Lord? wilt thou hide thyself for ever? shall thy wrath burn like fire?

verses.name: Psalms 89:47
verses.text: Remember how short my time is: wherefore hast thou made all men in vain?

verses.name: Psalms 89:48
verses.text: What man is he that liveth, and shall not see death? shall he deliver his soul from the hand of the grave? Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 89:49
verses.text: Lord, where are thy former lovingkindnesses, which thou swarest unto David in thy truth?

verses.name: Psalms 89:50
verses.text: Remember, Lord, the reproach of thy servants; how I do bear in my bosom the reproach of all the mighty people;

verses.name: Psalms 89:51
verses.text: Wherewith thine enemies have reproached, O Lord; wherewith they have reproached the footsteps of thine anointed.

verses.name: Psalms 89:52
verses.text: Blessed be the Lord for evermore. Amen, and Amen.

verses.name: Psalms 90:1
verses.text: Lord, thou hast been our dwelling place in all generations.

verses.name: Psalms 90:2
verses.text: Before the mountains were brought forth, or ever thou hadst formed the earth and the world, even from everlasting to everlasting, thou art God.

verses.name: Psalms 90:3
verses.text: Thou turnest man to destruction; and sayest, Return, ye children of men.

verses.name: Psalms 90:4
verses.text: For a thousand years in thy sight are but as yesterday when it is past, and as a watch in the night.

verses.name: Psalms 90:5
verses.text: Thou carriest them away as with a flood; they are as a sleep: in the morning they are like grass which groweth up.

verses.name: Psalms 90:6
verses.text: In the morning it flourisheth, and groweth up; in the evening it is cut down, and withereth.

verses.name: Psalms 90:7
verses.text: For we are consumed by thine anger, and by thy wrath are we troubled.

verses.name: Psalms 90:8
verses.text: Thou hast set our iniquities before thee, our secret sins in the light of thy countenance.

verses.name: Psalms 90:9
verses.text: For all our days are passed away in thy wrath: we spend our years as a tale that is told.

verses.name: Psalms 90:10
verses.text: The days of our years are threescore years and ten; and if by reason of strength they be fourscore years, yet is their strength labour and sorrow; for it is soon cut off, and we fly away.

verses.name: Psalms 90:11
verses.text: Who knoweth the power of thine anger? even according to thy fear, so is thy wrath.

verses.name: Psalms 90:12
verses.text: So teach us to number our days, that we may apply our hearts unto wisdom.

verses.name: Psalms 90:13
verses.text: Return, O Lord, how long? and let it repent thee concerning thy servants.

verses.name: Psalms 90:14
verses.text: O satisfy us early with thy mercy; that we may rejoice and be glad all our days.

verses.name: Psalms 90:15
verses.text: Make us glad according to the days wherein thou hast afflicted us, and the years wherein we have seen evil.

verses.name: Psalms 90:16
verses.text: Let thy work appear unto thy servants, and thy glory unto their children.

verses.name: Psalms 90:17
verses.text: And let the beauty of the Lord our God be upon us: and establish thou the work of our hands upon us; yea, the work of our hands establish thou it.

verses.name: Psalms 91:1
verses.text: He that dwelleth in the secret place of the most High shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty.

verses.name: Psalms 91:2
verses.text: I will say of the Lord, He is my refuge and my fortress: my God; in him will I trust.

verses.name: Psalms 91:3
verses.text: Surely he shall deliver thee from the snare of the fowler, and from the noisome pestilence.

verses.name: Psalms 91:4
verses.text: He shall cover thee with his feathers, and under his wings shalt thou trust: his truth shall be thy shield and buckler.

verses.name: Psalms 91:5
verses.text: Thou shalt not be afraid for the terror by night; nor for the arrow that flieth by day;

verses.name: Psalms 91:6
verses.text: Nor for the pestilence that walketh in darkness; nor for the destruction that wasteth at noonday.

verses.name: Psalms 91:7
verses.text: A thousand shall fall at thy side, and ten thousand at thy right hand; but it shall not come nigh thee.

verses.name: Psalms 91:8
verses.text: Only with thine eyes shalt thou behold and see the reward of the wicked.

verses.name: Psalms 91:9
verses.text: Because thou hast made the Lord, which is my refuge, even the most High, thy habitation;

verses.name: Psalms 91:10
verses.text: There shall no evil befall thee, neither shall any plague come nigh thy dwelling.

verses.name: Psalms 91:11
verses.text: For he shall give his angels charge over thee, to keep thee in all thy ways.

verses.name: Psalms 91:12
verses.text: They shall bear thee up in their hands, lest thou dash thy foot against a stone.

verses.name: Psalms 91:13
verses.text: Thou shalt tread upon the lion and adder: the young lion and the dragon shalt thou trample under feet.

verses.name: Psalms 91:14
verses.text: Because he hath set his love upon me, therefore will I deliver him: I will set him on high, because he hath known my name.

verses.name: Psalms 91:15
verses.text: He shall call upon me, and I will answer him: I will be with him in trouble; I will deliver him, and honour him.

verses.name: Psalms 91:16
verses.text: With long life will I satisfy him, and shew him my salvation.

verses.name: Psalms 92:1
verses.text: It is a good thing to give thanks unto the Lord, and to sing praises unto thy name, O most High:

verses.name: Psalms 92:2
verses.text: To shew forth thy lovingkindness in the morning, and thy faithfulness every night,

verses.name: Psalms 92:3
verses.text: Upon an instrument of ten strings, and upon the psaltery; upon the harp with a solemn sound.

verses.name: Psalms 92:4
verses.text: For thou, Lord, hast made me glad through thy work: I will triumph in the works of thy hands.

verses.name: Psalms 92:5
verses.text: O Lord, how great are thy works! and thy thoughts are very deep.

verses.name: Psalms 92:6
verses.text: A brutish man knoweth not; neither doth a fool understand this.

verses.name: Psalms 92:7
verses.text: When the wicked spring as the grass, and when all the workers of iniquity do flourish; it is that they shall be destroyed for ever:

verses.name: Psalms 92:8
verses.text: But thou, Lord, art most high for evermore.

verses.name: Psalms 92:9
verses.text: For, lo, thine enemies, O Lord, for, lo, thine enemies shall perish; all the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.

verses.name: Psalms 92:10
verses.text: But my horn shalt thou exalt like the horn of an unicorn: I shall be anointed with fresh oil.

verses.name: Psalms 92:11
verses.text: Mine eye also shall see my desire on mine enemies, and mine ears shall hear my desire of the wicked that rise up against me.

verses.name: Psalms 92:12
verses.text: The righteous shall flourish like the palm tree: he shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon.

verses.name: Psalms 92:13
verses.text: Those that be planted in the house of the Lord shall flourish in the courts of our God.

verses.name: Psalms 92:14
verses.text: They shall still bring forth fruit in old age; they shall be fat and flourishing;

verses.name: Psalms 92:15
verses.text: To shew that the Lord is upright: he is my rock, and there is no unrighteousness in him.

verses.name: Psalms 93:1
verses.text: The Lord reigneth, he is clothed with majesty; the Lord is clothed with strength, wherewith he hath girded himself: the world also is stablished, that it cannot be moved.

verses.name: Psalms 93:2
verses.text: Thy throne is established of old: thou art from everlasting.

verses.name: Psalms 93:3
verses.text: The floods have lifted up, O Lord, the floods have lifted up their voice; the floods lift up their waves.

verses.name: Psalms 93:4
verses.text: The Lord on high is mightier than the noise of many waters, yea, than the mighty waves of the sea.

verses.name: Psalms 93:5
verses.text: Thy testimonies are very sure: holiness becometh thine house, O Lord, for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 94:1
verses.text: O Lord God, to whom vengeance belongeth; O God, to whom vengeance belongeth, shew thyself.

verses.name: Psalms 94:2
verses.text: Lift up thyself, thou judge of the earth: render a reward to the proud.

verses.name: Psalms 94:3
verses.text: Lord, how long shall the wicked, how long shall the wicked triumph?

verses.name: Psalms 94:4
verses.text: How long shall they utter and speak hard things? and all the workers of iniquity boast themselves?

verses.name: Psalms 94:5
verses.text: They break in pieces thy people, O Lord, and afflict thine heritage.

verses.name: Psalms 94:6
verses.text: They slay the widow and the stranger, and murder the fatherless.

verses.name: Psalms 94:7
verses.text: Yet they say, The Lord shall not see, neither shall the God of Jacob regard it.

verses.name: Psalms 94:8
verses.text: Understand, ye brutish among the people: and ye fools, when will ye be wise?

verses.name: Psalms 94:9
verses.text: He that planted the ear, shall he not hear? he that formed the eye, shall he not see?

verses.name: Psalms 94:10
verses.text: He that chastiseth the heathen, shall not he correct? he that teacheth man knowledge, shall not he know?

verses.name: Psalms 94:11
verses.text: The Lord knoweth the thoughts of man, that they are vanity.

verses.name: Psalms 94:12
verses.text: Blessed is the man whom thou chastenest, O Lord, and teachest him out of thy law;

verses.name: Psalms 94:13
verses.text: That thou mayest give him rest from the days of adversity, until the pit be digged for the wicked.

verses.name: Psalms 94:14
verses.text: For the Lord will not cast off his people, neither will he forsake his inheritance.

verses.name: Psalms 94:15
verses.text: But judgment shall return unto righteousness: and all the upright in heart shall follow it.

verses.name: Psalms 94:16
verses.text: Who will rise up for me against the evildoers? or who will stand up for me against the workers of iniquity?

verses.name: Psalms 94:17
verses.text: Unless the Lord had been my help, my soul had almost dwelt in silence.

verses.name: Psalms 94:18
verses.text: When I said, My foot slippeth; thy mercy, O Lord, held me up.

verses.name: Psalms 94:19
verses.text: In the multitude of my thoughts within me thy comforts delight my soul.

verses.name: Psalms 94:20
verses.text: Shall the throne of iniquity have fellowship with thee, which frameth mischief by a law?

verses.name: Psalms 94:21
verses.text: They gather themselves together against the soul of the righteous, and condemn the innocent blood.

verses.name: Psalms 94:22
verses.text: But the Lord is my defence; and my God is the rock of my refuge.

verses.name: Psalms 94:23
verses.text: And he shall bring upon them their own iniquity, and shall cut them off in their own wickedness; yea, the Lord our God shall cut them off.

verses.name: Psalms 95:1
verses.text: O come, let us sing unto the Lord: let us make a joyful noise to the rock of our salvation.

verses.name: Psalms 95:2
verses.text: Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving, and make a joyful noise unto him with psalms.

verses.name: Psalms 95:3
verses.text: For the Lord is a great God, and a great King above all gods.

verses.name: Psalms 95:4
verses.text: In his hand are the deep places of the earth: the strength of the hills is his also.

verses.name: Psalms 95:5
verses.text: The sea is his, and he made it: and his hands formed the dry land.

verses.name: Psalms 95:6
verses.text: O come, let us worship and bow down: let us kneel before the Lord our maker.

verses.name: Psalms 95:7
verses.text: For he is our God; and we are the people of his pasture, and the sheep of his hand. To day if ye will hear his voice,

verses.name: Psalms 95:8
verses.text: Harden not your heart, as in the provocation, and as in the day of temptation in the wilderness:

verses.name: Psalms 95:9
verses.text: When your fathers tempted me, proved me, and saw my work.

verses.name: Psalms 95:10
verses.text: Forty years long was I grieved with this generation, and said, It is a people that do err in their heart, and they have not known my ways:

verses.name: Psalms 95:11
verses.text: Unto whom I sware in my wrath that they should not enter into my rest.

verses.name: Psalms 96:1
verses.text: O sing unto the Lord a new song: sing unto the Lord, all the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 96:2
verses.text: Sing unto the Lord, bless his name; shew forth his salvation from day to day.

verses.name: Psalms 96:3
verses.text: Declare his glory among the heathen, his wonders among all people.

verses.name: Psalms 96:4
verses.text: For the Lord is great, and greatly to be praised: he is to be feared above all gods.

verses.name: Psalms 96:5
verses.text: For all the gods of the nations are idols: but the Lord made the heavens.

verses.name: Psalms 96:6
verses.text: Honour and majesty are before him: strength and beauty are in his sanctuary.

verses.name: Psalms 96:7
verses.text: Give unto the Lord, O ye kindreds of the people, give unto the Lord glory and strength.

verses.name: Psalms 96:8
verses.text: Give unto the Lord the glory due unto his name: bring an offering, and come into his courts.

verses.name: Psalms 96:9
verses.text: O worship the Lord in the beauty of holiness: fear before him, all the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 96:10
verses.text: Say among the heathen that the Lord reigneth: the world also shall be established that it shall not be moved: he shall judge the people righteously.

verses.name: Psalms 96:11
verses.text: Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad; let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof.

verses.name: Psalms 96:12
verses.text: Let the field be joyful, and all that is therein: then shall all the trees of the wood rejoice

verses.name: Psalms 96:13
verses.text: Before the Lord: for he cometh, for he cometh to judge the earth: he shall judge the world with righteousness, and the people with his truth.

verses.name: Psalms 97:1
verses.text: The Lord reigneth; let the earth rejoice; let the multitude of isles be glad thereof.

verses.name: Psalms 97:2
verses.text: Clouds and darkness are round about him: righteousness and judgment are the habitation of his throne.

verses.name: Psalms 97:3
verses.text: A fire goeth before him, and burneth up his enemies round about.

verses.name: Psalms 97:4
verses.text: His lightnings enlightened the world: the earth saw, and trembled.

verses.name: Psalms 97:5
verses.text: The hills melted like wax at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.

verses.name: Psalms 97:6
verses.text: The heavens declare his righteousness, and all the people see his glory.

verses.name: Psalms 97:7
verses.text: Confounded be all they that serve graven images, that boast themselves of idols: worship him, all ye gods.

verses.name: Psalms 97:8
verses.text: Zion heard, and was glad; and the daughters of Judah rejoiced because of thy judgments, O Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 97:9
verses.text: For thou, Lord, art high above all the earth: thou art exalted far above all gods.

verses.name: Psalms 97:10
verses.text: Ye that love the Lord, hate evil: he preserveth the souls of his saints; he delivereth them out of the hand of the wicked.

verses.name: Psalms 97:11
verses.text: Light is sown for the righteous, and gladness for the upright in heart.

verses.name: Psalms 97:12
verses.text: Rejoice in the Lord, ye righteous; and give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness.

verses.name: Psalms 98:1
verses.text: O sing unto the Lord a new song; for he hath done marvellous things: his right hand, and his holy arm, hath gotten him the victory.

verses.name: Psalms 98:2
verses.text: The Lord hath made known his salvation: his righteousness hath he openly shewed in the sight of the heathen.

verses.name: Psalms 98:3
verses.text: He hath remembered his mercy and his truth toward the house of Israel: all the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.

verses.name: Psalms 98:4
verses.text: Make a joyful noise unto the Lord, all the earth: make a loud noise, and rejoice, and sing praise.

verses.name: Psalms 98:5
verses.text: Sing unto the Lord with the harp; with the harp, and the voice of a psalm.

verses.name: Psalms 98:6
verses.text: With trumpets and sound of cornet make a joyful noise before the Lord, the King.

verses.name: Psalms 98:7
verses.text: Let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof; the world, and they that dwell therein.

verses.name: Psalms 98:8
verses.text: Let the floods clap their hands: let the hills be joyful together

verses.name: Psalms 98:9
verses.text: Before the Lord; for he cometh to judge the earth: with righteousness shall he judge the world, and the people with equity.

verses.name: Psalms 99:1
verses.text: The Lord reigneth; let the people tremble: he sitteth between the cherubims; let the earth be moved.

verses.name: Psalms 99:2
verses.text: The Lord is great in Zion; and he is high above all the people.

verses.name: Psalms 99:3
verses.text: Let them praise thy great and terrible name; for it is holy.

verses.name: Psalms 99:4
verses.text: The king’s strength also loveth judgment; thou dost establish equity, thou executest judgment and righteousness in Jacob.

verses.name: Psalms 99:5
verses.text: Exalt ye the Lord our God, and worship at his footstool; for he is holy.

verses.name: Psalms 99:6
verses.text: Moses and Aaron among his priests, and Samuel among them that call upon his name; they called upon the Lord, and he answered them.

verses.name: Psalms 99:7
verses.text: He spake unto them in the cloudy pillar: they kept his testimonies, and the ordinance that he gave them.

verses.name: Psalms 99:8
verses.text: Thou answeredst them, O Lord our God: thou wast a God that forgavest them, though thou tookest vengeance of their inventions.

verses.name: Psalms 99:9
verses.text: Exalt the Lord our God, and worship at his holy hill; for the Lord our God is holy.

verses.name: Psalms 100:1
verses.text: Make a joyful noise unto the Lord, all ye lands.

verses.name: Psalms 100:2
verses.text: Serve the Lord with gladness: come before his presence with singing.

verses.name: Psalms 100:3
verses.text: Know ye that the Lord he is God: it is he that hath made us, and not we ourselves; we are his people, and the sheep of his pasture.

verses.name: Psalms 100:4
verses.text: Enter into his gates with thanksgiving, and into his courts with praise: be thankful unto him, and bless his name.

verses.name: Psalms 100:5
verses.text: For the Lord is good; his mercy is everlasting; and his truth endureth to all generations.

verses.name: Psalms 101:1
verses.text: I will sing of mercy and judgment: unto thee, O Lord, will I sing.

verses.name: Psalms 101:2
verses.text: I will behave myself wisely in a perfect way. O when wilt thou come unto me? I will walk within my house with a perfect heart.

verses.name: Psalms 101:3
verses.text: I will set no wicked thing before mine eyes: I hate the work of them that turn aside; it shall not cleave to me.

verses.name: Psalms 101:4
verses.text: A froward heart shall depart from me: I will not know a wicked person.

verses.name: Psalms 101:5
verses.text: Whoso privily slandereth his neighbour, him will I cut off: him that hath an high look and a proud heart will not I suffer.

verses.name: Psalms 101:6
verses.text: Mine eyes shall be upon the faithful of the land, that they may dwell with me: he that walketh in a perfect way, he shall serve me.

verses.name: Psalms 101:7
verses.text: He that worketh deceit shall not dwell within my house: he that telleth lies shall not tarry in my sight.

verses.name: Psalms 101:8
verses.text: I will early destroy all the wicked of the land; that I may cut off all wicked doers from the city of the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 102:1
verses.text: Hear my prayer, O Lord, and let my cry come unto thee.

verses.name: Psalms 102:2
verses.text: Hide not thy face from me in the day when I am in trouble; incline thine ear unto me: in the day when I call answer me speedily.

verses.name: Psalms 102:3
verses.text: For my days are consumed like smoke, and my bones are burned as an hearth.

verses.name: Psalms 102:4
verses.text: My heart is smitten, and withered like grass; so that I forget to eat my bread.

verses.name: Psalms 102:5
verses.text: By reason of the voice of my groaning my bones cleave to my skin.

verses.name: Psalms 102:6
verses.text: I am like a pelican of the wilderness: I am like an owl of the desert.

verses.name: Psalms 102:7
verses.text: I watch, and am as a sparrow alone upon the house top.

verses.name: Psalms 102:8
verses.text: Mine enemies reproach me all the day; and they that are mad against me are sworn against me.

verses.name: Psalms 102:9
verses.text: For I have eaten ashes like bread, and mingled my drink with weeping,

verses.name: Psalms 102:10
verses.text: Because of thine indignation and thy wrath: for thou hast lifted me up, and cast me down.

verses.name: Psalms 102:11
verses.text: My days are like a shadow that declineth; and I am withered like grass.

verses.name: Psalms 102:12
verses.text: But thou, O Lord, shalt endure for ever; and thy remembrance unto all generations.

verses.name: Psalms 102:13
verses.text: Thou shalt arise, and have mercy upon Zion: for the time to favour her, yea, the set time, is come.

verses.name: Psalms 102:14
verses.text: For thy servants take pleasure in her stones, and favour the dust thereof.

verses.name: Psalms 102:15
verses.text: So the heathen shall fear the name of the Lord, and all the kings of the earth thy glory.

verses.name: Psalms 102:16
verses.text: When the Lord shall build up Zion, he shall appear in his glory.

verses.name: Psalms 102:17
verses.text: He will regard the prayer of the destitute, and not despise their prayer.

verses.name: Psalms 102:18
verses.text: This shall be written for the generation to come: and the people which shall be created shall praise the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 102:19
verses.text: For he hath looked down from the height of his sanctuary; from heaven did the Lord behold the earth;

verses.name: Psalms 102:20
verses.text: To hear the groaning of the prisoner; to loose those that are appointed to death;

verses.name: Psalms 102:21
verses.text: To declare the name of the Lord in Zion, and his praise in Jerusalem;

verses.name: Psalms 102:22
verses.text: When the people are gathered together, and the kingdoms, to serve the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 102:23
verses.text: He weakened my strength in the way; he shortened my days.

verses.name: Psalms 102:24
verses.text: I said, O my God, take me not away in the midst of my days: thy years are throughout all generations.

verses.name: Psalms 102:25
verses.text: Of old hast thou laid the foundation of the earth: and the heavens are the work of thy hands.

verses.name: Psalms 102:26
verses.text: They shall perish, but thou shalt endure: yea, all of them shall wax old like a garment; as a vesture shalt thou change them, and they shall be changed:

verses.name: Psalms 102:27
verses.text: But thou art the same, and thy years shall have no end.

verses.name: Psalms 102:28
verses.text: The children of thy servants shall continue, and their seed shall be established before thee.

verses.name: Psalms 103:1
verses.text: Bless the Lord, O my soul: and all that is within me, bless his holy name.

verses.name: Psalms 103:2
verses.text: Bless the Lord, O my soul, and forget not all his benefits:

verses.name: Psalms 103:3
verses.text: Who forgiveth all thine iniquities; who healeth all thy diseases;

verses.name: Psalms 103:4
verses.text: Who redeemeth thy life from destruction; who crowneth thee with lovingkindness and tender mercies;

verses.name: Psalms 103:5
verses.text: Who satisfieth thy mouth with good things; so that thy youth is renewed like the eagle’s.

verses.name: Psalms 103:6
verses.text: The Lord executeth righteousness and judgment for all that are oppressed.

verses.name: Psalms 103:7
verses.text: He made known his ways unto Moses, his acts unto the children of Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 103:8
verses.text: The Lord is merciful and gracious, slow to anger, and plenteous in mercy.

verses.name: Psalms 103:9
verses.text: He will not always chide: neither will he keep his anger for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 103:10
verses.text: He hath not dealt with us after our sins; nor rewarded us according to our iniquities.

verses.name: Psalms 103:11
verses.text: For as the heaven is high above the earth, so great is his mercy toward them that fear him.

verses.name: Psalms 103:12
verses.text: As far as the east is from the west, so far hath he removed our transgressions from us.

verses.name: Psalms 103:13
verses.text: Like as a father pitieth his children, so the Lord pitieth them that fear him.

verses.name: Psalms 103:14
verses.text: For he knoweth our frame; he remembereth that we are dust.

verses.name: Psalms 103:15
verses.text: As for man, his days are as grass: as a flower of the field, so he flourisheth.

verses.name: Psalms 103:16
verses.text: For the wind passeth over it, and it is gone; and the place thereof shall know it no more.

verses.name: Psalms 103:17
verses.text: But the mercy of the Lord is from everlasting to everlasting upon them that fear him, and his righteousness unto children’s children;

verses.name: Psalms 103:18
verses.text: To such as keep his covenant, and to those that remember his commandments to do them.

verses.name: Psalms 103:19
verses.text: The Lord hath prepared his throne in the heavens; and his kingdom ruleth over all.

verses.name: Psalms 103:20
verses.text: Bless the Lord, ye his angels, that excel in strength, that do his commandments, hearkening unto the voice of his word.

verses.name: Psalms 103:21
verses.text: Bless ye the Lord, all ye his hosts; ye ministers of his, that do his pleasure.

verses.name: Psalms 103:22
verses.text: Bless the Lord, all his works in all places of his dominion: bless the Lord, O my soul.

verses.name: Psalms 104:1
verses.text: Bless the Lord, O my soul. O Lord my God, thou art very great; thou art clothed with honour and majesty.

verses.name: Psalms 104:2
verses.text: Who coverest thyself with light as with a garment: who stretchest out the heavens like a curtain:

verses.name: Psalms 104:3
verses.text: Who layeth the beams of his chambers in the waters: who maketh the clouds his chariot: who walketh upon the wings of the wind:

verses.name: Psalms 104:4
verses.text: Who maketh his angels spirits; his ministers a flaming fire:

verses.name: Psalms 104:5
verses.text: Who laid the foundations of the earth, that it should not be removed for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 104:6
verses.text: Thou coveredst it with the deep as with a garment: the waters stood above the mountains.

verses.name: Psalms 104:7
verses.text: At thy rebuke they fled; at the voice of thy thunder they hasted away.

verses.name: Psalms 104:8
verses.text: They go up by the mountains; they go down by the valleys unto the place which thou hast founded for them.

verses.name: Psalms 104:9
verses.text: Thou hast set a bound that they may not pass over; that they turn not again to cover the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 104:10
verses.text: He sendeth the springs into the valleys, which run among the hills.

verses.name: Psalms 104:11
verses.text: They give drink to every beast of the field: the wild asses quench their thirst.

verses.name: Psalms 104:12
verses.text: By them shall the fowls of the heaven have their habitation, which sing among the branches.

verses.name: Psalms 104:13
verses.text: He watereth the hills from his chambers: the earth is satisfied with the fruit of thy works.

verses.name: Psalms 104:14
verses.text: He causeth the grass to grow for the cattle, and herb for the service of man: that he may bring forth food out of the earth;

verses.name: Psalms 104:15
verses.text: And wine that maketh glad the heart of man, and oil to make his face to shine, and bread which strengtheneth man’s heart.

verses.name: Psalms 104:16
verses.text: The trees of the Lord are full of sap; the cedars of Lebanon, which he hath planted;

verses.name: Psalms 104:17
verses.text: Where the birds make their nests: as for the stork, the fir trees are her house.

verses.name: Psalms 104:18
verses.text: The high hills are a refuge for the wild goats; and the rocks for the conies.

verses.name: Psalms 104:19
verses.text: He appointed the moon for seasons: the sun knoweth his going down.

verses.name: Psalms 104:20
verses.text: Thou makest darkness, and it is night: wherein all the beasts of the forest do creep forth.

verses.name: Psalms 104:21
verses.text: The young lions roar after their prey, and seek their meat from God.

verses.name: Psalms 104:22
verses.text: The sun ariseth, they gather themselves together, and lay them down in their dens.

verses.name: Psalms 104:23
verses.text: Man goeth forth unto his work and to his labour until the evening.

verses.name: Psalms 104:24
verses.text: O Lord, how manifold are thy works! in wisdom hast thou made them all: the earth is full of thy riches.

verses.name: Psalms 104:25
verses.text: So is this great and wide sea, wherein are things creeping innumerable, both small and great beasts.

verses.name: Psalms 104:26
verses.text: There go the ships: there is that leviathan, whom thou hast made to play therein.

verses.name: Psalms 104:27
verses.text: These wait all upon thee; that thou mayest give them their meat in due season.

verses.name: Psalms 104:28
verses.text: That thou givest them they gather: thou openest thine hand, they are filled with good.

verses.name: Psalms 104:29
verses.text: Thou hidest thy face, they are troubled: thou takest away their breath, they die, and return to their dust.

verses.name: Psalms 104:30
verses.text: Thou sendest forth thy spirit, they are created: and thou renewest the face of the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 104:31
verses.text: The glory of the Lord shall endure for ever: the Lord shall rejoice in his works.

verses.name: Psalms 104:32
verses.text: He looketh on the earth, and it trembleth: he toucheth the hills, and they smoke.

verses.name: Psalms 104:33
verses.text: I will sing unto the Lord as long as I live: I will sing praise to my God while I have my being.

verses.name: Psalms 104:34
verses.text: My meditation of him shall be sweet: I will be glad in the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 104:35
verses.text: Let the sinners be consumed out of the earth, and let the wicked be no more. Bless thou the Lord, O my soul. Praise ye the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 105:1
verses.text: O give thanks unto the Lord; call upon his name: make known his deeds among the people.

verses.name: Psalms 105:2
verses.text: Sing unto him, sing psalms unto him: talk ye of all his wondrous works.

verses.name: Psalms 105:3
verses.text: Glory ye in his holy name: let the heart of them rejoice that seek the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 105:4
verses.text: Seek the Lord, and his strength: seek his face evermore.

verses.name: Psalms 105:5
verses.text: Remember his marvellous works that he hath done; his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth;

verses.name: Psalms 105:6
verses.text: O ye seed of Abraham his servant, ye children of Jacob his chosen.

verses.name: Psalms 105:7
verses.text: He is the Lord our God: his judgments are in all the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 105:8
verses.text: He hath remembered his covenant for ever, the word which he commanded to a thousand generations.

verses.name: Psalms 105:9
verses.text: Which covenant he made with Abraham, and his oath unto Isaac;

verses.name: Psalms 105:10
verses.text: And confirmed the same unto Jacob for a law, and to Israel for an everlasting covenant:

verses.name: Psalms 105:11
verses.text: Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance:

verses.name: Psalms 105:12
verses.text: When they were but a few men in number; yea, very few, and strangers in it.

verses.name: Psalms 105:13
verses.text: When they went from one nation to another, from one kingdom to another people;

verses.name: Psalms 105:14
verses.text: He suffered no man to do them wrong: yea, he reproved kings for their sakes;

verses.name: Psalms 105:15
verses.text: Saying, Touch not mine anointed, and do my prophets no harm.

verses.name: Psalms 105:16
verses.text: Moreover he called for a famine upon the land: he brake the whole staff of bread.

verses.name: Psalms 105:17
verses.text: He sent a man before them, even Joseph, who was sold for a servant:

verses.name: Psalms 105:18
verses.text: Whose feet they hurt with fetters: he was laid in iron:

verses.name: Psalms 105:19
verses.text: Until the time that his word came: the word of the Lord tried him.

verses.name: Psalms 105:20
verses.text: The king sent and loosed him; even the ruler of the people, and let him go free.

verses.name: Psalms 105:21
verses.text: He made him lord of his house, and ruler of all his substance:

verses.name: Psalms 105:22
verses.text: To bind his princes at his pleasure; and teach his senators wisdom.

verses.name: Psalms 105:23
verses.text: Israel also came into Egypt; and Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.

verses.name: Psalms 105:24
verses.text: And he increased his people greatly; and made them stronger than their enemies.

verses.name: Psalms 105:25
verses.text: He turned their heart to hate his people, to deal subtilly with his servants.

verses.name: Psalms 105:26
verses.text: He sent Moses his servant; and Aaron whom he had chosen.

verses.name: Psalms 105:27
verses.text: They shewed his signs among them, and wonders in the land of Ham.

verses.name: Psalms 105:28
verses.text: He sent darkness, and made it dark; and they rebelled not against his word.

verses.name: Psalms 105:29
verses.text: He turned their waters into blood, and slew their fish.

verses.name: Psalms 105:30
verses.text: Their land brought forth frogs in abundance, in the chambers of their kings.

verses.name: Psalms 105:31
verses.text: He spake, and there came divers sorts of flies, and lice in all their coasts.

verses.name: Psalms 105:32
verses.text: He gave them hail for rain, and flaming fire in their land.

verses.name: Psalms 105:33
verses.text: He smote their vines also and their fig trees; and brake the trees of their coasts.

verses.name: Psalms 105:34
verses.text: He spake, and the locusts came, and caterpillers, and that without number,

verses.name: Psalms 105:35
verses.text: And did eat up all the herbs in their land, and devoured the fruit of their ground.

verses.name: Psalms 105:36
verses.text: He smote also all the firstborn in their land, the chief of all their strength.

verses.name: Psalms 105:37
verses.text: He brought them forth also with silver and gold: and there was not one feeble person among their tribes.

verses.name: Psalms 105:38
verses.text: Egypt was glad when they departed: for the fear of them fell upon them.

verses.name: Psalms 105:39
verses.text: He spread a cloud for a covering; and fire to give light in the night.

verses.name: Psalms 105:40
verses.text: The people asked, and he brought quails, and satisfied them with the bread of heaven.

verses.name: Psalms 105:41
verses.text: He opened the rock, and the waters gushed out; they ran in the dry places like a river.

verses.name: Psalms 105:42
verses.text: For he remembered his holy promise, and Abraham his servant.

verses.name: Psalms 105:43
verses.text: And he brought forth his people with joy, and his chosen with gladness:

verses.name: Psalms 105:44
verses.text: And gave them the lands of the heathen: and they inherited the labour of the people;

verses.name: Psalms 105:45
verses.text: That they might observe his statutes, and keep his laws. Praise ye the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 106:1
verses.text: Praise ye the Lord. O give thanks unto the Lord; for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 106:2
verses.text: Who can utter the mighty acts of the Lord? who can shew forth all his praise?

verses.name: Psalms 106:3
verses.text: Blessed are they that keep judgment, and he that doeth righteousness at all times.

verses.name: Psalms 106:4
verses.text: Remember me, O Lord, with the favour that thou bearest unto thy people: O visit me with thy salvation;

verses.name: Psalms 106:5
verses.text: That I may see the good of thy chosen, that I may rejoice in the gladness of thy nation, that I may glory with thine inheritance.

verses.name: Psalms 106:6
verses.text: We have sinned with our fathers, we have committed iniquity, we have done wickedly.

verses.name: Psalms 106:7
verses.text: Our fathers understood not thy wonders in Egypt; they remembered not the multitude of thy mercies; but provoked him at the sea, even at the Red sea.

verses.name: Psalms 106:8
verses.text: Nevertheless he saved them for his name’s sake, that he might make his mighty power to be known.

verses.name: Psalms 106:9
verses.text: He rebuked the Red sea also, and it was dried up: so he led them through the depths, as through the wilderness.

verses.name: Psalms 106:10
verses.text: And he saved them from the hand of him that hated them, and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.

verses.name: Psalms 106:11
verses.text: And the waters covered their enemies: there was not one of them left.

verses.name: Psalms 106:12
verses.text: Then believed they his words; they sang his praise.

verses.name: Psalms 106:13
verses.text: They soon forgat his works; they waited not for his counsel:

verses.name: Psalms 106:14
verses.text: But lusted exceedingly in the wilderness, and tempted God in the desert.

verses.name: Psalms 106:15
verses.text: And he gave them their request; but sent leanness into their soul.

verses.name: Psalms 106:16
verses.text: They envied Moses also in the camp, and Aaron the saint of the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 106:17
verses.text: The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan, and covered the company of Abiram.

verses.name: Psalms 106:18
verses.text: And a fire was kindled in their company; the flame burned up the wicked.

verses.name: Psalms 106:19
verses.text: They made a calf in Horeb, and worshipped the molten image.

verses.name: Psalms 106:20
verses.text: Thus they changed their glory into the similitude of an ox that eateth grass.

verses.name: Psalms 106:21
verses.text: They forgat God their saviour, which had done great things in Egypt;

verses.name: Psalms 106:22
verses.text: Wondrous works in the land of Ham, and terrible things by the Red sea.

verses.name: Psalms 106:23
verses.text: Therefore he said that he would destroy them, had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach, to turn away his wrath, lest he should destroy them.

verses.name: Psalms 106:24
verses.text: Yea, they despised the pleasant land, they believed not his word:

verses.name: Psalms 106:25
verses.text: But murmured in their tents, and hearkened not unto the voice of the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 106:26
verses.text: Therefore he lifted up his hand against them, to overthrow them in the wilderness:

verses.name: Psalms 106:27
verses.text: To overthrow their seed also among the nations, and to scatter them in the lands.

verses.name: Psalms 106:28
verses.text: They joined themselves also unto Baal–peor, and ate the sacrifices of the dead.

verses.name: Psalms 106:29
verses.text: Thus they provoked him to anger with their inventions: and the plague brake in upon them.

verses.name: Psalms 106:30
verses.text: Then stood up Phinehas, and executed judgment: and so the plague was stayed.

verses.name: Psalms 106:31
verses.text: And that was counted unto him for righteousness unto all generations for evermore.

verses.name: Psalms 106:32
verses.text: They angered him also at the waters of strife, so that it went ill with Moses for their sakes:

verses.name: Psalms 106:33
verses.text: Because they provoked his spirit, so that he spake unadvisedly with his lips.

verses.name: Psalms 106:34
verses.text: They did not destroy the nations, concerning whom the Lord commanded them:

verses.name: Psalms 106:35
verses.text: But were mingled among the heathen, and learned their works.

verses.name: Psalms 106:36
verses.text: And they served their idols: which were a snare unto them.

verses.name: Psalms 106:37
verses.text: Yea, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters unto devils,

verses.name: Psalms 106:38
verses.text: And shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters, whom they sacrificed unto the idols of Canaan: and the land was polluted with blood.

verses.name: Psalms 106:39
verses.text: Thus were they defiled with their own works, and went a whoring with their own inventions.

verses.name: Psalms 106:40
verses.text: Therefore was the wrath of the Lord kindled against his people, insomuch that he abhorred his own inheritance.

verses.name: Psalms 106:41
verses.text: And he gave them into the hand of the heathen; and they that hated them ruled over them.

verses.name: Psalms 106:42
verses.text: Their enemies also oppressed them, and they were brought into subjection under their hand.

verses.name: Psalms 106:43
verses.text: Many times did he deliver them; but they provoked him with their counsel, and were brought low for their iniquity.

verses.name: Psalms 106:44
verses.text: Nevertheless he regarded their affliction, when he heard their cry:

verses.name: Psalms 106:45
verses.text: And he remembered for them his covenant, and repented according to the multitude of his mercies.

verses.name: Psalms 106:46
verses.text: He made them also to be pitied of all those that carried them captives.

verses.name: Psalms 106:47
verses.text: Save us, O Lord our God, and gather us from among the heathen, to give thanks unto thy holy name, and to triumph in thy praise.

verses.name: Psalms 106:48
verses.text: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel from everlasting to everlasting: and let all the people say, Amen. Praise ye the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 107:1
verses.text: O give thanks unto the Lord, for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 107:2
verses.text: Let the redeemed of the Lord say so, whom he hath redeemed from the hand of the enemy;

verses.name: Psalms 107:3
verses.text: And gathered them out of the lands, from the east, and from the west, from the north, and from the south.

verses.name: Psalms 107:4
verses.text: They wandered in the wilderness in a solitary way; they found no city to dwell in.

verses.name: Psalms 107:5
verses.text: Hungry and thirsty, their soul fainted in them.

verses.name: Psalms 107:6
verses.text: Then they cried unto the Lord in their trouble, and he delivered them out of their distresses.

verses.name: Psalms 107:7
verses.text: And he led them forth by the right way, that they might go to a city of habitation.

verses.name: Psalms 107:8
verses.text: Oh that men would praise the Lord for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!

verses.name: Psalms 107:9
verses.text: For he satisfieth the longing soul, and filleth the hungry soul with goodness.

verses.name: Psalms 107:10
verses.text: Such as sit in darkness and in the shadow of death, being bound in affliction and iron;

verses.name: Psalms 107:11
verses.text: Because they rebelled against the words of God, and contemned the counsel of the most High:

verses.name: Psalms 107:12
verses.text: Therefore he brought down their heart with labour; they fell down, and there was none to help.

verses.name: Psalms 107:13
verses.text: Then they cried unto the Lord in their trouble, and he saved them out of their distresses.

verses.name: Psalms 107:14
verses.text: He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death, and brake their bands in sunder.

verses.name: Psalms 107:15
verses.text: Oh that men would praise the Lord for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!

verses.name: Psalms 107:16
verses.text: For he hath broken the gates of brass, and cut the bars of iron in sunder.

verses.name: Psalms 107:17
verses.text: Fools because of their transgression, and because of their iniquities, are afflicted.

verses.name: Psalms 107:18
verses.text: Their soul abhorreth all manner of meat; and they draw near unto the gates of death.

verses.name: Psalms 107:19
verses.text: Then they cry unto the Lord in their trouble, and he saveth them out of their distresses.

verses.name: Psalms 107:20
verses.text: He sent his word, and healed them, and delivered them from their destructions.

verses.name: Psalms 107:21
verses.text: Oh that men would praise the Lord for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!

verses.name: Psalms 107:22
verses.text: And let them sacrifice the sacrifices of thanksgiving, and declare his works with rejoicing.

verses.name: Psalms 107:23
verses.text: They that go down to the sea in ships, that do business in great waters;

verses.name: Psalms 107:24
verses.text: These see the works of the Lord, and his wonders in the deep.

verses.name: Psalms 107:25
verses.text: For he commandeth, and raiseth the stormy wind, which lifteth up the waves thereof.

verses.name: Psalms 107:26
verses.text: They mount up to the heaven, they go down again to the depths: their soul is melted because of trouble.

verses.name: Psalms 107:27
verses.text: They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man, and are at their wits’ end.

verses.name: Psalms 107:28
verses.text: Then they cry unto the Lord in their trouble, and he bringeth them out of their distresses.

verses.name: Psalms 107:29
verses.text: He maketh the storm a calm, so that the waves thereof are still.

verses.name: Psalms 107:30
verses.text: Then are they glad because they be quiet; so he bringeth them unto their desired haven.

verses.name: Psalms 107:31
verses.text: Oh that men would praise the Lord for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!

verses.name: Psalms 107:32
verses.text: Let them exalt him also in the congregation of the people, and praise him in the assembly of the elders.

verses.name: Psalms 107:33
verses.text: He turneth rivers into a wilderness, and the watersprings into dry ground;

verses.name: Psalms 107:34
verses.text: A fruitful land into barrenness, for the wickedness of them that dwell therein.

verses.name: Psalms 107:35
verses.text: He turneth the wilderness into a standing water, and dry ground into watersprings.

verses.name: Psalms 107:36
verses.text: And there he maketh the hungry to dwell, that they may prepare a city for habitation;

verses.name: Psalms 107:37
verses.text: And sow the fields, and plant vineyards, which may yield fruits of increase.

verses.name: Psalms 107:38
