verses.text: He blesseth them also, so that they are multiplied greatly; and suffereth not their cattle to decrease.

verses.name: Psalms 107:39
verses.text: Again, they are minished and brought low through oppression, affliction, and sorrow.

verses.name: Psalms 107:40
verses.text: He poureth contempt upon princes, and causeth them to wander in the wilderness, where there is no way.

verses.name: Psalms 107:41
verses.text: Yet setteth he the poor on high from affliction, and maketh him families like a flock.

verses.name: Psalms 107:42
verses.text: The righteous shall see it, and rejoice: and all iniquity shall stop her mouth.

verses.name: Psalms 107:43
verses.text: Whoso is wise, and will observe these things, even they shall understand the lovingkindness of the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 108:1
verses.text: O God, my heart is fixed; I will sing and give praise, even with my glory.

verses.name: Psalms 108:2
verses.text: Awake, psaltery and harp: I myself will awake early.

verses.name: Psalms 108:3
verses.text: I will praise thee, O Lord, among the people: and I will sing praises unto thee among the nations.

verses.name: Psalms 108:4
verses.text: For thy mercy is great above the heavens: and thy truth reacheth unto the clouds.

verses.name: Psalms 108:5
verses.text: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens: and thy glory above all the earth;

verses.name: Psalms 108:6
verses.text: That thy beloved may be delivered: save with thy right hand, and answer me.

verses.name: Psalms 108:7
verses.text: God hath spoken in his holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.

verses.name: Psalms 108:8
verses.text: Gilead is mine; Manasseh is mine; Ephraim also is the strength of mine head; Judah is my lawgiver;

verses.name: Psalms 108:9
verses.text: Moab is my washpot; over Edom will I cast out my shoe; over Philistia will I triumph.

verses.name: Psalms 108:10
verses.text: Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me into Edom?

verses.name: Psalms 108:11
verses.text: Wilt not thou, O God, who hast cast us off? and wilt not thou, O God, go forth with our hosts?

verses.name: Psalms 108:12
verses.text: Give us help from trouble: for vain is the help of man.

verses.name: Psalms 108:13
verses.text: Through God we shall do valiantly: for he it is that shall tread down our enemies.

verses.name: Psalms 109:1
verses.text: Hold not thy peace, O God of my praise;

verses.name: Psalms 109:2
verses.text: For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful are opened against me: they have spoken against me with a lying tongue.

verses.name: Psalms 109:3
verses.text: They compassed me about also with words of hatred; and fought against me without a cause.

verses.name: Psalms 109:4
verses.text: For my love they are my adversaries: but I give myself unto prayer.

verses.name: Psalms 109:5
verses.text: And they have rewarded me evil for good, and hatred for my love.

verses.name: Psalms 109:6
verses.text: Set thou a wicked man over him: and let Satan stand at his right hand.

verses.name: Psalms 109:7
verses.text: When he shall be judged, let him be condemned: and let his prayer become sin.

verses.name: Psalms 109:8
verses.text: Let his days be few; and let another take his office.

verses.name: Psalms 109:9
verses.text: Let his children be fatherless, and his wife a widow.

verses.name: Psalms 109:10
verses.text: Let his children be continually vagabonds, and beg: let them seek their bread also out of their desolate places.

verses.name: Psalms 109:11
verses.text: Let the extortioner catch all that he hath; and let the strangers spoil his labour.

verses.name: Psalms 109:12
verses.text: Let there be none to extend mercy unto him: neither let there be any to favour his fatherless children.

verses.name: Psalms 109:13
verses.text: Let his posterity be cut off; and in the generation following let their name be blotted out.

verses.name: Psalms 109:14
verses.text: Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with the Lord; and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.

verses.name: Psalms 109:15
verses.text: Let them be before the Lord continually, that he may cut off the memory of them from the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 109:16
verses.text: Because that he remembered not to shew mercy, but persecuted the poor and needy man, that he might even slay the broken in heart.

verses.name: Psalms 109:17
verses.text: As he loved cursing, so let it come unto him: as he delighted not in blessing, so let it be far from him.

verses.name: Psalms 109:18
verses.text: As he clothed himself with cursing like as with his garment, so let it come into his bowels like water, and like oil into his bones.

verses.name: Psalms 109:19
verses.text: Let it be unto him as the garment which covereth him, and for a girdle wherewith he is girded continually.

verses.name: Psalms 109:20
verses.text: Let this be the reward of mine adversaries from the Lord, and of them that speak evil against my soul.

verses.name: Psalms 109:21
verses.text: But do thou for me, O God the Lord, for thy name’s sake: because thy mercy is good, deliver thou me.

verses.name: Psalms 109:22
verses.text: For I am poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.

verses.name: Psalms 109:23
verses.text: I am gone like the shadow when it declineth: I am tossed up and down as the locust.

verses.name: Psalms 109:24
verses.text: My knees are weak through fasting; and my flesh faileth of fatness.

verses.name: Psalms 109:25
verses.text: I became also a reproach unto them: when they looked upon me they shaked their heads.

verses.name: Psalms 109:26
verses.text: Help me, O Lord my God: O save me according to thy mercy:

verses.name: Psalms 109:27
verses.text: That they may know that this is thy hand; that thou, Lord, hast done it.

verses.name: Psalms 109:28
verses.text: Let them curse, but bless thou: when they arise, let them be ashamed; but let thy servant rejoice.

verses.name: Psalms 109:29
verses.text: Let mine adversaries be clothed with shame, and let them cover themselves with their own confusion, as with a mantle.

verses.name: Psalms 109:30
verses.text: I will greatly praise the Lord with my mouth; yea, I will praise him among the multitude.

verses.name: Psalms 109:31
verses.text: For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor, to save him from those that condemn his soul.

verses.name: Psalms 110:1
verses.text: The Lord said unto my Lord, Sit thou at my right hand, until I make thine enemies thy footstool.

verses.name: Psalms 110:2
verses.text: The Lord shall send the rod of thy strength out of Zion: rule thou in the midst of thine enemies.

verses.name: Psalms 110:3
verses.text: Thy people shall be willing in the day of thy power, in the beauties of holiness from the womb of the morning: thou hast the dew of thy youth.

verses.name: Psalms 110:4
verses.text: The Lord hath sworn, and will not repent, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.

verses.name: Psalms 110:5
verses.text: The Lord at thy right hand shall strike through kings in the day of his wrath.

verses.name: Psalms 110:6
verses.text: He shall judge among the heathen, he shall fill the places with the dead bodies; he shall wound the heads over many countries.

verses.name: Psalms 110:7
verses.text: He shall drink of the brook in the way: therefore shall he lift up the head.

verses.name: Psalms 111:1
verses.text: Praise ye the Lord. I will praise the Lord with my whole heart, in the assembly of the upright, and in the congregation.

verses.name: Psalms 111:2
verses.text: The works of the Lord are great, sought out of all them that have pleasure therein.

verses.name: Psalms 111:3
verses.text: His work is honourable and glorious: and his righteousness endureth for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 111:4
verses.text: He hath made his wonderful works to be remembered: the Lord is gracious and full of compassion.

verses.name: Psalms 111:5
verses.text: He hath given meat unto them that fear him: he will ever be mindful of his covenant.

verses.name: Psalms 111:6
verses.text: He hath shewed his people the power of his works, that he may give them the heritage of the heathen.

verses.name: Psalms 111:7
verses.text: The works of his hands are verity and judgment; all his commandments are sure.

verses.name: Psalms 111:8
verses.text: They stand fast for ever and ever, and are done in truth and uprightness.

verses.name: Psalms 111:9
verses.text: He sent redemption unto his people: he hath commanded his covenant for ever: holy and reverend is his name.

verses.name: Psalms 111:10
verses.text: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom: a good understanding have all they that do his commandments: his praise endureth for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 112:1
verses.text: Praise ye the Lord. Blessed is the man that feareth the Lord, that delighteth greatly in his commandments.

verses.name: Psalms 112:2
verses.text: His seed shall be mighty upon earth: the generation of the upright shall be blessed.

verses.name: Psalms 112:3
verses.text: Wealth and riches shall be in his house: and his righteousness endureth for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 112:4
verses.text: Unto the upright there ariseth light in the darkness: he is gracious, and full of compassion, and righteous.

verses.name: Psalms 112:5
verses.text: A good man sheweth favour, and lendeth: he will guide his affairs with discretion.

verses.name: Psalms 112:6
verses.text: Surely he shall not be moved for ever: the righteous shall be in everlasting remembrance.

verses.name: Psalms 112:7
verses.text: He shall not be afraid of evil tidings: his heart is fixed, trusting in the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 112:8
verses.text: His heart is established, he shall not be afraid, until he see his desire upon his enemies.

verses.name: Psalms 112:9
verses.text: He hath dispersed, he hath given to the poor; his righteousness endureth for ever; his horn shall be exalted with honour.

verses.name: Psalms 112:10
verses.text: The wicked shall see it, and be grieved; he shall gnash with his teeth, and melt away: the desire of the wicked shall perish.

verses.name: Psalms 113:1
verses.text: Praise ye the Lord. Praise, O ye servants of the Lord, praise the name of the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 113:2
verses.text: Blessed be the name of the Lord from this time forth and for evermore.

verses.name: Psalms 113:3
verses.text: From the rising of the sun unto the going down of the same the Lord’s name is to be praised.

verses.name: Psalms 113:4
verses.text: The Lord is high above all nations, and his glory above the heavens.

verses.name: Psalms 113:5
verses.text: Who is like unto the Lord our God, who dwelleth on high,

verses.name: Psalms 113:6
verses.text: Who humbleth himself to behold the things that are in heaven, and in the earth!

verses.name: Psalms 113:7
verses.text: He raiseth up the poor out of the dust, and lifteth the needy out of the dunghill;

verses.name: Psalms 113:8
verses.text: That he may set him with princes, even with the princes of his people.

verses.name: Psalms 113:9
verses.text: He maketh the barren woman to keep house, and to be a joyful mother of children. Praise ye the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 114:1
verses.text: When Israel went out of Egypt, the house of Jacob from a people of strange language;

verses.name: Psalms 114:2
verses.text: Judah was his sanctuary, and Israel his dominion.

verses.name: Psalms 114:3
verses.text: The sea saw it, and fled: Jordan was driven back.

verses.name: Psalms 114:4
verses.text: The mountains skipped like rams, and the little hills like lambs.

verses.name: Psalms 114:5
verses.text: What ailed thee, O thou sea, that thou fleddest? thou Jordan, that thou wast driven back?

verses.name: Psalms 114:6
verses.text: Ye mountains, that ye skipped like rams; and ye little hills, like lambs?

verses.name: Psalms 114:7
verses.text: Tremble, thou earth, at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the God of Jacob;

verses.name: Psalms 114:8
verses.text: Which turned the rock into a standing water, the flint into a fountain of waters.

verses.name: Psalms 115:1
verses.text: Not unto us, O Lord, not unto us, but unto thy name give glory, for thy mercy, and for thy truth’s sake.

verses.name: Psalms 115:2
verses.text: Wherefore should the heathen say, Where is now their God?

verses.name: Psalms 115:3
verses.text: But our God is in the heavens: he hath done whatsoever he hath pleased.

verses.name: Psalms 115:4
verses.text: Their idols are silver and gold, the work of men’s hands.

verses.name: Psalms 115:5
verses.text: They have mouths, but they speak not: eyes have they, but they see not:

verses.name: Psalms 115:6
verses.text: They have ears, but they hear not: noses have they, but they smell not:

verses.name: Psalms 115:7
verses.text: They have hands, but they handle not: feet have they, but they walk not: neither speak they through their throat.

verses.name: Psalms 115:8
verses.text: They that make them are like unto them; so is every one that trusteth in them.

verses.name: Psalms 115:9
verses.text: O Israel, trust thou in the Lord: he is their help and their shield.

verses.name: Psalms 115:10
verses.text: O house of Aaron, trust in the Lord: he is their help and their shield.

verses.name: Psalms 115:11
verses.text: Ye that fear the Lord, trust in the Lord: he is their help and their shield.

verses.name: Psalms 115:12
verses.text: The Lord hath been mindful of us: he will bless us; he will bless the house of Israel; he will bless the house of Aaron.

verses.name: Psalms 115:13
verses.text: He will bless them that fear the Lord, both small and great.

verses.name: Psalms 115:14
verses.text: The Lord shall increase you more and more, you and your children.

verses.name: Psalms 115:15
verses.text: Ye are blessed of the Lord which made heaven and earth.

verses.name: Psalms 115:16
verses.text: The heaven, even the heavens, are the Lord’s: but the earth hath he given to the children of men.

verses.name: Psalms 115:17
verses.text: The dead praise not the Lord, neither any that go down into silence.

verses.name: Psalms 115:18
verses.text: But we will bless the Lord from this time forth and for evermore. Praise the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 116:1
verses.text: I love the Lord, because he hath heard my voice and my supplications.

verses.name: Psalms 116:2
verses.text: Because he hath inclined his ear unto me, therefore will I call upon him as long as I live.

verses.name: Psalms 116:3
verses.text: The sorrows of death compassed me, and the pains of hell gat hold upon me: I found trouble and sorrow.

verses.name: Psalms 116:4
verses.text: Then called I upon the name of the Lord; O Lord, I beseech thee, deliver my soul.

verses.name: Psalms 116:5
verses.text: Gracious is the Lord, and righteous; yea, our God is merciful.

verses.name: Psalms 116:6
verses.text: The Lord preserveth the simple: I was brought low, and he helped me.

verses.name: Psalms 116:7
verses.text: Return unto thy rest, O my soul; for the Lord hath dealt bountifully with thee.

verses.name: Psalms 116:8
verses.text: For thou hast delivered my soul from death, mine eyes from tears, and my feet from falling.

verses.name: Psalms 116:9
verses.text: I will walk before the Lord in the land of the living.

verses.name: Psalms 116:10
verses.text: I believed, therefore have I spoken: I was greatly afflicted:

verses.name: Psalms 116:11
verses.text: I said in my haste, All men are liars.

verses.name: Psalms 116:12
verses.text: What shall I render unto the Lord for all his benefits toward me?

verses.name: Psalms 116:13
verses.text: I will take the cup of salvation, and call upon the name of the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 116:14
verses.text: I will pay my vows unto the Lord now in the presence of all his people.

verses.name: Psalms 116:15
verses.text: Precious in the sight of the Lord is the death of his saints.

verses.name: Psalms 116:16
verses.text: O Lord, truly I am thy servant; I am thy servant, and the son of thine handmaid: thou hast loosed my bonds.

verses.name: Psalms 116:17
verses.text: I will offer to thee the sacrifice of thanksgiving, and will call upon the name of the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 116:18
verses.text: I will pay my vows unto the Lord now in the presence of all his people,

verses.name: Psalms 116:19
verses.text: In the courts of the Lord’s house, in the midst of thee, O Jerusalem. Praise ye the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 117:1
verses.text: O praise the Lord, all ye nations: praise him, all ye people.

verses.name: Psalms 117:2
verses.text: For his merciful kindness is great toward us: and the truth of the Lord endureth for ever. Praise ye the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 118:1
verses.text: O give thanks unto the Lord; for he is good: because his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 118:2
verses.text: Let Israel now say, that his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 118:3
verses.text: Let the house of Aaron now say, that his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 118:4
verses.text: Let them now that fear the Lord say, that his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 118:5
verses.text: I called upon the Lord in distress: the Lord answered me, and set me in a large place.

verses.name: Psalms 118:6
verses.text: The Lord is on my side; I will not fear: what can man do unto me?

verses.name: Psalms 118:7
verses.text: The Lord taketh my part with them that help me: therefore shall I see my desire upon them that hate me.

verses.name: Psalms 118:8
verses.text: It is better to trust in the Lord than to put confidence in man.

verses.name: Psalms 118:9
verses.text: It is better to trust in the Lord than to put confidence in princes.

verses.name: Psalms 118:10
verses.text: All nations compassed me about: but in the name of the Lord will I destroy them.

verses.name: Psalms 118:11
verses.text: They compassed me about; yea, they compassed me about: but in the name of the Lord I will destroy them.

verses.name: Psalms 118:12
verses.text: They compassed me about like bees; they are quenched as the fire of thorns: for in the name of the Lord I will destroy them.

verses.name: Psalms 118:13
verses.text: Thou hast thrust sore at me that I might fall: but the Lord helped me.

verses.name: Psalms 118:14
verses.text: The Lord is my strength and song, and is become my salvation.

verses.name: Psalms 118:15
verses.text: The voice of rejoicing and salvation is in the tabernacles of the righteous: the right hand of the Lord doeth valiantly.

verses.name: Psalms 118:16
verses.text: The right hand of the Lord is exalted: the right hand of the Lord doeth valiantly.

verses.name: Psalms 118:17
verses.text: I shall not die, but live, and declare the works of the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 118:18
verses.text: The Lord hath chastened me sore: but he hath not given me over unto death.

verses.name: Psalms 118:19
verses.text: Open to me the gates of righteousness: I will go into them, and I will praise the Lord:

verses.name: Psalms 118:20
verses.text: This gate of the Lord, into which the righteous shall enter.

verses.name: Psalms 118:21
verses.text: I will praise thee: for thou hast heard me, and art become my salvation.

verses.name: Psalms 118:22
verses.text: The stone which the builders refused is become the head stone of the corner.

verses.name: Psalms 118:23
verses.text: This is the Lord’s doing; it is marvellous in our eyes.

verses.name: Psalms 118:24
verses.text: This is the day which the Lord hath made; we will rejoice and be glad in it.

verses.name: Psalms 118:25
verses.text: Save now, I beseech thee, O Lord: O Lord, I beseech thee, send now prosperity.

verses.name: Psalms 118:26
verses.text: Blessed be he that cometh in the name of the Lord: we have blessed you out of the house of the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 118:27
verses.text: God is the Lord, which hath shewed us light: bind the sacrifice with cords, even unto the horns of the altar.

verses.name: Psalms 118:28
verses.text: Thou art my God, and I will praise thee: thou art my God, I will exalt thee.

verses.name: Psalms 118:29
verses.text: O give thanks unto the Lord; for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 119:1
verses.text: Blessed are the undefiled in the way, who walk in the law of the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 119:2
verses.text: Blessed are they that keep his testimonies, and that seek him with the whole heart.

verses.name: Psalms 119:3
verses.text: They also do no iniquity: they walk in his ways.

verses.name: Psalms 119:4
verses.text: Thou hast commanded us to keep thy precepts diligently.

verses.name: Psalms 119:5
verses.text: O that my ways were directed to keep thy statutes!

verses.name: Psalms 119:6
verses.text: Then shall I not be ashamed, when I have respect unto all thy commandments.

verses.name: Psalms 119:7
verses.text: I will praise thee with uprightness of heart, when I shall have learned thy righteous judgments.

verses.name: Psalms 119:8
verses.text: I will keep thy statutes: O forsake me not utterly.

verses.name: Psalms 119:9
verses.text: Wherewithal shall a young man cleanse his way? by taking heed thereto according to thy word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:10
verses.text: With my whole heart have I sought thee: O let me not wander from thy commandments.

verses.name: Psalms 119:11
verses.text: Thy word have I hid in mine heart, that I might not sin against thee.

verses.name: Psalms 119:12
verses.text: Blessed art thou, O Lord: teach me thy statutes.

verses.name: Psalms 119:13
verses.text: With my lips have I declared all the judgments of thy mouth.

verses.name: Psalms 119:14
verses.text: I have rejoiced in the way of thy testimonies, as much as in all riches.

verses.name: Psalms 119:15
verses.text: I will meditate in thy precepts, and have respect unto thy ways.

verses.name: Psalms 119:16
verses.text: I will delight myself in thy statutes: I will not forget thy word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:17
verses.text: Deal bountifully with thy servant, that I may live, and keep thy word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:18
verses.text: Open thou mine eyes, that I may behold wondrous things out of thy law.

verses.name: Psalms 119:19
verses.text: I am a stranger in the earth: hide not thy commandments from me.

verses.name: Psalms 119:20
verses.text: My soul breaketh for the longing that it hath unto thy judgments at all times.

verses.name: Psalms 119:21
verses.text: Thou hast rebuked the proud that are cursed, which do err from thy commandments.

verses.name: Psalms 119:22
verses.text: Remove from me reproach and contempt; for I have kept thy testimonies.

verses.name: Psalms 119:23
verses.text: Princes also did sit and speak against me: but thy servant did meditate in thy statutes.

verses.name: Psalms 119:24
verses.text: Thy testimonies also are my delight and my counsellors.

verses.name: Psalms 119:25
verses.text: My soul cleaveth unto the dust: quicken thou me according to thy word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:26
verses.text: I have declared my ways, and thou heardest me: teach me thy statutes.

verses.name: Psalms 119:27
verses.text: Make me to understand the way of thy precepts: so shall I talk of thy wondrous works.

verses.name: Psalms 119:28
verses.text: My soul melteth for heaviness: strengthen thou me according unto thy word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:29
verses.text: Remove from me the way of lying: and grant me thy law graciously.

verses.name: Psalms 119:30
verses.text: I have chosen the way of truth: thy judgments have I laid before me.

verses.name: Psalms 119:31
verses.text: I have stuck unto thy testimonies: O Lord, put me not to shame.

verses.name: Psalms 119:32
verses.text: I will run the way of thy commandments, when thou shalt enlarge my heart.

verses.name: Psalms 119:33
verses.text: Teach me, O Lord, the way of thy statutes; and I shall keep it unto the end.

verses.name: Psalms 119:34
verses.text: Give me understanding, and I shall keep thy law; yea, I shall observe it with my whole heart.

verses.name: Psalms 119:35
verses.text: Make me to go in the path of thy commandments; for therein do I delight.

verses.name: Psalms 119:36
verses.text: Incline my heart unto thy testimonies, and not to covetousness.

verses.name: Psalms 119:37
verses.text: Turn away mine eyes from beholding vanity; and quicken thou me in thy way.

verses.name: Psalms 119:38
verses.text: Stablish thy word unto thy servant, who is devoted to thy fear.

verses.name: Psalms 119:39
verses.text: Turn away my reproach which I fear: for thy judgments are good.

verses.name: Psalms 119:40
verses.text: Behold, I have longed after thy precepts: quicken me in thy righteousness.

verses.name: Psalms 119:41
verses.text: Let thy mercies come also unto me, O Lord, even thy salvation, according to thy word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:42
verses.text: So shall I have wherewith to answer him that reproacheth me: for I trust in thy word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:43
verses.text: And take not the word of truth utterly out of my mouth; for I have hoped in thy judgments.

verses.name: Psalms 119:44
verses.text: So shall I keep thy law continually for ever and ever.

verses.name: Psalms 119:45
verses.text: And I will walk at liberty: for I seek thy precepts.

verses.name: Psalms 119:46
verses.text: I will speak of thy testimonies also before kings, and will not be ashamed.

verses.name: Psalms 119:47
verses.text: And I will delight myself in thy commandments, which I have loved.

verses.name: Psalms 119:48
verses.text: My hands also will I lift up unto thy commandments, which I have loved; and I will meditate in thy statutes.

verses.name: Psalms 119:49
verses.text: Remember the word unto thy servant, upon which thou hast caused me to hope.

verses.name: Psalms 119:50
verses.text: This is my comfort in my affliction: for thy word hath quickened me.

verses.name: Psalms 119:51
verses.text: The proud have had me greatly in derision: yet have I not declined from thy law.

verses.name: Psalms 119:52
verses.text: I remembered thy judgments of old, O Lord; and have comforted myself.

verses.name: Psalms 119:53
verses.text: Horror hath taken hold upon me because of the wicked that forsake thy law.

verses.name: Psalms 119:54
verses.text: Thy statutes have been my songs in the house of my pilgrimage.

verses.name: Psalms 119:55
verses.text: I have remembered thy name, O Lord, in the night, and have kept thy law.

verses.name: Psalms 119:56
verses.text: This I had, because I kept thy precepts.

verses.name: Psalms 119:57
verses.text: Thou art my portion, O Lord: I have said that I would keep thy words.

verses.name: Psalms 119:58
verses.text: I intreated thy favour with my whole heart: be merciful unto me according to thy word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:59
verses.text: I thought on my ways, and turned my feet unto thy testimonies.

verses.name: Psalms 119:60
verses.text: I made haste, and delayed not to keep thy commandments.

verses.name: Psalms 119:61
verses.text: The bands of the wicked have robbed me: but I have not forgotten thy law.

verses.name: Psalms 119:62
verses.text: At midnight I will rise to give thanks unto thee because of thy righteous judgments.

verses.name: Psalms 119:63
verses.text: I am a companion of all them that fear thee, and of them that keep thy precepts.

verses.name: Psalms 119:64
verses.text: The earth, O Lord, is full of thy mercy: teach me thy statutes.

verses.name: Psalms 119:65
verses.text: Thou hast dealt well with thy servant, O Lord, according unto thy word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:66
verses.text: Teach me good judgment and knowledge: for I have believed thy commandments.

verses.name: Psalms 119:67
verses.text: Before I was afflicted I went astray: but now have I kept thy word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:68
verses.text: Thou art good, and doest good; teach me thy statutes.

verses.name: Psalms 119:69
verses.text: The proud have forged a lie against me: but I will keep thy precepts with my whole heart.

verses.name: Psalms 119:70
verses.text: Their heart is as fat as grease; but I delight in thy law.

verses.name: Psalms 119:71
verses.text: It is good for me that I have been afflicted; that I might learn thy statutes.

verses.name: Psalms 119:72
verses.text: The law of thy mouth is better unto me than thousands of gold and silver.

verses.name: Psalms 119:73
verses.text: Thy hands have made me and fashioned me: give me understanding, that I may learn thy commandments.

verses.name: Psalms 119:74
verses.text: They that fear thee will be glad when they see me; because I have hoped in thy word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:75
verses.text: I know, O Lord, that thy judgments are right, and that thou in faithfulness hast afflicted me.

verses.name: Psalms 119:76
verses.text: Let, I pray thee, thy merciful kindness be for my comfort, according to thy word unto thy servant.

verses.name: Psalms 119:77
verses.text: Let thy tender mercies come unto me, that I may live: for thy law is my delight.

verses.name: Psalms 119:78
verses.text: Let the proud be ashamed; for they dealt perversely with me without a cause: but I will meditate in thy precepts.

verses.name: Psalms 119:79
verses.text: Let those that fear thee turn unto me, and those that have known thy testimonies.

verses.name: Psalms 119:80
verses.text: Let my heart be sound in thy statutes; that I be not ashamed.

verses.name: Psalms 119:81
verses.text: My soul fainteth for thy salvation: but I hope in thy word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:82
verses.text: Mine eyes fail for thy word, saying, When wilt thou comfort me?

verses.name: Psalms 119:83
verses.text: For I am become like a bottle in the smoke; yet do I not forget thy statutes.

verses.name: Psalms 119:84
verses.text: How many are the days of thy servant? when wilt thou execute judgment on them that persecute me?

verses.name: Psalms 119:85
verses.text: The proud have digged pits for me, which are not after thy law.

verses.name: Psalms 119:86
verses.text: All thy commandments are faithful: they persecute me wrongfully; help thou me.

verses.name: Psalms 119:87
verses.text: They had almost consumed me upon earth; but I forsook not thy precepts.

verses.name: Psalms 119:88
verses.text: Quicken me after thy lovingkindness; so shall I keep the testimony of thy mouth.

verses.name: Psalms 119:89
verses.text: For ever, O Lord, thy word is settled in heaven.

verses.name: Psalms 119:90
verses.text: Thy faithfulness is unto all generations: thou hast established the earth, and it abideth.

verses.name: Psalms 119:91
verses.text: They continue this day according to thine ordinances: for all are thy servants.

verses.name: Psalms 119:92
verses.text: Unless thy law had been my delights, I should then have perished in mine affliction.

verses.name: Psalms 119:93
verses.text: I will never forget thy precepts: for with them thou hast quickened me.

verses.name: Psalms 119:94
verses.text: I am thine, save me; for I have sought thy precepts.

verses.name: Psalms 119:95
verses.text: The wicked have waited for me to destroy me: but I will consider thy testimonies.

verses.name: Psalms 119:96
verses.text: I have seen an end of all perfection: but thy commandment is exceeding broad.

verses.name: Psalms 119:97
verses.text: O how love I thy law! it is my meditation all the day.

verses.name: Psalms 119:98
verses.text: Thou through thy commandments hast made me wiser than mine enemies: for they are ever with me.

verses.name: Psalms 119:99
verses.text: I have more understanding than all my teachers: for thy testimonies are my meditation.

verses.name: Psalms 119:100
verses.text: I understand more than the ancients, because I keep thy precepts.

verses.name: Psalms 119:101
verses.text: I have refrained my feet from every evil way, that I might keep thy word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:102
verses.text: I have not departed from thy judgments: for thou hast taught me.

verses.name: Psalms 119:103
verses.text: How sweet are thy words unto my taste! yea, sweeter than honey to my mouth!

verses.name: Psalms 119:104
verses.text: Through thy precepts I get understanding: therefore I hate every false way.

verses.name: Psalms 119:105
verses.text: Thy word is a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path.

verses.name: Psalms 119:106
verses.text: I have sworn, and I will perform it, that I will keep thy righteous judgments.

verses.name: Psalms 119:107
verses.text: I am afflicted very much: quicken me, O Lord, according unto thy word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:108
verses.text: Accept, I beseech thee, the freewill offerings of my mouth, O Lord, and teach me thy judgments.

verses.name: Psalms 119:109
verses.text: My soul is continually in my hand: yet do I not forget thy law.

verses.name: Psalms 119:110
verses.text: The wicked have laid a snare for me: yet I erred not from thy precepts.

verses.name: Psalms 119:111
verses.text: Thy testimonies have I taken as an heritage for ever: for they are the rejoicing of my heart.

verses.name: Psalms 119:112
verses.text: I have inclined mine heart to perform thy statutes alway, even unto the end.

verses.name: Psalms 119:113
verses.text: I hate vain thoughts: but thy law do I love.

verses.name: Psalms 119:114
verses.text: Thou art my hiding place and my shield: I hope in thy word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:115
verses.text: Depart from me, ye evildoers: for I will keep the commandments of my God.

verses.name: Psalms 119:116
verses.text: Uphold me according unto thy word, that I may live: and let me not be ashamed of my hope.

verses.name: Psalms 119:117
verses.text: Hold thou me up, and I shall be safe: and I will have respect unto thy statutes continually.

verses.name: Psalms 119:118
verses.text: Thou hast trodden down all them that err from thy statutes: for their deceit is falsehood.

verses.name: Psalms 119:119
verses.text: Thou puttest away all the wicked of the earth like dross: therefore I love thy testimonies.

verses.name: Psalms 119:120
verses.text: My flesh trembleth for fear of thee; and I am afraid of thy judgments.

verses.name: Psalms 119:121
verses.text: I have done judgment and justice: leave me not to mine oppressors.

verses.name: Psalms 119:122
verses.text: Be surety for thy servant for good: let not the proud oppress me.

verses.name: Psalms 119:123
verses.text: Mine eyes fail for thy salvation, and for the word of thy righteousness.

verses.name: Psalms 119:124
verses.text: Deal with thy servant according unto thy mercy, and teach me thy statutes.

verses.name: Psalms 119:125
verses.text: I am thy servant; give me understanding, that I may know thy testimonies.

verses.name: Psalms 119:126
verses.text: It is time for thee, Lord, to work: for they have made void thy law.

verses.name: Psalms 119:127
verses.text: Therefore I love thy commandments above gold; yea, above fine gold.

verses.name: Psalms 119:128
verses.text: Therefore I esteem all thy precepts concerning all things to be right; and I hate every false way.

verses.name: Psalms 119:129
verses.text: Thy testimonies are wonderful: therefore doth my soul keep them.

verses.name: Psalms 119:130
verses.text: The entrance of thy words giveth light; it giveth understanding unto the simple.

verses.name: Psalms 119:131
verses.text: I opened my mouth, and panted: for I longed for thy commandments.

verses.name: Psalms 119:132
verses.text: Look thou upon me, and be merciful unto me, as thou usest to do unto those that love thy name.

verses.name: Psalms 119:133
verses.text: Order my steps in thy word: and let not any iniquity have dominion over me.

verses.name: Psalms 119:134
verses.text: Deliver me from the oppression of man: so will I keep thy precepts.

verses.name: Psalms 119:135
verses.text: Make thy face to shine upon thy servant; and teach me thy statutes.

verses.name: Psalms 119:136
verses.text: Rivers of waters run down mine eyes, because they keep not thy law.

verses.name: Psalms 119:137
verses.text: Righteous art thou, O Lord, and upright are thy judgments.

verses.name: Psalms 119:138
verses.text: Thy testimonies that thou hast commanded are righteous and very faithful.

verses.name: Psalms 119:139
verses.text: My zeal hath consumed me, because mine enemies have forgotten thy words.

verses.name: Psalms 119:140
verses.text: Thy word is very pure: therefore thy servant loveth it.

verses.name: Psalms 119:141
verses.text: I am small and despised: yet do not I forget thy precepts.

verses.name: Psalms 119:142
verses.text: Thy righteousness is an everlasting righteousness, and thy law is the truth.

verses.name: Psalms 119:143
verses.text: Trouble and anguish have taken hold on me: yet thy commandments are my delights.

verses.name: Psalms 119:144
verses.text: The righteousness of thy testimonies is everlasting: give me understanding, and I shall live.

verses.name: Psalms 119:145
verses.text: I cried with my whole heart; hear me, O Lord: I will keep thy statutes.

verses.name: Psalms 119:146
verses.text: I cried unto thee; save me, and I shall keep thy testimonies.

verses.name: Psalms 119:147
verses.text: I prevented the dawning of the morning, and cried: I hoped in thy word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:148
verses.text: Mine eyes prevent the night watches, that I might meditate in thy word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:149
verses.text: Hear my voice according unto thy lovingkindness: O Lord, quicken me according to thy judgment.

verses.name: Psalms 119:150
verses.text: They draw nigh that follow after mischief: they are far from thy law.

verses.name: Psalms 119:151
verses.text: Thou art near, O Lord; and all thy commandments are truth.

verses.name: Psalms 119:152
verses.text: Concerning thy testimonies, I have known of old that thou hast founded them for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 119:153
verses.text: Consider mine affliction, and deliver me: for I do not forget thy law.

verses.name: Psalms 119:154
verses.text: Plead my cause, and deliver me: quicken me according to thy word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:155
verses.text: Salvation is far from the wicked: for they seek not thy statutes.

verses.name: Psalms 119:156
verses.text: Great are thy tender mercies, O Lord: quicken me according to thy judgments.

verses.name: Psalms 119:157
verses.text: Many are my persecutors and mine enemies; yet do I not decline from thy testimonies.

verses.name: Psalms 119:158
verses.text: I beheld the transgressors, and was grieved; because they kept not thy word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:159
verses.text: Consider how I love thy precepts: quicken me, O Lord, according to thy lovingkindness.

verses.name: Psalms 119:160
verses.text: Thy word is true from the beginning: and every one of thy righteous judgments endureth for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 119:161
verses.text: Princes have persecuted me without a cause: but my heart standeth in awe of thy word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:162
verses.text: I rejoice at thy word, as one that findeth great spoil.

verses.name: Psalms 119:163
verses.text: I hate and abhor lying: but thy law do I love.

verses.name: Psalms 119:164
verses.text: Seven times a day do I praise thee because of thy righteous judgments.

verses.name: Psalms 119:165
verses.text: Great peace have they which love thy law: and nothing shall offend them.

verses.name: Psalms 119:166
verses.text: Lord, I have hoped for thy salvation, and done thy commandments.

verses.name: Psalms 119:167
verses.text: My soul hath kept thy testimonies; and I love them exceedingly.

verses.name: Psalms 119:168
verses.text: I have kept thy precepts and thy testimonies: for all my ways are before thee.

verses.name: Psalms 119:169
verses.text: Let my cry come near before thee, O Lord: give me understanding according to thy word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:170
verses.text: Let my supplication come before thee: deliver me according to thy word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:171
verses.text: My lips shall utter praise, when thou hast taught me thy statutes.

verses.name: Psalms 119:172
verses.text: My tongue shall speak of thy word: for all thy commandments are righteousness.

verses.name: Psalms 119:173
verses.text: Let thine hand help me; for I have chosen thy precepts.

verses.name: Psalms 119:174
verses.text: I have longed for thy salvation, O Lord; and thy law is my delight.

verses.name: Psalms 119:175
verses.text: Let my soul live, and it shall praise thee; and let thy judgments help me.

verses.name: Psalms 119:176
verses.text: I have gone astray like a lost sheep; seek thy servant; for I do not forget thy commandments.

verses.name: Psalms 120:1
verses.text: In my distress I cried unto the Lord, and he heard me.

verses.name: Psalms 120:2
verses.text: Deliver my soul, O Lord, from lying lips, and from a deceitful tongue.

verses.name: Psalms 120:3
verses.text: What shall be given unto thee? or what shall be done unto thee, thou false tongue?

verses.name: Psalms 120:4
verses.text: Sharp arrows of the mighty, with coals of juniper.

verses.name: Psalms 120:5
verses.text: Woe is me, that I sojourn in Mesech, that I dwell in the tents of Kedar!

verses.name: Psalms 120:6
verses.text: My soul hath long dwelt with him that hateth peace.

verses.name: Psalms 120:7
verses.text: I am for peace: but when I speak, they are for war.

verses.name: Psalms 121:1
verses.text: I will lift up mine eyes unto the hills, from whence cometh my help.

verses.name: Psalms 121:2
verses.text: My help cometh from the Lord, which made heaven and earth.

verses.name: Psalms 121:3
verses.text: He will not suffer thy foot to be moved: he that keepeth thee will not slumber.

verses.name: Psalms 121:4
verses.text: Behold, he that keepeth Israel shall neither slumber nor sleep.

verses.name: Psalms 121:5
verses.text: The Lord is thy keeper: the Lord is thy shade upon thy right hand.

verses.name: Psalms 121:6
verses.text: The sun shall not smite thee by day, nor the moon by night.

verses.name: Psalms 121:7
verses.text: The Lord shall preserve thee from all evil: he shall preserve thy soul.

verses.name: Psalms 121:8
verses.text: The Lord shall preserve thy going out and thy coming in from this time forth, and even for evermore.

verses.name: Psalms 122:1
verses.text: I was glad when they said unto me, Let us go into the house of the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 122:2
verses.text: Our feet shall stand within thy gates, O Jerusalem.

verses.name: Psalms 122:3
verses.text: Jerusalem is builded as a city that is compact together:

verses.name: Psalms 122:4
verses.text: Whither the tribes go up, the tribes of the Lord, unto the testimony of Israel, to give thanks unto the name of the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 122:5
verses.text: For there are set thrones of judgment, the thrones of the house of David.

verses.name: Psalms 122:6
verses.text: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem: they shall prosper that love thee.

verses.name: Psalms 122:7
verses.text: Peace be within thy walls, and prosperity within thy palaces.

verses.name: Psalms 122:8
verses.text: For my brethren and companions’ sakes, I will now say, Peace be within thee.

verses.name: Psalms 122:9
verses.text: Because of the house of the Lord our God I will seek thy good.

verses.name: Psalms 123:1
verses.text: Unto thee lift I up mine eyes, O thou that dwellest in the heavens.

verses.name: Psalms 123:2
verses.text: Behold, as the eyes of servants look unto the hand of their masters, and as the eyes of a maiden unto the hand of her mistress; so our eyes wait upon the Lord our God, until that he have mercy upon us.

verses.name: Psalms 123:3
verses.text: Have mercy upon us, O Lord, have mercy upon us: for we are exceedingly filled with contempt.

verses.name: Psalms 123:4
verses.text: Our soul is exceedingly filled with the scorning of those that are at ease, and with the contempt of the proud.

verses.name: Psalms 124:1
verses.text: If it had not been the Lord who was on our side, now may Israel say;

verses.name: Psalms 124:2
verses.text: If it had not been the Lord who was on our side, when men rose up against us:

verses.name: Psalms 124:3
verses.text: Then they had swallowed us up quick, when their wrath was kindled against us:

verses.name: Psalms 124:4
verses.text: Then the waters had overwhelmed us, the stream had gone over our soul:

verses.name: Psalms 124:5
verses.text: Then the proud waters had gone over our soul.

verses.name: Psalms 124:6
verses.text: Blessed be the Lord, who hath not given us as a prey to their teeth.

verses.name: Psalms 124:7
verses.text: Our soul is escaped as a bird out of the snare of the fowlers: the snare is broken, and we are escaped.

verses.name: Psalms 124:8
verses.text: Our help is in the name of the Lord, who made heaven and earth.

verses.name: Psalms 125:1
verses.text: They that trust in the Lord shall be as mount Zion, which cannot be removed, but abideth for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 125:2
verses.text: As the mountains are round about Jerusalem, so the Lord is round about his people from henceforth even for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 125:3
verses.text: For the rod of the wicked shall not rest upon the lot of the righteous; lest the righteous put forth their hands unto iniquity.

verses.name: Psalms 125:4
verses.text: Do good, O Lord, unto those that be good, and to them that are upright in their hearts.

verses.name: Psalms 125:5
verses.text: As for such as turn aside unto their crooked ways, the Lord shall lead them forth with the workers of iniquity: but peace shall be upon Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 126:1
verses.text: When the Lord turned again the captivity of Zion, we were like them that dream.

verses.name: Psalms 126:2
verses.text: Then was our mouth filled with laughter, and our tongue with singing: then said they among the heathen, The Lord hath done great things for them.

verses.name: Psalms 126:3
verses.text: The Lord hath done great things for us; whereof we are glad.

verses.name: Psalms 126:4
verses.text: Turn again our captivity, O Lord, as the streams in the south.

verses.name: Psalms 126:5
verses.text: They that sow in tears shall reap in joy.

verses.name: Psalms 126:6
verses.text: He that goeth forth and weepeth, bearing precious seed, shall doubtless come again with rejoicing, bringing his sheaves with him.

verses.name: Psalms 127:1
verses.text: Except the Lord build the house, they labour in vain that build it: except the Lord keep the city, the watchman waketh but in vain.

verses.name: Psalms 127:2
verses.text: It is vain for you to rise up early, to sit up late, to eat the bread of sorrows: for so he giveth his beloved sleep.

verses.name: Psalms 127:3
verses.text: Lo, children are an heritage of the Lord: and the fruit of the womb is his reward.

verses.name: Psalms 127:4
verses.text: As arrows are in the hand of a mighty man; so are children of the youth.

verses.name: Psalms 127:5
verses.text: Happy is the man that hath his quiver full of them: they shall not be ashamed, but they shall speak with the enemies in the gate.

verses.name: Psalms 128:1
verses.text: Blessed is every one that feareth the Lord; that walketh in his ways.

verses.name: Psalms 128:2
verses.text: For thou shalt eat the labour of thine hands: happy shalt thou be, and it shall be well with thee.

verses.name: Psalms 128:3
verses.text: Thy wife shall be as a fruitful vine by the sides of thine house: thy children like olive plants round about thy table.

verses.name: Psalms 128:4
verses.text: Behold, that thus shall the man be blessed that feareth the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 128:5
verses.text: The Lord shall bless thee out of Zion: and thou shalt see the good of Jerusalem all the days of thy life.

verses.name: Psalms 128:6
verses.text: Yea, thou shalt see thy children’s children, and peace upon Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 129:1
verses.text: Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth, may Israel now say:

verses.name: Psalms 129:2
verses.text: Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth: yet they have not prevailed against me.

verses.name: Psalms 129:3
verses.text: The plowers plowed upon my back: they made long their furrows.

verses.name: Psalms 129:4
verses.text: The Lord is righteous: he hath cut asunder the cords of the wicked.

verses.name: Psalms 129:5
verses.text: Let them all be confounded and turned back that hate Zion.

verses.name: Psalms 129:6
verses.text: Let them be as the grass upon the housetops, which withereth afore it groweth up:

verses.name: Psalms 129:7
verses.text: Wherewith the mower filleth not his hand; nor he that bindeth sheaves his bosom.

verses.name: Psalms 129:8
verses.text: Neither do they which go by say, The blessing of the Lord be upon you: we bless you in the name of the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 130:1
verses.text: Out of the depths have I cried unto thee, O Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 130:2
verses.text: Lord, hear my voice: let thine ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.

verses.name: Psalms 130:3
verses.text: If thou, Lord, shouldest mark iniquities, O Lord, who shall stand?

verses.name: Psalms 130:4
verses.text: But there is forgiveness with thee, that thou mayest be feared.

verses.name: Psalms 130:5
verses.text: I wait for the Lord, my soul doth wait, and in his word do I hope.

verses.name: Psalms 130:6
verses.text: My soul waiteth for the Lord more than they that watch for the morning: I say, more than they that watch for the morning.

verses.name: Psalms 130:7
verses.text: Let Israel hope in the Lord: for with the Lord there is mercy, and with him is plenteous redemption.

verses.name: Psalms 130:8
verses.text: And he shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities.

verses.name: Psalms 131:1
verses.text: Lord, my heart is not haughty, nor mine eyes lofty: neither do I exercise myself in great matters, or in things too high for me.

verses.name: Psalms 131:2
verses.text: Surely I have behaved and quieted myself, as a child that is weaned of his mother: my soul is even as a weaned child.

verses.name: Psalms 131:3
verses.text: Let Israel hope in the Lord from henceforth and for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 132:1
verses.text: Lord, remember David, and all his afflictions:

verses.name: Psalms 132:2
verses.text: How he sware unto the Lord, and vowed unto the mighty God of Jacob;

verses.name: Psalms 132:3
verses.text: Surely I will not come into the tabernacle of my house, nor go up into my bed;

verses.name: Psalms 132:4
verses.text: I will not give sleep to mine eyes, or slumber to mine eyelids,

verses.name: Psalms 132:5
verses.text: Until I find out a place for the Lord, an habitation for the mighty God of Jacob.

verses.name: Psalms 132:6
verses.text: Lo, we heard of it at Ephratah: we found it in the fields of the wood.

verses.name: Psalms 132:7
verses.text: We will go into his tabernacles: we will worship at his footstool.

verses.name: Psalms 132:8
verses.text: Arise, O Lord, into thy rest; thou, and the ark of thy strength.

verses.name: Psalms 132:9
verses.text: Let thy priests be clothed with righteousness; and let thy saints shout for joy.

verses.name: Psalms 132:10
verses.text: For thy servant David’s sake turn not away the face of thine anointed.

verses.name: Psalms 132:11
verses.text: The Lord hath sworn in truth unto David; he will not turn from it; Of the fruit of thy body will I set upon thy throne.

verses.name: Psalms 132:12
verses.text: If thy children will keep my covenant and my testimony that I shall teach them, their children shall also sit upon thy throne for evermore.

verses.name: Psalms 132:13
verses.text: For the Lord hath chosen Zion; he hath desired it for his habitation.

verses.name: Psalms 132:14
verses.text: This is my rest for ever: here will I dwell; for I have desired it.

verses.name: Psalms 132:15
verses.text: I will abundantly bless her provision: I will satisfy her poor with bread.

verses.name: Psalms 132:16
verses.text: I will also clothe her priests with salvation: and her saints shall shout aloud for joy.

verses.name: Psalms 132:17
verses.text: There will I make the horn of David to bud: I have ordained a lamp for mine anointed.

verses.name: Psalms 132:18
verses.text: His enemies will I clothe with shame: but upon himself shall his crown flourish.

verses.name: Psalms 133:1
verses.text: Behold, how good and how pleasant it is for brethren to dwell together in unity!

verses.name: Psalms 133:2
verses.text: It is like the precious ointment upon the head, that ran down upon the beard, even Aaron’s beard: that went down to the skirts of his garments;

verses.name: Psalms 133:3
verses.text: As the dew of Hermon, and as the dew that descended upon the mountains of Zion: for there the Lord commanded the blessing, even life for evermore.

verses.name: Psalms 134:1
verses.text: Behold, bless ye the Lord, all ye servants of the Lord, which by night stand in the house of the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 134:2
verses.text: Lift up your hands in the sanctuary, and bless the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 134:3
verses.text: The Lord that made heaven and earth bless thee out of Zion.

verses.name: Psalms 135:1
verses.text: Praise ye the Lord. Praise ye the name of the Lord; praise him, O ye servants of the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 135:2
verses.text: Ye that stand in the house of the Lord, in the courts of the house of our God,

verses.name: Psalms 135:3
verses.text: Praise the Lord; for the Lord is good: sing praises unto his name; for it is pleasant.

verses.name: Psalms 135:4
verses.text: For the Lord hath chosen Jacob unto himself, and Israel for his peculiar treasure.

verses.name: Psalms 135:5
verses.text: For I know that the Lord is great, and that our Lord is above all gods.

verses.name: Psalms 135:6
verses.text: Whatsoever the Lord pleased, that did he in heaven, and in earth, in the seas, and all deep places.

verses.name: Psalms 135:7
verses.text: He causeth the vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth; he maketh lightnings for the rain; he bringeth the wind out of his treasuries.

verses.name: Psalms 135:8
verses.text: Who smote the firstborn of Egypt, both of man and beast.

verses.name: Psalms 135:9
verses.text: Who sent tokens and wonders into the midst of thee, O Egypt, upon Pharaoh, and upon all his servants.

verses.name: Psalms 135:10
verses.text: Who smote great nations, and slew mighty kings;

verses.name: Psalms 135:11
verses.text: Sihon king of the Amorites, and Og king of Bashan, and all the kingdoms of Canaan:

verses.name: Psalms 135:12
verses.text: And gave their land for an heritage, an heritage unto Israel his people.

verses.name: Psalms 135:13
verses.text: Thy name, O Lord, endureth for ever; and thy memorial, O Lord, throughout all generations.

verses.name: Psalms 135:14
verses.text: For the Lord will judge his people, and he will repent himself concerning his servants.

verses.name: Psalms 135:15
verses.text: The idols of the heathen are silver and gold, the work of men’s hands.

verses.name: Psalms 135:16
verses.text: They have mouths, but they speak not; eyes have they, but they see not;

verses.name: Psalms 135:17
verses.text: They have ears, but they hear not; neither is there any breath in their mouths.

verses.name: Psalms 135:18
verses.text: They that make them are like unto them: so is every one that trusteth in them.

verses.name: Psalms 135:19
verses.text: Bless the Lord, O house of Israel: bless the Lord, O house of Aaron:

verses.name: Psalms 135:20
verses.text: Bless the Lord, O house of Levi: ye that fear the Lord, bless the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 135:21
verses.text: Blessed be the Lord out of Zion, which dwelleth at Jerusalem. Praise ye the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 136:1
verses.text: O give thanks unto the Lord; for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:2
verses.text: O give thanks unto the God of gods: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:3
verses.text: O give thanks to the Lord of lords: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:4
verses.text: To him who alone doeth great wonders: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:5
verses.text: To him that by wisdom made the heavens: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:6
verses.text: To him that stretched out the earth above the waters: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:7
verses.text: To him that made great lights: for his mercy endureth for ever:

verses.name: Psalms 136:8
verses.text: The sun to rule by day: for his mercy endureth for ever:

verses.name: Psalms 136:9
verses.text: The moon and stars to rule by night: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:10
verses.text: To him that smote Egypt in their firstborn: for his mercy endureth for ever:

verses.name: Psalms 136:11
verses.text: And brought out Israel from among them: for his mercy endureth for ever:

verses.name: Psalms 136:12
verses.text: With a strong hand, and with a stretched out arm: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:13
verses.text: To him which divided the Red sea into parts: for his mercy endureth for ever:

verses.name: Psalms 136:14
verses.text: And made Israel to pass through the midst of it: for his mercy endureth for ever:

verses.name: Psalms 136:15
verses.text: But overthrew Pharaoh and his host in the Red sea: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:16
verses.text: To him which led his people through the wilderness: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:17
verses.text: To him which smote great kings: for his mercy endureth for ever:

verses.name: Psalms 136:18
verses.text: And slew famous kings: for his mercy endureth for ever:

verses.name: Psalms 136:19
verses.text: Sihon king of the Amorites: for his mercy endureth for ever:

verses.name: Psalms 136:20
verses.text: And Og the king of Bashan: for his mercy endureth for ever:

verses.name: Psalms 136:21
verses.text: And gave their land for an heritage: for his mercy endureth for ever:

verses.name: Psalms 136:22
verses.text: Even an heritage unto Israel his servant: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:23
verses.text: Who remembered us in our low estate: for his mercy endureth for ever:

verses.name: Psalms 136:24
verses.text: And hath redeemed us from our enemies: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:25
verses.text: Who giveth food to all flesh: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:26
verses.text: O give thanks unto the God of heaven: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 137:1
verses.text: By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down, yea, we wept, when we remembered Zion.

verses.name: Psalms 137:2
verses.text: We hanged our harps upon the willows in the midst thereof.

verses.name: Psalms 137:3
verses.text: For there they that carried us away captive required of us a song; and they that wasted us required of us mirth, saying, Sing us one of the songs of Zion.

verses.name: Psalms 137:4
verses.text: How shall we sing the Lord’s song in a strange land?

verses.name: Psalms 137:5
verses.text: If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, let my right hand forget her cunning.

verses.name: Psalms 137:6
verses.text: If I do not remember thee, let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth; if I prefer not Jerusalem above my chief joy.

verses.name: Psalms 137:7
verses.text: Remember, O Lord, the children of Edom in the day of Jerusalem; who said, Rase it, rase it, even to the foundation thereof.

verses.name: Psalms 137:8
verses.text: O daughter of Babylon, who art to be destroyed; happy shall he be, that rewardeth thee as thou hast served us.

verses.name: Psalms 137:9
verses.text: Happy shall he be, that taketh and dasheth thy little ones against the stones.

verses.name: Psalms 138:1
verses.text: I will praise thee with my whole heart: before the gods will I sing praise unto thee.

verses.name: Psalms 138:2
verses.text: I will worship toward thy holy temple, and praise thy name for thy lovingkindness and for thy truth: for thou hast magnified thy word above all thy name.

verses.name: Psalms 138:3
verses.text: In the day when I cried thou answeredst me, and strengthenedst me with strength in my soul.

verses.name: Psalms 138:4
verses.text: All the kings of the earth shall praise thee, O Lord, when they hear the words of thy mouth.

verses.name: Psalms 138:5
verses.text: Yea, they shall sing in the ways of the Lord: for great is the glory of the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 138:6
verses.text: Though the Lord be high, yet hath he respect unto the lowly: but the proud he knoweth afar off.

verses.name: Psalms 138:7
verses.text: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, thou wilt revive me: thou shalt stretch forth thine hand against the wrath of mine enemies, and thy right hand shall save me.

verses.name: Psalms 138:8
verses.text: The Lord will perfect that which concerneth me: thy mercy, O Lord, endureth for ever: forsake not the works of thine own hands.

verses.name: Psalms 139:1
verses.text: O Lord, thou hast searched me, and known me.

verses.name: Psalms 139:2
verses.text: Thou knowest my downsitting and mine uprising, thou understandest my thought afar off.

verses.name: Psalms 139:3
verses.text: Thou compassest my path and my lying down, and art acquainted with all my ways.

verses.name: Psalms 139:4
verses.text: For there is not a word in my tongue, but, lo, O Lord, thou knowest it altogether.

verses.name: Psalms 139:5
verses.text: Thou hast beset me behind and before, and laid thine hand upon me.

verses.name: Psalms 139:6
verses.text: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me; it is high, I cannot attain unto it.

verses.name: Psalms 139:7
verses.text: Whither shall I go from thy spirit? or whither shall I flee from thy presence?

verses.name: Psalms 139:8
verses.text: If I ascend up into heaven, thou art there: if I make my bed in hell, behold, thou art there.

verses.name: Psalms 139:9
verses.text: If I take the wings of the morning, and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea;

verses.name: Psalms 139:10
verses.text: Even there shall thy hand lead me, and thy right hand shall hold me.

verses.name: Psalms 139:11
verses.text: If I say, Surely the darkness shall cover me; even the night shall be light about me.

verses.name: Psalms 139:12
verses.text: Yea, the darkness hideth not from thee; but the night shineth as the day: the darkness and the light are both alike to thee.

verses.name: Psalms 139:13
verses.text: For thou hast possessed my reins: thou hast covered me in my mother’s womb.

verses.name: Psalms 139:14
verses.text: I will praise thee; for I am fearfully and wonderfully made: marvellous are thy works; and that my soul knoweth right well.

verses.name: Psalms 139:15
verses.text: My substance was not hid from thee, when I was made in secret, and curiously wrought in the lowest parts of the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 139:16
verses.text: Thine eyes did see my substance, yet being unperfect; and in thy book all my members were written, which in continuance were fashioned, when as yet there was none of them.

verses.name: Psalms 139:17
verses.text: How precious also are thy thoughts unto me, O God! how great is the sum of them!

verses.name: Psalms 139:18
verses.text: If I should count them, they are more in number than the sand: when I awake, I am still with thee.

verses.name: Psalms 139:19
verses.text: Surely thou wilt slay the wicked, O God: depart from me therefore, ye bloody men.

verses.name: Psalms 139:20
verses.text: For they speak against thee wickedly, and thine enemies take thy name in vain.

verses.name: Psalms 139:21
verses.text: Do not I hate them, O Lord, that hate thee? and am not I grieved with those that rise up against thee?

verses.name: Psalms 139:22
verses.text: I hate them with perfect hatred: I count them mine enemies.

verses.name: Psalms 139:23
verses.text: Search me, O God, and know my heart: try me, and know my thoughts:

verses.name: Psalms 139:24
verses.text: And see if there be any wicked way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting.

verses.name: Psalms 140:1
verses.text: Deliver me, O Lord, from the evil man: preserve me from the violent man;

verses.name: Psalms 140:2
verses.text: Which imagine mischiefs in their heart; continually are they gathered together for war.

verses.name: Psalms 140:3
verses.text: They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent; adders’ poison is under their lips. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 140:4
verses.text: Keep me, O Lord, from the hands of the wicked; preserve me from the violent man; who have purposed to overthrow my goings.

verses.name: Psalms 140:5
verses.text: The proud have hid a snare for me, and cords; they have spread a net by the wayside; they have set gins for me. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 140:6
verses.text: I said unto the Lord, Thou art my God: hear the voice of my supplications, O Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 140:7
verses.text: O God the Lord, the strength of my salvation, thou hast covered my head in the day of battle.

verses.name: Psalms 140:8
verses.text: Grant not, O Lord, the desires of the wicked: further not his wicked device; lest they exalt themselves. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 140:9
verses.text: As for the head of those that compass me about, let the mischief of their own lips cover them.

verses.name: Psalms 140:10
verses.text: Let burning coals fall upon them: let them be cast into the fire; into deep pits, that they rise not up again.

verses.name: Psalms 140:11
verses.text: Let not an evil speaker be established in the earth: evil shall hunt the violent man to overthrow him.

verses.name: Psalms 140:12
verses.text: I know that the Lord will maintain the cause of the afflicted, and the right of the poor.

verses.name: Psalms 140:13
verses.text: Surely the righteous shall give thanks unto thy name: the upright shall dwell in thy presence.

verses.name: Psalms 141:1
verses.text: Lord, I cry unto thee: make haste unto me; give ear unto my voice, when I cry unto thee.

verses.name: Psalms 141:2
verses.text: Let my prayer be set forth before thee as incense; and the lifting up of my hands as the evening sacrifice.

verses.name: Psalms 141:3
verses.text: Set a watch, O Lord, before my mouth; keep the door of my lips.

verses.name: Psalms 141:4
verses.text: Incline not my heart to any evil thing, to practise wicked works with men that work iniquity: and let me not eat of their dainties.

verses.name: Psalms 141:5
verses.text: Let the righteous smite me; it shall be a kindness: and let him reprove me; it shall be an excellent oil, which shall not break my head: for yet my prayer also shall be in their calamities.

verses.name: Psalms 141:6
verses.text: When their judges are overthrown in stony places, they shall hear my words; for they are sweet.

verses.name: Psalms 141:7
verses.text: Our bones are scattered at the grave’s mouth, as when one cutteth and cleaveth wood upon the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 141:8
verses.text: But mine eyes are unto thee, O God the Lord: in thee is my trust; leave not my soul destitute.

verses.name: Psalms 141:9
verses.text: Keep me from the snares which they have laid for me, and the gins of the workers of iniquity.

verses.name: Psalms 141:10
verses.text: Let the wicked fall into their own nets, whilst that I withal escape.

verses.name: Psalms 142:1
verses.text: I cried unto the Lord with my voice; with my voice unto the Lord did I make my supplication.

verses.name: Psalms 142:2
verses.text: I poured out my complaint before him; I shewed before him my trouble.

verses.name: Psalms 142:3
verses.text: When my spirit was overwhelmed within me, then thou knewest my path. In the way wherein I walked have they privily laid a snare for me.

verses.name: Psalms 142:4
verses.text: I looked on my right hand, and beheld, but there was no man that would know me: refuge failed me; no man cared for my soul.

verses.name: Psalms 142:5
verses.text: I cried unto thee, O Lord: I said, Thou art my refuge and my portion in the land of the living.

verses.name: Psalms 142:6
verses.text: Attend unto my cry; for I am brought very low: deliver me from my persecutors; for they are stronger than I.

verses.name: Psalms 142:7
verses.text: Bring my soul out of prison, that I may praise thy name: the righteous shall compass me about; for thou shalt deal bountifully with me.

verses.name: Psalms 143:1
verses.text: Hear my prayer, O Lord, give ear to my supplications: in thy faithfulness answer me, and in thy righteousness.

verses.name: Psalms 143:2
verses.text: And enter not into judgment with thy servant: for in thy sight shall no man living be justified.

verses.name: Psalms 143:3
verses.text: For the enemy hath persecuted my soul; he hath smitten my life down to the ground; he hath made me to dwell in darkness, as those that have been long dead.

verses.name: Psalms 143:4
verses.text: Therefore is my spirit overwhelmed within me; my heart within me is desolate.

verses.name: Psalms 143:5
verses.text: I remember the days of old; I meditate on all thy works; I muse on the work of thy hands.

verses.name: Psalms 143:6
verses.text: I stretch forth my hands unto thee: my soul thirsteth after thee, as a thirsty land. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 143:7
verses.text: Hear me speedily, O Lord: my spirit faileth: hide not thy face from me, lest I be like unto them that go down into the pit.

verses.name: Psalms 143:8
verses.text: Cause me to hear thy lovingkindness in the morning; for in thee do I trust: cause me to know the way wherein I should walk; for I lift up my soul unto thee.

verses.name: Psalms 143:9
verses.text: Deliver me, O Lord, from mine enemies: I flee unto thee to hide me.

verses.name: Psalms 143:10
verses.text: Teach me to do thy will; for thou art my God: thy spirit is good; lead me into the land of uprightness.

verses.name: Psalms 143:11
verses.text: Quicken me, O Lord, for thy name’s sake: for thy righteousness’ sake bring my soul out of trouble.

verses.name: Psalms 143:12
verses.text: And of thy mercy cut off mine enemies, and destroy all them that afflict my soul: for I am thy servant.

verses.name: Psalms 144:1
verses.text: Blessed be the Lord my strength, which teacheth my hands to war, and my fingers to fight:

verses.name: Psalms 144:2
verses.text: My goodness, and my fortress; my high tower, and my deliverer; my shield, and he in whom I trust; who subdueth my people under me.

verses.name: Psalms 144:3
verses.text: Lord, what is man, that thou takest knowledge of him! or the son of man, that thou makest account of him!

verses.name: Psalms 144:4
verses.text: Man is like to vanity: his days are as a shadow that passeth away.

verses.name: Psalms 144:5
verses.text: Bow thy heavens, O Lord, and come down: touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.

verses.name: Psalms 144:6
verses.text: Cast forth lightning, and scatter them: shoot out thine arrows, and destroy them.

verses.name: Psalms 144:7
verses.text: Send thine hand from above; rid me, and deliver me out of great waters, from the hand of strange children;

verses.name: Psalms 144:8
verses.text: Whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood.

verses.name: Psalms 144:9
verses.text: I will sing a new song unto thee, O God: upon a psaltery and an instrument of ten strings will I sing praises unto thee.

verses.name: Psalms 144:10
verses.text: It is he that giveth salvation unto kings: who delivereth David his servant from the hurtful sword.

verses.name: Psalms 144:11
verses.text: Rid me, and deliver me from the hand of strange children, whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood:

verses.name: Psalms 144:12
verses.text: That our sons may be as plants grown up in their youth; that our daughters may be as corner stones, polished after the similitude of a palace:

verses.name: Psalms 144:13
verses.text: That our garners may be full, affording all manner of store: that our sheep may bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our streets:

verses.name: Psalms 144:14
verses.text: That our oxen may be strong to labour; that there be no breaking in, nor going out; that there be no complaining in our streets.

verses.name: Psalms 144:15
verses.text: Happy is that people, that is in such a case: yea, happy is that people, whose God is the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 145:1
verses.text: I will extol thee, my God, O king; and I will bless thy name for ever and ever.

verses.name: Psalms 145:2
verses.text: Every day will I bless thee; and I will praise thy name for ever and ever.

verses.name: Psalms 145:3
verses.text: Great is the Lord, and greatly to be praised; and his greatness is unsearchable.

verses.name: Psalms 145:4
verses.text: One generation shall praise thy works to another, and shall declare thy mighty acts.

verses.name: Psalms 145:5
verses.text: I will speak of the glorious honour of thy majesty, and of thy wondrous works.

verses.name: Psalms 145:6
verses.text: And men shall speak of the might of thy terrible acts: and I will declare thy greatness.

verses.name: Psalms 145:7
verses.text: They shall abundantly utter the memory of thy great goodness, and shall sing of thy righteousness.

verses.name: Psalms 145:8
verses.text: The Lord is gracious, and full of compassion; slow to anger, and of great mercy.

verses.name: Psalms 145:9
verses.text: The Lord is good to all: and his tender mercies are over all his works.

verses.name: Psalms 145:10
verses.text: All thy works shall praise thee, O Lord; and thy saints shall bless thee.

verses.name: Psalms 145:11
verses.text: They shall speak of the glory of thy kingdom, and talk of thy power;

verses.name: Psalms 145:12
verses.text: To make known to the sons of men his mighty acts, and the glorious majesty of his kingdom.

verses.name: Psalms 145:13
verses.text: Thy kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and thy dominion endureth throughout all generations.

verses.name: Psalms 145:14
verses.text: The Lord upholdeth all that fall, and raiseth up all those that be bowed down.

verses.name: Psalms 145:15
verses.text: The eyes of all wait upon thee; and thou givest them their meat in due season.

verses.name: Psalms 145:16
verses.text: Thou openest thine hand, and satisfiest the desire of every living thing.

verses.name: Psalms 145:17
verses.text: The Lord is righteous in all his ways, and holy in all his works.

verses.name: Psalms 145:18
verses.text: The Lord is nigh unto all them that call upon him, to all that call upon him in truth.

verses.name: Psalms 145:19
verses.text: He will fulfil the desire of them that fear him: he also will hear their cry, and will save them.

verses.name: Psalms 145:20
verses.text: The Lord preserveth all them that love him: but all the wicked will he destroy.

verses.name: Psalms 145:21
verses.text: My mouth shall speak the praise of the Lord: and let all flesh bless his holy name for ever and ever.

verses.name: Psalms 146:1
verses.text: Praise ye the Lord. Praise the Lord, O my soul.

verses.name: Psalms 146:2
verses.text: While I live will I praise the Lord: I will sing praises unto my God while I have any being.

verses.name: Psalms 146:3
verses.text: Put not your trust in princes, nor in the son of man, in whom there is no help.

verses.name: Psalms 146:4
verses.text: His breath goeth forth, he returneth to his earth; in that very day his thoughts perish.

verses.name: Psalms 146:5
verses.text: Happy is he that hath the God of Jacob for his help, whose hope is in the Lord his God:

verses.name: Psalms 146:6
verses.text: Which made heaven, and earth, the sea, and all that therein is: which keepeth truth for ever:

verses.name: Psalms 146:7
verses.text: Which executeth judgment for the oppressed: which giveth food to the hungry. The Lord looseth the prisoners:

verses.name: Psalms 146:8
verses.text: The Lord openeth the eyes of the blind: the Lord raiseth them that are bowed down: the Lord loveth the righteous:

verses.name: Psalms 146:9
verses.text: The Lord preserveth the strangers; he relieveth the fatherless and widow: but the way of the wicked he turneth upside down.

verses.name: Psalms 146:10
verses.text: The Lord shall reign for ever, even thy God, O Zion, unto all generations. Praise ye the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 147:1
verses.text: Praise ye the Lord: for it is good to sing praises unto our God; for it is pleasant; and praise is comely.

verses.name: Psalms 147:2
verses.text: The Lord doth build up Jerusalem: he gathereth together the outcasts of Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 147:3
verses.text: He healeth the broken in heart, and bindeth up their wounds.

verses.name: Psalms 147:4
verses.text: He telleth the number of the stars; he calleth them all by their names.

verses.name: Psalms 147:5
verses.text: Great is our Lord, and of great power: his understanding is infinite.

verses.name: Psalms 147:6
verses.text: The Lord lifteth up the meek: he casteth the wicked down to the ground.

verses.name: Psalms 147:7
verses.text: Sing unto the Lord with thanksgiving; sing praise upon the harp unto our God:

verses.name: Psalms 147:8
verses.text: Who covereth the heaven with clouds, who prepareth rain for the earth, who maketh grass to grow upon the mountains.

verses.name: Psalms 147:9
verses.text: He giveth to the beast his food, and to the young ravens which cry.

verses.name: Psalms 147:10
verses.text: He delighteth not in the strength of the horse: he taketh not pleasure in the legs of a man.

verses.name: Psalms 147:11
verses.text: The Lord taketh pleasure in them that fear him, in those that hope in his mercy.

verses.name: Psalms 147:12
verses.text: Praise the Lord, O Jerusalem; praise thy God, O Zion.

verses.name: Psalms 147:13
verses.text: For he hath strengthened the bars of thy gates; he hath blessed thy children within thee.

verses.name: Psalms 147:14
verses.text: He maketh peace in thy borders, and filleth thee with the finest of the wheat.

verses.name: Psalms 147:15
verses.text: He sendeth forth his commandment upon earth: his word runneth very swiftly.

verses.name: Psalms 147:16
verses.text: He giveth snow like wool: he scattereth the hoarfrost like ashes.

verses.name: Psalms 147:17
verses.text: He casteth forth his ice like morsels: who can stand before his cold?

verses.name: Psalms 147:18
verses.text: He sendeth out his word, and melteth them: he causeth his wind to blow, and the waters flow.

verses.name: Psalms 147:19
verses.text: He sheweth his word unto Jacob, his statutes and his judgments unto Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 147:20
verses.text: He hath not dealt so with any nation: and as for his judgments, they have not known them. Praise ye the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 148:1
verses.text: Praise ye the Lord. Praise ye the Lord from the heavens: praise him in the heights.

verses.name: Psalms 148:2
verses.text: Praise ye him, all his angels: praise ye him, all his hosts.

verses.name: Psalms 148:3
verses.text: Praise ye him, sun and moon: praise him, all ye stars of light.

verses.name: Psalms 148:4
verses.text: Praise him, ye heavens of heavens, and ye waters that be above the heavens.

verses.name: Psalms 148:5
verses.text: Let them praise the name of the Lord: for he commanded, and they were created.

verses.name: Psalms 148:6
verses.text: He hath also stablished them for ever and ever: he hath made a decree which shall not pass.

verses.name: Psalms 148:7
verses.text: Praise the Lord from the earth, ye dragons, and all deeps:

verses.name: Psalms 148:8
verses.text: Fire, and hail; snow, and vapour; stormy wind fulfilling his word:

verses.name: Psalms 148:9
verses.text: Mountains, and all hills; fruitful trees, and all cedars:

verses.name: Psalms 148:10
verses.text: Beasts, and all cattle; creeping things, and flying fowl:

verses.name: Psalms 148:11
verses.text: Kings of the earth, and all people; princes, and all judges of the earth:

verses.name: Psalms 148:12
verses.text: Both young men, and maidens; old men, and children:

verses.name: Psalms 148:13
verses.text: Let them praise the name of the Lord: for his name alone is excellent; his glory is above the earth and heaven.

verses.name: Psalms 148:14
verses.text: He also exalteth the horn of his people, the praise of all his saints; even of the children of Israel, a people near unto him. Praise ye the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 149:1
verses.text: Praise ye the Lord. Sing unto the Lord a new song, and his praise in the congregation of saints.

verses.name: Psalms 149:2
verses.text: Let Israel rejoice in him that made him: let the children of Zion be joyful in their King.

verses.name: Psalms 149:3
verses.text: Let them praise his name in the dance: let them sing praises unto him with the timbrel and harp.

verses.name: Psalms 149:4
verses.text: For the Lord taketh pleasure in his people: he will beautify the meek with salvation.

verses.name: Psalms 149:5
verses.text: Let the saints be joyful in glory: let them sing aloud upon their beds.

verses.name: Psalms 149:6
verses.text: Let the high praises of God be in their mouth, and a twoedged sword in their hand;

verses.name: Psalms 149:7
verses.text: To execute vengeance upon the heathen, and punishments upon the people;

verses.name: Psalms 149:8
verses.text: To bind their kings with chains, and their nobles with fetters of iron;

verses.name: Psalms 149:9
verses.text: To execute upon them the judgment written: this honour have all his saints. Praise ye the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 150:1
verses.text: Praise ye the Lord. Praise God in his sanctuary: praise him in the firmament of his power.

verses.name: Psalms 150:2
verses.text: Praise him for his mighty acts: praise him according to his excellent greatness.

verses.name: Psalms 150:3
verses.text: Praise him with the sound of the trumpet: praise him with the psaltery and harp.

verses.name: Psalms 150:4
verses.text: Praise him with the timbrel and dance: praise him with stringed instruments and organs.

verses.name: Psalms 150:5
verses.text: Praise him upon the loud cymbals: praise him upon the high sounding cymbals.

verses.name: Psalms 150:6
verses.text: Let every thing that hath breath praise the Lord. Praise ye the Lord.
